loans.name: Zoila Licinda

texts.en:
Zoila Licinda C. M. sells regional food in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She makes dishes such as juane, caldo, steak, and escaveche. She has many loyal clients that come to visit her stand in the Bellavista market. She also sells bananas and coal when she has enough capital.

Zoila is 45 years old, has six children, and is divorced. She works very hard, and four of her children still depend on her. She loves to cook and build relationships, and she has many loyal customers.

A member of the community bank Las Abejitas, Zoila is requesting a loan of $550 to repay over four months. She will use the loan to buy all the ingredients used to make her delicious meals.

loans.use: To buy all the ingredients used to make her delicious meals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timbers to fix the walls to improve the living condition.

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: M. Malik is 54 years old. He is married and has three children. Malik’s wife is a housekeeper. Almost all of his children are married and have their own children except his younger son. Malik is working hard as he is the only bread-winner in the family. Already for 2 years he is selling the blankets and underclothes in the local market “Somon-bozor”. This market is very popular among the population because of his attractive prices that is why Malik has a lot of clients. Malik’s goods are supplied from the neighboring town Istaravshan by himself. He tries to choose various goods of good quality and attractive prices which allows him keeping the clientele. The business brings the stable income and allows Malik to improve the living conditions for his family and thus he is accumulating money for arranging the marriage of his younger son. Today Malik requests 600 $ US Dollars for purchasing the blankets and underclothes in order to increase the range of goods. Malik would like to thank everybody for supporting him and promises that he will repay the loan in 12 months promptly. The progress of Malik’s business is on your hands. Your support will really help him.

loans.use: To upgrade stock and improve sales

loans.name: Oyekola

texts.en: Oyekola M. owns a fish farm (pond). She learned this business  for 3 months and she started her own fish pond 2 years ago. Oyekola M. is 43 years old and married with 4 children. She needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy more fingerlings (small fish). This will increase her production and thereby increase her profit margin by having more fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy more fingerlings (small fish)

loans.name: Lamina

texts.en: Lamina (her brother is pictured) is a widow with the one child. She was born in 1946. The Aliyev's family lives in Baku city, Mashtaga settlement. Lamina has been in the dairy business for 6 years. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Futari's Tuaminiane Group

texts.en:
Futari is 32 years old. She is widow with 2 children aged 6 and 3 years old. She runs her own phone accessories shop and she has been a charcoal seller since 2003. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Futari now hopes for a loan to buy more phone accessories and charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Naeshe.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories and charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
El centro focal de Villa tejada  esta ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto, a este pertenece la asociación “Las Palmeras”  que trabajan con mucha responsabilidad en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
Cuentan que carecen de servicios básicos ya que viven en alquiler en pequeños ambientes que no cuentan con agua potable, tampoco con gas domiciliario, por lo que deben abastecerse de piletas públicas y garrafas de distribución.
La actividad principal de este grupo es la confección de ropa que luego las venden en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Quieren ampliar su producción y vender en otras feria de la ciudad, por lo que necesitan comprar  materia prima en mayor cantidad, con esto obtener mayores ganancias que les permita ahorrar para poder alquilar ambientes cómodos para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of "The Palm Trees" work in the focal center of the city of El Alto with a lot of responsibility to fulfill their financial obligations and business activities. They are without basic services at home because they live in small rental units with no running water or gas, so they stock up at public fountains and fuel distribution centers. The main activity of this group is making clothes, which they then sell at the July 16th Market in El Alto. They want to increase their production and sell at other markets in the city, so they need larger quantities of raw matterials (thread, cloth, etc.). With this, they can generate more earnings, allowing them to save so they can rent more comfortable dwellings for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials (thread, cloth, etc.) to increase their production

loans.name: Jina

texts.en:
Jina has been selling dresses and fabric in Zanzibar for one year. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $85 each month through her sales. She is now requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can expand her inventory and increase her sales.

Jina is 23 years old, married, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy fabric and dresses

loans.name: Suun

texts.ru: Базаров Суюн житель района Вахш. Возраст 39 лет, женат, имеет четверых детей. Имеет среднее образование. Всю жизнь занимается разведением и продажей крупно рогатого скота. Откармливает бычков для продажи мясникам на мясо. Он своим делом обеспечивает качественным мясом. Для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота планирует получить кредит и купить еще одного бычка. Откормив его он сможет заработать деньги. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Suun B. lives in the Bakhsh district. He is 39 years old, married, and has four children. He has a secondary education. Suun has raised and sold cattle his whole life. He finishes bull calves for sale to butchers for meat. His work always results in high quality meat. To increase his number of cattle he decided to take out a loan and buy one more calf. Raising it will earn him money. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Maria R. cuento con mi propio negocio de costura el cual manejo hace varios años,  tengo muchos clientes, tambien hago ropa para caballero solo camisas, para damas hago de todo tipo de ropa, mi taller es pequeño y tengo la ayuda de una prima con la mano de obra, yo necesito un credito para poder comprar una maquina de cocer industrial para mejorar la calidad de mi trabajo ya que las exigencias de mis clientes son muchas, asi tendre mayores ventas y por ende mayores ingresos. soy madre soltea y tengo un hijo de cuatro años de edad el cual solo depende de mi, nosotros vivimos con mi familia ya que es muy dificil alquilar o comprar una casa, deseo tener una oportunidad para poder salir adelante con mi hijo.
texts.en:
Hi my name is Maria R.. I have my own sewing business which I have managed for several years. I have many customers. I also make clothing; for men, I only sell shirts, and for ladies, I make all types of clothing. My studio is small, and my cousin assists me with work. I need a credit to buy an industrial sewing machine to improve the quality of my work to meet the many demands of my clients. This will increase sales and therefore increase revenues. I am a single mother, and I have a four-year-old son who depends on me. We live with my family as it is very difficult to rent or purchase a house. I hope for the opportunity to give my son a good education in life.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Anna S. from Dar es Salaam. She is widowed with one child who is 14 years old. Anna has been running a tailoring equipment business since 2002. Her business is to sell tailoring equipment to people conducting tailoring business.  She works at the business for 10 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Anna currently earns about 400 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 525 USD in order to purchase additional stock of equipment. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Anna thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of tailoring equipment.

loans.name: Armida

texts.es: Armida A. D. P., es una señora D. 47 años D. edad, la cuál trabaja D. manera ambulante para poder comercializar sus productos tales como licras, shorts y todo lo relacionado con ropa interior. Ella trabaja diariamente para poder costear la alimentación y estudios D. su hijo D. 17 años D. edad y su nieto D. 7 años, los cuales depenD. únicamente D. lo que ella logra obtener D. sus ganancias. Ya que Armida es la única fuente D. ingresos para su familia, ella solicita un préstamo y D. esta manera, poder aumentar su mercadería y variedad D. productos, D. modo que pueda obtener mayores ganancias durante la temporada seca, debido a que en la temporada lluviosa se le dificulta poder salir a las calles y vender sus productos, es por ellos que su deseo más granD. es ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Armida A. D. P. is 47 years old. She works in traveling sales, selling all types of undergarments. Armida works every day in order to earn enough to cover the food and school fees for her 17 year old son and her 7 year old grandson, who depend on her earnings. Armida is the only source of income for her family, and she is asking for a loan to increase her merchandise and expand the variety of her products. In this way she'll be able to obtain better earnings during the dry season, because during the rainy season it is difficult for her to travel the streets. Armida would like to expand her business and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more and newer merchandise.

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.ru: Шерова Нозигуль жительница города Вахдат. Возраст 43 года, замужем и имеет пятерых детей.. Уже 12 лет занимается торговлей детской одежды. Имеет потребность в кредите для того, чтобы привезти товар к весне.Это поможет ей увеличить товарооборот и обеспечить себя и население товаром. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nozigul S. lives in the town of Vakhdat. She is 43 years old and is married with five children. For the past 12 years she has been selling children's clothing. She would like to receive a loan in order to supply more goods ahead of the spring season. This would help her increase cash flow and provide goods for herself and her fellow residents. She would be able to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to supply goods for the spring season

loans.name: Sisters In Business Group

texts.en:
David (left) is the leader of this group. He is fifty years of age. He was born in Yele Sanda village, four miles from Makeni City in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and the two have eight children. Four of his children are in secondary school, three in primary school and one is still sucking. He has been a businessman for over twenty years now.

David sells market food. He sells pepper and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil). With this new loan, he will expand on his business. He will be able to buy about four bags of pepper and three barters (five gallons make a barter) of palm-oil. He buys his goods from either the village called Kalamgba or Tambiama. A bag of pepper costs him Le 200,000 and a barter of palm-oil costd him Le 40,000 in either of these villages.

So far, David faces no serious challenge in his business that is worth noting. Business is going fine and smooth. He enjoys what he does for a living. To David and his colleagues in the group, an increase in profit means making their lives better. They will be able to take good care of their children, specifically with their educational and nutritional needs, and save some money for emergencies.

loans.use: To buy four bags of pepper and three barters of palm-oil

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Maribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Victorias”, vive en el Jr. Las Caobas – Santa Rosa, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 42 años y es madre de 02 hijos, todos independientes.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 pudo iniciar su negocio de venta de plásticos.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, ubicada en su misma casa; donde vende a sus clientes y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,800.00 que pagara a un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como bandejas, baldes, vasos de vidrio, platos y tazas  de loza y descartables,  bacines y  productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Es ella quien  toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más sociable, más segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Maribel, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maribel belongs to "Banco Comunal "Las Victorias". She lives in Jr. Las Caobas - Santa Rosa, District of Juanjui, Department of San Martin. She is single, 42 years old and a mother of 2 children, both independent. With the first loan of S/.300.00 she was able to start her business selling plastic items. At the present she continues with the same business located at her house where she sells to clients and friends.

With this loan of S/.1,800.00, to be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in buying more products for her business such as trays, buckets, glasses, china plates and cups as well as disposables, pots, and a variety of products to keep her clients happy. In her business she makes the decisions about the earnings. Personally she tells us she is more sociable, more secure and responsible with the repayments. Maribel is thankful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businesswoman and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastic, glass, and disposable items.

loans.name: Immaculate Nanfuka‘S Group

texts.en:
Immaculate is 38 years of age, married with four children aged between 10 and 16. All her children go to school. She owns a three-roomed house where she is living with six people, and she doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has access to electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Immaculate sells fruits and vegetables in Ndeeba Market, in one of the city suburbs. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work from suppliers who get the goods from villages; that is how she earns her living. Her monthly expenses include rent for her place of work and school fees for her children.

Immaculate sells to all categories of people and works six days week. She has done this business for over four years now This is her twelfth loan since she joined MCDT, and she has been with MCDT for six years, working with the same group mates. Immaculate wants to use this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables right from the farmers and partly to pay school fees for her children She is aspiring of seeing her business growing bigger and owning permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more fruits direct from the farmers

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Lượng Nguyễn Thị (1014060416) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc.  She is married and has two infant children. To making a living, Lượng owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  Lượng has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, Lượng joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lượng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to expand the business.  Lượng is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Lượng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
Alhassan A. is twenty-eight years old. He is married and has three children: two boys and one girl. According to him, all are currently in the primary school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busy business centres in the region. His wife is a food vendor.

Alhassan is a trader. He runs a provision store which he says is by the roadside. He buys his provisions from Kumasi. He has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure provisions in bulk to increase his stock. He is hopeful to expand his business and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Rene Mariana

texts.es:
La señora René Mariana Chávez B. tiene 43 años, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Superior Técnica Completa Secretariado Ejecutivo,   tiene 2 hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
René  se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y a la crianza de pollos, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió  en la compra de productos de belleza como cremas, colonias, champús, lápiz labiales.
El crédito de 1200 soles, lo invertirá en la crianza de pollos para implementar su negocio.
René tiene como sueño  tener su granja para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. René Mariana Chávez B. is 43 years old and lives in the La Esperanza province of Trujillo in La Libertad, Peru. She completed advanced executive secretarial studies and has two children who are both dependents. René sells beauty products and raises chickens for a living; she also works from home. She invested her first loan of 300 soles received from her communal bank “Nueva Esperanza,” in the purchase of beauty products like: creams, perfumes, shampoos, and lipsticks. This loan of 1,200 soles will be invested in raising chickens so she can get this business going. René has a dream of having her own farm so she can grow as a mirco-business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: La crianza de pollos para implementar su negocio.

loans.name: Julisa

texts.es:
La señora Julisa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 37 años, 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Julisa, una mujer que se siente capaz de cumplir sus metas, por lo que decidió implementar su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que se inicio con la venta de  bebidas que los vendía en su misma casa, poco a poco fue ahorrando y juntando su propio capital y con el prestamo de Manuela Ramos implementó su negocio de venta de abarrotes, ubicada en su misma casa y hoy ya tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad, es muy conocida y muy querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Julisa, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarial.
texts.en:
Ms. Julisa C. is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” Microfinance Institute in the Moyobamba district and province, department of San Martin. She is a 37-year-old married mother with 2 children who still depend on her financially. Julisa, a woman who feels capable of reaching her goals, decided to start her own business. She states that she started out by selling beverages from home. Little by little, she kept saving up her own money, and with the loan from Manuela Ramos, she established her general store, located in her house. She is now very experienced in this business, and is well-known and loved by her customers. She currently has faithful customers who frequent her store daily to shop because they can find everything a homemaker needs. She personally attends to her customers with the charm that she is noted for. With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, she will purchase sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, crates of milk, boxes of assorted brands of canned fish, household cleaning tools, and personal hygiene products so that she can continue giving the best customer service. Julisa now feels very fulfilled and has the desire to keep moving forward and making her dreams come true. She gives thanks to Manuela Ramos for helping her to start her own business, as well as for having helped other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Enlarge business premises

loans.name: Xavier

texts.pt:
Xavier P. de 47 anos de idade, natural de Montepuez, província de Cabo delgado, casado é pai de 03 filhos, o primeiro tem 18 anos de idade e é estudante, o segundo com 10 anos de idade também e estudante e o terceiro tem apenas 03 meses de idade, vive na casa própria em Boane e esta a frequentar a 7ª classe, pois havia interrompido os estudos para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório, sustenta a família com ajuda da esposa que e que agente de serviços da EPC-Namaacha.     

Nasceu em Montepuez e em 1987 mudou-se de Montepuez para Maputo pelo serviço militar obrigatório. 

Xavier P. é agente de segurança da empresa(SINER, segurança) afecto na subestação da EDM em Boane há 08 anos, foi formado pela mesma empresa em 2001 e a sua renda mensal e de 2.600,00MT, com o qual e com ajuda da sua esposa sustenta a sua família e consegue poupar para melhorar a sua residência. 

Conheceu a Hluvuku-adsema através da divulgação feita a quando da abertura da sucursal de Boane, este e o quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku, tendo se beneficiado de empréstimos de 9.200,00MT, 10.500,00MT e 13.000,00MT destinados a bens de consumo, comercio e habitação respectivamente, de salientar que tem reembolsado o empréstimo sem problemas. 

Com o empréstimo de 15.000,00MT, pretende comprar cimento, areia e pedra para concluir a sua obra. O seu maior desafio e concluir a obra.
Propõe-se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a outros créditos para mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Xavier P. is 47 years old and is from Montepuez in the Cabo Delgado province. He is married and has 3 children: the oldest is 18 and is a student, the middle child is 10 and is also a student and the youngest is only 3 months old. They live in their own home in Boane and he sometimes attends 7th grade classes. His schooling was interrupted when he had to fulfill his obligatory military service. He maintains his family with his wife’s help, who works as an EPC service agent in Namaacha. He was born in Montepuez and in 1987 he moved to Maputo for his military service. Xavier has been an insurance agent (SINER insurance) at the EDM branch in Boane for the past 8 years. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku. His previous loans were for 9.200,00MT, 10.500,00MT and 13.000,00MT, which he used for basic goods, business and housing needs. All of his loans were repaid without any problems. With this loan of 15.00,00MT he wants to buy cement, sand and rocks to finish his project. His biggest challenge is finishing this project. He pledges to repay the loan without problems, so that he can continue with future loan cycles to improve his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cement, sand and rocks for construction

loans.name: Djamilatou

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et est mère d’un enfant. Elle a ouvert en 2002 une boutique de vente de pagnes de qualité supérieure ; elle vend également des bijoux de très haute valeur. Sa boutique est bien connue de beaucoup de personnes, surtout les femmes d’affaire du secteur privé, les femmes fonctionnaires de l’administration publique. Elle reçoit ses commandes de bijoux de la France. Pour renouveler son stock de pagnes et de bijoux, elle souhaite avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 pagnes Hitarget, 5 pagnes Wax, 10 pagnes Phoenix, et des boîtes de bijou de haute valeur. Sa boutique est située dans le quartier Adidoadin à Lomé.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of one child. In 2002, she opened a boutique selling superior quality "pagnes" (colorful wax cloths). She also sells very valuable jewelry. Her store is well-known by many people, by all of the business women in the private sector and the female civil servants of the government. She receives orders for gems from France. To renew her stock of "pagnes" and jewelry, she is requesting a loan from WAGES (the micro-finance institution). She will use this loan to purchase 15 "Hitarget" brand "pagnes", 5 "Wax" brand "pagnes", 10 "Phoenix" brand "pagnes" and boxes of high-value jewels.

Her shop is located in the neighborhood of Adidoadin, in Lomé.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase high quality "pagnes" (colorful wax cloths) and jewelry

loans.name: Rocío Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rocío del Pilar es una mujer trabajadora, alegre y muy dinámica, tiene 31 años, es  madre de 2 hijos  menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, pero solo para adultos, ofrece   su mercadería  en su casa, ya tiene una buena cartera de clientes que la visitan en su domicilio, esta mercadería la envían desde la ciudad de Lima. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él es mecánico en general. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Laboriosas II”, desde hace tres años. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en los gastos de su hogar y en la apertura de su negocio actual, compró ropa de segunda mano al por mayor. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual invertirá en traer ropa de segunda desde Lima. La meta de Rocío es poder tener una tienda de calzados y también dedicarse a la venta de joyas, de esta manera aportar en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Rocio del Pilar is a hardworking, cheerful, and dynamic woman. She is 31 years old and the mother of two children. Rocio sells used clothing, but only for adults. She offers her merchandise from her home and already has a long list of clients who visit her. The clothing is shipped in from the city of Lima. She has the support of her husband, who is a general mechanic by trade.

Rocio has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Laboriosas II” (The Industrious Ones II) for 3 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used for household expenses and starting her current business of selling secondhand clothing.

With this loan of 1000 soles, she will purchase more used clothing from Lima. Rocio’s goal is to open a shoe store and also sell jewelry so that she can have additional money for household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase secondhand clothing wholesale

loans.name: El Provenir Group

texts.es:
El grupo el provenir esta integrado por  María Gabriela B. D., Sandi de los Santos N. y Martha Lorena R.. Ellas son provenientes del centro de Ticuantepe.
 
María Gabriela B. D. comenzó apoyando a su mamá con la atención de la pulpería, luego empezó a comercializar productos de la Avon desde entonces ha ido invirtiendo en diferentes productos como ropa, perfumes y la venta de fritanga. 

Esta joven de tan solo 21 años ha demostrado ser una gran comerciante y administradora, pero su mayor su ello es poder estudiar y aplicar su conocimientos al negocio.

Las integrantes del grupo son Sandi de los Santos N. de 26 años vende ropa nueva y usada y Martha Lorena R. de 42 años que vende ropa.

loans.use: para comprar granos básicos y chiverias

loans.name: Abdu's Group

texts.en:
Abdu is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is 38 years old and married with four children between the ages of 3 and 15 years old. He also cares for six dependents. Abdu has been a bread vendor in Lugazi for eight years and his business has been mostly affected by the changing seasons as well as bad debts. Amidst all this, Abdu makes 150,000/= a week and this helps him pay school fees for his children and dependents, as well as save for future developments. He ensures that he makes and sells quality bread and this increases his sales. 

Abdu has a dream of expanding his bakery so he can make more bread per day, plus cakes for increased income. He also vies to educate his children to the highest level of learning for self sustainability in the future. At the moment, Abdu needs a loan to help purchase more baking supplies to increase output.

loans.use: Purchase more baking supplies to increase output

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cloth

loans.name: Allah Kan Dèmè Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de cinq  femmes  toutes mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames élargies, les membres de groupe Allah Kan Dèmè ont en moyenne 44 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent dans le quartier Bamanan de Sakoïba (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage, de voisinage  et exercent comme activités génératrices de revenus le commerce d’articles divers.
Après cinq  prêts de groupe tous remboursés sans aucune difficulté, elles sont à leur 6ème  prêt solidaire.
Ce nouveau prêt servira à acheter, 30 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, 27 sacs de charbon de bois,  3 sacs de graines d’arachide, une dizaine de petits seaux en plastiques pour y mettre de la pâte d’arachide. 
Elles s’approvisionnent en bois de chauffe et  charbon de bois sur place, fournis par les exploitants de Zenguela, Soignébougou, Ouassila, Siradoba, et Bougounina ; en graines d’arachide à Konodimini et  au grand marché de Ségou (lors des foires hebdomadaires). 
Les ventes se font à Ségou généralement, de façon fixe, les jours de foire de la ville de Ségou, en ambulant  les jours ordinaires, en détail, au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen mensuel de 23.500 FCFA qui servira à satisfaire certains besoins familiaux,  rembourser les intérêts de prêt et participer aux évènements sociaux
Leur ambition est d’épargner pour acheter des petits ruminants (moutons, chèvres) et quelques bœufs, pour  préparer petit à petit leur avenir et celui  de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Composed of five married women living mostly in extended polygamous families, the members of the group Allah Kan Dèmè average 44 years of age and 6 children each. They live in the Bamanan district of Sakoïba (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, marriage, and community, and they have revenue-generating businesses involving a variety of goods. After five group loans, all repaid without difficulty, they are on their sixth solidarity loan. This new loan will be used to buy 30 cart-loads of firewood, 27 sacks of charcoal, 3 sacks of peanuts, and a dozen plastic buckets in which to put peanut butter. Supplies of firewood and charcoal are gotten locally, furnished by producers from Zenguela, Soignébougou, Ouassila, Siradoba, and Bougounina. Supplies of peanuts are gotten at the big market of Ségou (at the weekly fairs). Sales are made at the retail level in cash or on credit to customers composed of women and men generally in Ségou from a fixed spot at the weekly fairs in Ségou City. On ordinary days, sales are made from place to place. The group members hope to realize an average monthly profit of 23,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet certain family needs, to repay the loan interest, and to assist at societal events. Their ambition is to save money to buy small ruminants (sheep, goats) and a few head of cattle in order to make a future, little by little, for themselves and for their children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods

loans.name: Duke

texts.en:
Duke is 24 years old. His wife is a software developer and they have two young children. Duke runs a grocery store and sells vegetables and mali mali (household items). He's been in business for five years and has one employee. He also occasionally works as a manual laborer or driver for extra income. 

He requested this loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Faulu to purchase the following items:
- 2 crates of tomatoes: 8,000 KES 
- 2 sacks sukuma (kale): 3,000 KES
- 2 sacks charcoal: 3,000 KES
- 50 trays of eggs: 11,000 KES
- 2 sacks of Irish potatoes: 10,000 KES
- mali mali items: 5,000 KES

Duke describes himself as hardworking, focused and willing to grow. Since joining Faulu, he says his business has changed drastically and his vision of the future has changed. In the future, he hopes to continue to expand his businesses and to buy a plot of land for his family.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” desD. hace 5 años atrás, del distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 50 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales uno vive con ella. Estudió primaria incompleta y se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales menores.
Juliana nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  pudo comprar gallinas y ovejas.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrà comprar una oveja cara negra.
Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su alimentación y vivir feliz y tranquila.
Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Juliana has been a member of the "Gregoria Apaza" communal bank in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department, for 5 years now. She is 50 years old, a widow, and has 4 children, one of whom still lives with her. She didn't finish elementary school and she raises small farm animals. Juliana tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement to buy chickens and sheep. She now is requesting 500 new soles with which to buy a black face sheep. Her dream for the future is to improve her diet and to live a happy and peaceful life. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a black face sheep.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Francisco tiene 47 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos: German Ricardo tiene 8 años y Gorki tiene 3 años. El socio Francisco es natural de la ciudad de Urubamba departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

El socio trabaja en construcción civil como albañil. Actualmente esta construyendo una casa de 100 metros cuadrados. El socio y su esposa tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comida y preparan desayuno, almuerzo y cena, hace un mes atrás que abrieron el negocio y les esta yendo muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, verduras y carnes.         
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Francisco is 47 years old, lives with a partner, and has two children, German Ricardo, 8, and Gorki, 3. Francisco is a native of the city of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. He belongs to the Jose Carlos Mariategui Communal Bank of the la Asociación Arariwa. Francisco works in construction as a brick mason. Currently, he is building a house of 100 square meters. He and his wife also have a small business selling food. They prepare breakfast, lunch and dinner. They started the business one month ago and it is going well thanks to the determination they put into their work. Francisco is a hardworking and enterprising father who is helping his family get ahead. He is seeking a loan to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, beans, vegetables, and meats. He is grateful for the opportunity this brings and promises to complete his payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients such as rice, sugar, beans, vegetables, and meats

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Efepania S. is from the village of Caputol. She is 59 years old. Efepania is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Efepania and her husband (in the pictured) owns & operates a motorcycle transport for rent business in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing for rent motorcycle transport to local community members. Efepania has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.In 2000, Efepania joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Efepania has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. 

Efepania is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Efepania from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Ana es casada, tiene 79 años y 1 hija, Ana venD. ropa, frazadas, edredones, sabanas, D. acuerdo a los pedidos D. sus clientes, la mayoría D. sus ventas son al crédito.
Ana necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ropa variada,
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the communal bank called Nueve Era, or New Era. She is 79 years old and married with one daughter. Ana sells clothing, as well as quilts, duvets and bedding depending on the requests of her customers. The majority of her sales are done on credit. Ana needs this loan to purchase a variety of clothing to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing for her customers

loans.name: Tugolokoke Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Eve, in the small photo at the top left also appears in the big group photo and she is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 40 years old and is a hard working lady with four children. She also takes care of her parents. 

Eve is a strong business lady. She has a retail shop and has also been a maize farmer in Kyetume for 20 years. From these businesses, she is able to make 300,000/= as profit. She says that she has been successful because of her good hygiene, customer friendliness plus the favorable prices that attract many customers. 

She hopes to expand both businesses in the future as she is a single parent and has a strong drive to continue educating all her children and to build rental properties for their upkeep. She needs a loan to be able to increase the stock in her retail shop so that her sales can increase.

loans.use: to restock her retail shop

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy C. is from Oroquieta City. He is 29 years old and single. To make a living, Roy offers motor transport services. He has been doing so for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.  Roy joined GDMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He successfully repaid a previous GDMPC loan of 23000 PHP, and is now requesting his third loan, for 12000 PHP, to be used to repair his vehicle for better service.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his business vehicle.

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji Jerisio,32, is married to a husband who is a teacher. They have five children who go to school. Keji has a business selling a local brew and beer and is requesting a loan to purchase crates of beer to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Sriyani

texts.en:
Sriyani is a married woman living with her husband and two children, ages 10 and 5, in the town of Hikkaduwa on the southern coast of Sri Lanka. 

Her husband is a fisherman and Sriyani has requested this loan for his business. They work together as a team, and have done so for the past 15 years. They are both hardworking and active people.  

Sriyani has requested a 25,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help expand her husband's business affairs.  Both of them want to create a bright future for their children.

loans.use: To expand a fishing business

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah K. is a 36 year-old married man living in the South Rift Valley of Kenya, near the town of Litein. He has six children, ranging in age from less than one year to 12 years old. All the children but the youngest are currently attending school. 

Jonah has been running his mixed farm for 18 years now. He previously worked as a tea-plucker for other farmers. He now earns his income selling milk, tea, and maize. He says that lately the main challenges to his business are poor seeds, lack of water from drought and lack of sufficient feed for his livestock.

Jonah has a successful history with Juhudi Kilimo, previously completing a loan of 45,000 KES. He has now requested this loan for 60,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow and improve his overall farm activities. He says that with a good quality dairy cow he can produce enough milk to easily repay the loan and pay his children's school fees.

His main goal for the future is to purchase land and build a modern house for his family. He added, "Loans from Juhudi have helped me to progress because previously I was not able to access any credit."

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Ana Maria tiene su bazar-librería  en la zona de Pampahasi, lleva muchos años con esta actividad, y es muy conocida por la zona, su librería es muy surtida ya que esta cerca de un colegio, por esto tambien tiene su fotocopiadora y plastificadora; ella vive Tambien por la zona con sus hijitos y su esposo, sus hijos están en colegio y su esposo es gerontólogo y trabaja en una institución y particularmente. Es una persona muy reponsable y muy puntual, trabaja hace 4 años aproximadamente con nuestra institución. El crédito será invetido en la compra de paquetes de hojas bond y otros tipos de hojas para la librería. Es una persona muy responsable y dinamica, esta muy agradecida a Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ana Maria owns and runs a bookstore-bazaar in the Pampahasi area; she has been working in this business for a long time and she is well known in the area; her bookshop has a very good assortment, as it is located close to a school, and for this reason she also has a photocopier and a laminating machine. Ana Maria lives in the same area with her young children and her husband: her children are of school age and her husband is a gerontologist working both in an hospital and privately. She is a very responsible and scrupulous woman, who has been working with our institution for about 4 years. The loan will be used to buy reams of Bond paper and other varieties of writing paper for the bookstore. She is a very responsible and dynamic person, and she is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the faith shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy reams of writing paper for her bookstore

loans.name: Nilda Agustina

texts.es:
Nilda de 41 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran  (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución), Nilda para poder solventar su hogar tuvo que viajar a España para buscar las oportunidades que no tenia en su país, por un periodo de 10 años tuvo que trabajar en España para tener el mismo negocio de deposito de madera de su padre. 

Cuando regreso a Ecuador ella compro madera para su negocio, con la guía de su padre obtuvo buenos resultados, ahora ella trabaja de lunes a sábados comprando y vendiendo madera, tiene todo tipo de madera, caña, tablas, guayacán etc. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar tablas y caña para su deposito de madera. 

En el futuro quiere tener otro deposito de madera para expandirse.
texts.en:
Nilda, age 41, lives in Primavera de Duran (the urban perimeter was originally irregular with various hills, creeks, and lakes that are still there even though they appear as the remains of an ecology in dissolution). To support her household Nilda had to travel to Spain. She was looking for opportunities that she did not have in her country. She had to work in Spain for ten years. This was in order for her to have the same business, a lumberyard, as her father. When she returned to Ecuador she bought wood for her business. With her father’s guidance she got good results. She now works Monday through Saturday buying and selling wood. She has all types of wood; cane, planks, and Guayacan, etc. With the loan she will buy planks and cane for her lumberyard. In the future she wants to have another lumberyard in order to expand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planks and cane

loans.name: Tamaraneh V Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Tamaraneh V” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Fatmata I. K. (pictured first row, right) is the leader of this group. The 40-year-old is married and has 4 children – 2 of her children are attending primary school and 2 are attending secondary school. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for five years now; she sells dishes, plates, spoons, cups, bowls, etc. With her share of this loan, Fatmata will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: Buy dishes, plates, spoons, cups, bowls, etc. for resale

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
El grupo Génesis está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Juana del Rosario R. quien tiene una pequeña fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comidas fritas como tajadas con queso, carne asada (gallo pinto, tajadas, ensalada de repollo y carne), pollo asado o frito, tacos, enchiladas…etc. El negocio lo inicio hace 20 años con el cual sus apoyo a sus seis hijos y sigue apoyando a los menores de 20, 18, 17 y 15 años respectivamente quienes colaboran en la fritanga.

R. piensa invertir una parte del préstamo en materia prima para el negocio y otra para comprar cosméticos. El sueño de ella es trabajar con su propio capital para ello trabajara arduamente.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Ángela Rosa R. quien vende tortillas, frijoles, cuajadita y nacatamales desde hace siete años y Juan Manuel F. T. quien se dedica al comercio de corte, perfumes y productos de aseo personal.
texts.en:
The Génesis group is comprised of three hard-working people. Juana del Rosario R. is one of them. She has a small “fritanga”. This is a popular restaurant, which sells fried food like plantain chips with cheese, roasted meat, (“gallos pinto”; which is rice and beans, plantain chips, cabbage salad, and meat) roasted or fried chicken, tacos, and enchiladas, etc. She stared the business 20 years ago. She supported her six children with the business. She continues supporting the younger ones, ages 20, 18, 17, and 15. They help in the fritanga. R. is planning on using part of the loan to buy raw material for her business. She will use the other part to buy cosmetics. Her dream is to work with her own money, and she is working arduously to do so. Ángela Rosa R.; a member of the group; has been selling tortillas, beans, cheese, and nactatamales (a traditional Central American dish similar to tamales) for seven years. The other member, Juan Manuel F. Tiberino, cuts hair and sells perfume and personal hygiene products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic grains, oil, bananas, cabbage, and meat, etc.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie S. is from the city of Rizal Santiago. She is 48 years old. Annie is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Annie owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. The main source of income for the business comes from managing a passengered motorcycle. Annie has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Annie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be Annie's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand the business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia A. is a married woman who lives in San Antonio, Brgy. Kabac, Bantayan, Cebu City. She earns a living by operating 3 business ventures: selling Ready to Wear clothes, farming and pig fattening. Her husband, Sulpicio A. who is 53 years old, works as a farmer and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 8 children who are 15 to 32 years old. 

Apolonia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Apolonia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her to earn a monthly profit of PHP 40,000,  raising her family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use as additional working capital. She can then continue to save up for the future, improve her business and pay her children's tuition fees. Apolonia A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to provide additional working capital

loans.name: Rosa Arcila

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Arcila V. es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive en la comunidad de Zhimbrug que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta parroquia se caracteriza por su gente la que es muy amable y cálida, se dedican a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, este sector tiene un clima frio.
 
La Señora Rosa Arcila es socia del banco comunal hace un año, y ha llegado a tener una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras de la banca comunal, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar de su hijos, también aprovecha el tiempo para criar chanchos, cuyes y gallinas ya que este es su negocio.

Doña Rosa tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 24, 23, 22, 20, 15 y 4 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y estudian en el colegio, su cuarto hijo  estudia en la universidad y también trabaja, su quinta hija estudia en el colegio, su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo su propio bus, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de los útiles escolares de su hija y también para el alimento de sus chanchos.
 
Su meta es tener un kiosco en su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa Arcila V. is a member of the community bank Unión Progresista. She lives in the Zhimbrug community which belongs to the parish of Santa Ana. The parish is characterized by its warm and kind hearted people who work in agriculture and raise animals in a cold climate. Rosa Arcila joined the community bank one year ago, and since then she has formed a great friendship with all of her fellow bank members. She works at home bringing up her children and caring for the house, taking advantage of her time by also raising pigs, guinea pigs and chickens which she uses to run her business. Rosa is 45 years old, married and has six children of 24, 23, 22, 20, 15 and 4 years of age. Her first three children work and study at school, her fourth child studies at university and also works and her 15 year old daughter studies at school. Her husband works as a driver and has his own bus; with his income they have been able to build their own house. Rosa’s loan will go towards purchasing school supplies for her daughter and feed for the pigs. Her dream is to run a kiosk from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies and feed for pigs

loans.name: Tamaraneh Traders Association Group

texts.en: Kadiatu T. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in Makeni city, about 44 years ago. She is married with two children, both of whom are attending secondary school. Kadiatu sells rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc. She has been running this business for countless years. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,400,000) to expand her business. She will buy rice and palm oil at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy rice and palm oil

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine T. is 26 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Siari within the Sindangan municipality, a part of Zamboanga del Norte province on the Mindanao islands. Geraldine runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Geraldine has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Geraldine joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,500 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Geraldine is requesting a new loan, her third from PMPC, of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha P. is from the village of San Isidro, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 44 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $190 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Editha joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Editha is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is currently in the business of selling onions at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of onions to sell. Mary is 30 years old and is married with a husband that is a driver. She has no children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot in Juba.

loans.use: To stock more bags of onions to sell

loans.name: Yesica Janet

texts.es: La Sra. Yesica Janet B. M. es trabajadora Activa de la empresa D.G.I desempeñándose como Analista de Recaudación tiene dos  años de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  cuatro   créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este crédito lo está solicitando para cambiarle el techo a su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Yesica Janet B. M. is currently an employee at a company called D.G.I., in the role of Collections Analyst.  She has been working for this institution for two years.  

She has had four loans with CEPRODEL, and has taken each one in order to buy construction materials to expand and improve her home.  She is requesting this loan in order to replace her roof.

The loans through CEPRODEL have greatly benefited her by allowing her to improve her and her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase zinc, beams, screws and to pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Sophia Wanjiru

texts.en:
Sophia is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She stays in Limuru from where she operates her milk business. This is a middle class town and with a high population. She buys and sells milk to the residents of the place and also supplies to others from the surrounding region. This is her primary business, which she has been doing for the last 13 years. 

She got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member, and she has borrowed from another financial institution before. She is thus well versed with Microfinance Institutions. With this loan she plans to buy high grade cows so that she is able to get more milk to be able to supply to all her customers within the area. Since she will not need to buy the milk from other clients then the milk from her cows will increase the quantity that she sells to her neighbors.

loans.use: Sophia plans to buy a cow which will add the number of liters of milk she sells to her clients.

loans.name: Main Dans La Main Plus Group

texts.en:
Main dans la Main Plus is a group of 17 owners of small businesses chaired by Blandine. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI (Micro-Finance Institution) HOPE DRC to grow their businesses.

Blandine N. is determined to be a successful businesswoman. She operates a general store. She became a microentrepreneur in 2007. She has already received 10 loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory. She will buy items for the store for resale in order to reinforce her working capital and increase the profit. She will seek to make more profit with more goods preferred by her customers.  Blandine is 39 years old, married and the mother of four children aged 6 to 13. All of them attend school. She is also taking care of four children left by her relatives.

loans.use: To purchase items for resale

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: La Sra. Flora vive en el municipio de el Torno,  hace unos 25 años que llego del Departamento de Tarija , nacida en el departamento de Tarija, ella se dedica a la venta de jugos de fruta natural y también a la  elaboración de una variedad de galletas y empanadas que vende junto con los jugos, ella tiene un puesto de venta donde ya muchos de los clientes le visitan por sus deliciosos jugos y empanadas,  su esposo con el cual tiene dos hijos se dedica al transporte de personas(taxi), hace unos 4 años,  el destino del crédito es para aumentar su capital de trabajo e invertir en muebles en su negocio comprando mesas y sillas para dar comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Sra. Flora lives in the town of Torno.  She was born in the "departamento" of Tarija and came to Torno from there some 25 years ago.  She operates a business selling natural fruit juices.  She also makes and sells a variety of empanadas and snacks that she sells with her fruit juices.  She has a stand where her customers come back, time after time, to buy her delicious fruit juices and empanadas.  Sra. Flora's husband, with whom she has two children, has operated a taxi business for 4 years.  She will use this loan to increase her working capital.  She plans to buy tables and chairs for the business so that she can provide a better service to her customers.

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for food business.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 33 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Rolando de 33 años y de sus 2 pequeños hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde muy joven esta dedicada mujer siempre ha laborado en el comercio de diversos artículos, y hace siete  años comercializa productos naturales y también de limpieza. Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes, durante sus ratos libres, y le va muy bien pues lo productos de limpieza los fabrica su hermano y se los vende barato, de esta manera ella puede obtener buenas ganancias de las ventas. Le gusta mucho ofrecer las hierbas naturales, que compra a mayoristas, pues sabe de las bondades curativas de éstos productos. Los días de Liz pasan tranquilos entre el cuidado de sus hijos y su trabajo que no le toma mucho tiempo; y ya esta pensando instalar un negocio de venta de venta de productos de limpieza en un local fijo ya que tiene varios clientes fijos. Es el 20avo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar adelante con su negocio. Liz tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en productos de limpieza, pues quiere abastecerse para el año venidero.
texts.en: Liz, 33 years old, lives in her own house with her husband Rolando, who is 33 years old, and her two small children.  They work hard every day to get ahead.  Since she was very young, this dedicated woman has worked at selling various products and for the last seven years she has been selling natural products and cleaning supplies.  She works from Monday to Friday, during her free time, and she is doing very well because her brother makes the cleaning products and she is able to get them very cheaply and can this way make good profits from her sales.  She likes to sell the natural herbs, which she buys from a wholesaler, because she know that they offer many curative benefits. Her days are quiet, between the care of her children and her work which does not take too much of her time.  She is thinking of opening a store selling cleaning products, now that she has some stable customers.  This is her 20th loan with MFP and she promises to pay her installments on time because she does not want to look bad to all the people that have made her support possible and allow her to continue to get ahead.  Liz is planning to invest this loan in the purchase of cleaning merchandise and supply her business for the upcoming year.

loans.use: Purchase cleaning products to supply her business.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en: The man shown in the picture is Mr. Pho S., 21, a fisherman. He usually needs to take eight hours a day to fish around the river in the village. He catches around five kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers who are retail sellers. His wife’s name is Thy; she is 16 years old and works in the farming business. The young couple is blessed with one young child who is still not enrolled in school. Mr. Pho S. will use his loan to buy a used motorbike for transporting his fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for transporting his fish for sale.

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
El cliente tiene 42 años y radica en el trópico de Cochabamba, desde hace 12 años junto a su esposa e hijos.
Vivía en la ciudad de Cochabamba, ya que sus ingresos eran insuficientes para poder sobrevivir y vio una opción de ir al trópico de Cochabamba, aunque los primeros años fue difícil pero con esmero y muchos esfuerzos y con la ayuda de su familia lograron seguir adelante, trabajo en muchas cosas como peón, en empresas como cocinero, ayudante de albañil, hasta que un día decidió hacer masitas (repostería), poco a poco fue ahorrando y se compró su lote urbano logro construir una casa sencilla.

El crédito que está solicitando es para refaccionar su vivienda y ampliar un poco más, hoy por hoy el señor Cesar trabaja como moto taxista y su negocio de masitas, poco a poco  en el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y así poder sacar adelante a toda  su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is 42 years old and has lived in the tropics of Cochabamba for twelve years with his wife and children. He previously lived in the city of Cochabamba, but his income was not enough to survive so he chose to move to the tropics of Cochabamba. The early years were difficult, but with great care and effort and the help of his family, he was able to move forward. Cesar worked several jobs as a laborer, a chef, and a masonry assistant until one day he decided to make desserts (cakes). He saved up money over time until he bought a lot where he built a modest house.

The loan he is requesting will be used to repair his home and expand it a little more. Today Sr. Cesar works as a motorcycle taxi driver and at his dessert business. Over time, he wants to expand his business in the future so that his entire family can get ahead.

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 31 años, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 9 años de edad, tiene casa propia y es profesor, trabaja en el Instituto Tecnológico hace 4 años, de lunes a viernes de 7:00am a 4:00pm.
Él por el momento se le presentan algunos gastos educativos que no puede cubrir por lo que solicita un préstamo para cubrir estos gastos, este préstamo le ayudara para cancelar una Maestría que desea estudiar y pagar las mensualidades. El seguir estudiando para él es lo mejor pues debe seguir actualizándose para mejorar el desempeño en su trabajo ya que es su sueño, realizarse con una buena profesión para ayudar más a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge resides in El Transito in the Department of San Miguel. He is 31 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and nine year old son. Jorge has been a teacher at the Instituto Tecnológico for four years and works Monday through Friday from 7am to 4pm.

At the moment Jorge has a few educational expenses that he is not able to pay, so he is requesting a loan that will help cover them. The money will be used to pay the monthly tuition toward completing his Master’s degree. Continuing his education is the best way for him to improve his performance at work. It is his dream to become a good professional so that he can further assist his family.

loans.use: Pay his tuition toward completing a Master's degree

loans.name: John Mutwii

texts.en:
John Mutwii S. does carpentry work at Kikomba Market in Kangundo town.  He has been in this business for two years and earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000. He is 32 years old with a wife named Catherine, and they are blessed with one child.

John has never borrowed from any other MFI, and he is applying for his second loan after being introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit Officer.  He  plans to use the loan to buy timber and materials for making chairs and on maintenance for his workshop tools.  

John plans to use the anticipated profit to meet the basic needs of his family. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To buy timber for making chairs and for workshop tool maintenance.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Rosa D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en San  Miguel, vive con su esposo, tiene un taller D. sastrería, este negocio fue fundado por iniciativa propia, hace 6 años, aprendió la confección D. prendas D. vestir en una academia D. corte y confección, trabajo todos los días D. 7:00am a 6:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. telas, hilos, ciper, botones, entre otros materiales que les son necesarios. Esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer el taller D. aquellos materiales que son imprescindibles para el desarrollo D. su trabajo, esperando brindar una mejor atención a los clientes, y generar más utilidades para cubrir sus necesidades y reinvertir en el taller.
El objetivo D. doña Rosa es mantenerse en el negocio que por años le ha dado todo lo necesario para vivir, por tal razón trabaja día con día en  este taller.
texts.en:
Rosa is 60 years old and she lives in San Miguel. She lives with her husband. She has a tailoring shop. This business was started under her own initiative six years ago. She learned to make articles of clothing from a tailoring academy. She works every day from 7am to 6pm. 

She requests a loan to purchase fabrics, threads, zippers, and buttons among other necessary materials. This investment will help her reinforce her shop with those materials that are essential to carry out her work. She hopes to proviD. her clients with better service and to generate a greater income to proviD. for her needs and to reinvest in the shop. 

Rosa's objective is to keep up the same business that for years has provided her with what she needs to live. For this reason she works day after day in this shop.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, zippers, and buttons

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en: Suzanne is 41 years old and lives in the Lawole district of Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. Together with her husband Pascal she looks after their four children, all of whom are schooled. For the past 10 years, Suzanne has sold meals from her stall outside her home. This is her fourth loan with Alidé, following successful past repayments. It will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Adja, a large food market. Her aim is to diversify her business to new products.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel O. is a farmer in his native town of Kisii in South Rift, Kenya. He is married  with two children aged seven and three years.

He has been doing mixed farming for the last eight years, producing tea, maize and beans and selling them to the Kenya Tea Development Authority and the local market. He has two farmhands at his farm. He runs a hotel and a butchery in his local market for additional income.

Daniel has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will provide milk for use in the hotel and help him pay his children's school fees from its additional income. 

In the future, he will be focusing on buying a pick-up to transport his produce to the market.

Daniel says the challenge in farming is a lack of quality dairy breeds and general low produce from the farms. He is full of praise for Juhudi Kilimo for providing agricultural loans to farmers.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Darlinda

texts.en:
Darlinda is a 46-year-old woman. She is married and has five children. One of her children is in school. Darlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Darlinda runs a Sari-sari store in the Philippines. She sells a variety of items such as noodles, salt, sugar, candies, and sardines. Darlinda has been in business for five years. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store.

In the future, Darlinda would like to save enough money that she could send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tututepec Los Maguitos Group

texts.es:
“Tututepec los Manguitos” este grupo se llama así porque existen varios árboles de mangos donde es el punto de reunión de los integrantes y también porque todos pertenecen a la población de Tututepec “Cerro del pájaro”, un lugar muy hermoso con mucha diversidad de flora y fauna. Este grupo esta formado por 11 personas muy trabajadoras que se dedican a diferentes actividades para obtener dinero y así mantener a su familia y son las siguientes: Erud (Herreria-compra de materiales para la elaboración de puertas y ventanas), Zarai, Reyna y Yesica (Venta de cosméticos y Tupper Ware), Lourdes (Venta de pescados), Carlos (Servcio de Taxi), Minerva y Gloria (Venta de antojitos), Maribel y Balbina (Venta de tamales y pozole), Antonio (Cultivo de limón).            
Minerva es una mujer que a sabido enfrentar la vida y luchar para salir adelante, ella a trabajado duro cada día para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que desde hace varios años se divorcio de su esposo y desde entonces inicio con el negocio de antojitos; actividad que le ah ayudado a mantener a sus hijos y darles educación, tiene 3 hijos los cuales 2 trabajan y la ayudan con los gastos económicos solo tiene a 1 estudiando por el cual se esfuerza mas para darle una carrera y tenga mejores oportunidades el día de mañana, ella tiene un pequeño negocio que se encuentra ubicado en el centro de la población en el cual vende antojitos como son: sopes, tostadas, enchiladas y quesadillas, ella solicito el crédito para comprar mas productos para la elaboración de sus antojitos como son: tomate, chiles, cebollas, queso, pollo, carne de res, entre otros ya que son sus ingredientes principales.
