Ella comenta que actualmente le va bien en su negocio, tiene varios clientes ya que la mayoría de la población la conoce por lo rico que guisa, además de que el lugar donde vende es muy transitable. Su desafío que enfrenta es la competencia ya que hay varios puestos de comida en ese lugar pero ella casi no se preocupa ya que ella dice “que Dios le da para todos” y que “para todos sale el sol”, ella le agradece a Dios porque nunca le ha hecho falta alimentación y siempre le ha dado la fuerza para salir adelante con todo.
Minerva comenta que su mas grande sueño es remodelar su casa es por ello que de las ganancias que obtiene esta haciendo unos ahorritos para iniciar con su sueño.
Todos lo integrantes de este grupo agradecen por el préstamo otorgado ya que gracias a ello podrán invertir más en su negocio y así obtener más ganancias para solventar los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called “Tututepec los Manguitos” because there are several mango trees at the place where the group meets and because they all belong to the town of Tututepec “Hill of the Bird,” a very beautiful place with much variety of flora and fauna. 

The group has 11 very hard working members who are in a variety of different activities:  Erud (metal shop; purchases materials to make doors and windows), Zaray, Reyna and Yesica (Tupperware and cosmetics sales), Lourdes (fish sales), Carlos (taxi services), Minerva and Gloria (fast food sales), Maribel and Balbina (tamale and pozole sales) and Antonio (lemon farmer).

Minerva is a woman who has known how to face life and fight to get ahead.  She’s worked hard every day to support her children because for many years now since her divorce from her husband she’s been in the fast food business, an activity that has helped her support her children and provide them with education.  She has three children.  Two of them work and help her with household expenses and she still has one in school.  She works hard to provide a career for him so that he will have better opportunities in the future.

She has a small business located downtown where she sells fast food like: sopes, tostadas, enchiladas and quesadillas.  She requested the loan to buy more ingredients to make the dishes like: tomatoes, chilies, onion, cheese, chicken and beef, among others, since these are the main ingredients.

She comments that she’s doing well in the business currently.  She has several customers since most of the population knows that her dishes are very tasty.  Besides, the place she’s located at has a lot of foot traffic.  The challenge she faces is competition because there are several food stands nearby but she isn’t concerned about that because she says: “God provides for everyone” and “the sun rises for all.”  She thanks God because she’s never lacked food and He has always given her strength to get ahead.

Minerva comments that her greatest wish is to remodel her house and this is why she’s saving up a little from her profits to start making this dream come true.

All the group members are grateful for the loan provided because, thanks to it, they will be able to invest more in their businesses and obtain higher profits to meet their family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fast food ingredients and to buy cosmetics.

location.town: Villa de Melchor Ocampo, Tututepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Cristo Y Nuestro Esfuerzo 4 & 8 Group

texts.en:
Junette is the coordinator of her group, Cristo y nuestro esfuerzo 4 & 8 (Christ and our effort). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is saving enough money to buy a house. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying her business.

Junette is excited to be taking a second loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for three and a half years, starting with a loan she took from a friend. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothes for sale in her house and through walking around in the community. She will save the profits, because through this business she wants to make her dreams come true, which is to have her own house.

She needed to improve her business by investing more capital, but now she knows Esperanza Internacional.  As a result she has the opportunity to improve her business by taking loans, making good investments, and paying every payment.

Junette´s group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. She thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Aida has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional beverages, canned goods & snacks.

Aida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional beverages, canned goods & snacks

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a widow and spends her time at home managing household chores and taking care of the cattle. Her husband was involved in a livestock business but after his death, her eldest son took it over and started a dairy business. Presently, they have three buffalos at home, which has become a source of income for them.   

Nasreen has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Nasreen’s remaining children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who wants to buy another buffalo to improve his dairy business. This will help him sell a larger quantity of milk to different milk shops and earn better profits. Nasreen is hopeful that after investing the loan money in her son’s business, he will be able to earn more income and Nasreen will be in a position to get him married soon. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit record and never missed any meeting. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Djiguisseme Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe DJIGUISSEME III sont  des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et  en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fala, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SÉTOU, assise au milieu, compte acheter les intrants et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare  riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djiguisseme III group are married women who average 32 years of age and have an average of three children each. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Fala, one of the villages in the municipality of Massigui, in the prefecture of Dioïla, which lies in Koulikoro, Mali's second administrative region.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of better organising their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. They grow millet, rice and groundnut. They are on their sixth loan from the institution. 

With this new loan, Sétou, who is sitting in the middle, is planning to buy farm inputs and pay labor costs necessary to maintain around one hectar of rice and groundnut. 

The produce is sold once harvested in the town of Massigui to a customer base made up of men and women. She is planning to make an average profit of around 40,000FCFA at the end of the season.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizer and weedkiller

loans.name: See Us Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “See Us” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each woman in the group. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Isatu is the leader of this group. She is 23 years old, married to a businessman and they have 3 children. Isatu sells clothes. She requested a loan of SLL 500,000 from Kiva lenders in order to buy more clothes to build her inventory and offer a larger selection.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Enkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhtsetseg, 28, is a hard-working woman who lives with her husband and two daughters in a ger, the traditional nomadic Mongolian tent. She has been operating a clothing-sales business since 2005 and now owns four booths there, having begun with just one.

Enkhtsetseg wants to expand her business by increasing the variety of her goods and is therefore requesting a loan to purchase new kinds of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase some new clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen es comerciante hace mas D. 10 años, está casada con el Señor Sindulfo hace mas D. 30 años. Tienen una despensa bien surtida. Comenta que tiene mucha clientela porque ella misma atienD. su negocio, le trata bien a la gente y porque es conocida en el barrio, además su marido tiene un carrito con caballo y todo los días sale a vender frutas y verduras por toda la zona y así se ayudan mutuamente.
Comenta que siempre han trabajado mucho para mantener a su familia y que gracias a Dios todos ya son grandes y ya formaron sus propias familias, ahora en la casa viven la Señora Carmen, el Señor Sindulfo y una nieta D. 5 años llamada Andrea.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. panificados, hortalizas, lácteos, carnes y demás para abastecer su despensa. Ella está muy esperanzada en el crédito, ya que le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen has been a merchant for more than 10 years. She has been married to Sr. Sindulfo for more than 30 years. Carmen has a food pantry that is well-stocked. She says that she has many customers as a result of attending to her business. Carmen tries to treat people well because she is known in the neighborhood. In addition, her husband has a horse-drawn cart from which he sells fruits and vegetables. He sells every day and travels throughout the area. Carmen and her husband help one another.

She says that she has always worked hard to maintain her family. Thanks to God, all of her children are grown and have started their own families. The only people living in her house now are Sra. Carmen, Sr. Sindulfo, and their five-year-old granddaughter named Andrea.

Carmen is requesting a loan to buy baked goods, vegetables, dairy products, meat, and other products to restock her food pantry. She is very hopeful that this loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, vegetables, dairy products, meat, and other products.

loans.name: Margie Llegunas Group

texts.en:
Margie is married. She is now 44 years old. With 8 children, she lives in Camanga, Tukuran, ZDS.

Margie is a farmer and grows PALAY(rice) to earn a living, but she also plants vegetables as another source of income. She's been doing this for 13 years. 

She has requested a loan for 4,500 to purchase fertilizer for her farm. Margie has been a member of PMPC for more than 4 years. In the future, Margie hopes to have her own farm land. Margie in the leader of 3 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 36-year-old business lady, and she is married with one child.  She has been raising poultry for the past two years with a monthly income of 10,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully.  Victoria will use the loan to buy poultry feed and additional chicks. 

With the anticipated profit from her business, she will expand the poultry pen so that the chickens can be comfortable.  She hopes to own a big poultry farm that will help her improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and additional chicks.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad, age 49, runs a business selling snacks and other delicacies. She earns about PhP 2,700 each month doing this type of work. She also engages in farming. She and her husband live in Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, and have one child.
 
Trinidad has requested a loan of PhP 14,900 in order to purchase two sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies for the farm.
 
Trinidad has been a member of PMPC for 12 years.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies for the farm

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Rowena has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rowena has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 44 years old and lives in Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is married with eight school-aged children. 

To earn a living, Liza has a food stall selling a food called fried chicken neck. She earns about 3000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Liza has a requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her fried chicken neck. 

Liza has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Liza would like to put up a permanent store in Ozamiz for her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making fried chicken necks

loans.name: Agapitus Mukabi

texts.en: Agapitus is a 33-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from 1 year to 5 years old.  He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a retail shop where he sells general items like sugar, flour, cooking oil, detergents, beverages etc. He has been involved in this business for five years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a shopping center. He describes his biggest business challenges to be inflation and poor transport network. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of general items. His business goal is to grow into wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will purchase a van to facilitate the running of the business.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flour, detergents etc

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Lam (pictured) is a weaver and her husband, Bunthoeun is now a construction worker. They have been married since 1990 and have three children - two sons and one daughter. One is a construction worker, one is a housekeeper and another one attends school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Lan is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to get work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to get work.

loans.name: Chanthard

texts.en:
Chanthard, 27, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. 

Chanthard is employed at a garment factory, and her husband sells palm products. 

Chanthard is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to take palm products to sell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to take palm products to sell.

loans.name: Sopharn

texts.en:
Sopharn is 35 years old and her husband, Nan, is 38 years old. They have been married since 2000 and have one young son. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sopharn is a weaver, while her husband is a security guard. He also does farming when he is free. Sopharn is asking for a loan of $500 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.  

In the photo, Sopharn is sitting at her loom.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Leonora has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Leonora has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Leonora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has been operating a business selling food from a stall in South Sudan for four years. Joice is requesting this loan through Kiva's partner, BRAC South Sudan, to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.fr:
Client de 40 ans, marie et père de 3 enfants dont tous sont sur le banc de l'école, il a été bénéficiaire depuis bientôt plus d'une année ,il est parmi  l'un de nos meilleurs clients, il a élargi son activité , il a  fait des benefices énormes et a rembourse avec succès ses differents prêts.
Avec ce nouveau prêt,il va acheter des pantalons en jeans de differents couleurs, des polos, des t-shirts et des marinières  
Il est très connu dans le marche et dans son quartier , puisque cela fait bientôt 15 ans, qu'il est dans la meme activité.
Il a pour ambition d'ouvrir un magasin d'habits et tient a aller très loin avec Hope pour atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en: A 40 year old man, married and the father of three children, who are all in school, this client has been a beneficiary for more than a year.  He is one of our best clients.  He has enlarged his business, has made enormous profits, and has successfully repaid his various loans.  With this new loan, he is going to buy denim pants in different colors, polos, t-shirts, and striped shirts.  He is very well-known at the market and in his neighborhood, since he has been in this business for nearly 15 years.  His ambition is to open a clothing shop and he hopes to go far with Hope to reach his objectives.

loans.use: to buy denim pants, polos, t-shirts, and striped shirts.

loans.name: Arnaud Junior

texts.fr:
Ce client est âgé de 25 ans il est celibataire et a un enfant d'une année maintenant,il a eu son bac il y'a plusieurs années, ne pouvant faire des etudes universitaires , il s'inscrit dans une école de pâtisserie et a l'obtention de son certificat , il ouvre une petite pâtisserie pour fabriquer des croissants, des pains au lait, pain au chocolat, des madeleines , des croissants...
Ses ventes ont largement augmentées, a l'heure actuelle , il a en moyenne 50.000 frs a 125.000 frs par jour.
Comme il fait ses achats en gros, il ne connait plus de rupture en stock et il a élargi son activité, parce qu'il fait des livraisons de domicile a domicile et a ouvert aussi un réseau  de gâteaux dans certaines boutiques d'alimentation et cantines scolaires .
Avec son nouveau prêt, il va acheter 5 sacs de farine , 2 sacs de 50 kg de sucre, des pots de margarine , 5 cartons d'œufs, des arômes et des pots de chocolat . Pour elargir son activité, il a prit deux jeunes apprentis qui l'aider a  travailler 

Il a l'ambition d'atteindre son objectif celui d'ouvrir un salon de the et acheter des équipements pour améliorer ses conditions de travail.
texts.en:
This client is 25 years old. He is unmarried, has a 1-year-old son, and graduated from high school a few years ago. Not having had the means to attend a university, he enrolled in a school for making pastries and, after obtaining his diploma, opened a small bakery in which he sells croissants, pains au lait, chocolate croissants, madeleines, etc.
His sales have greatly increased; he now makes about 50,000 frs to 125,000 frs per day.
As he buys wholesale, he no longer runs out of stock and he has expanded his business, since he does at-home deliveries and sells cakes in a network of food stores and schools.
With this new loan, he will buy 5 bags of flour, 100 kg of sugar, margarine pots, 5 boxes of eggs, flavorings, and chocolate. To expand his business, he has taken 2 apprentices to help him.
He wants to reach his goal of opening a tea house and buying new equipment to improve his working conditions.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of flour, 100 kg of sugar, margarine pots, 5 boxes of eggs, flavorings, and chocolate.

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Martha es una clienta habitante del barrio memorial Sandino junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos que están pequeños y todavía no pueden valerse por si solos, dependen de ella a los cuales mantiene de su negocio de pulpería hace 4 años que le ayuda para los gastos principales del hogar, está optando a su onceavo crédito para invertir más en su negocio aumentando su inventario con productos como refrescos envasados, golosinas, reposterías entre otros para cumplir con la demanda de los clientes y así aumentar sus ingresos económicos para brindarle lo necesario y si se puede un poco más a su  familia.

loans.use: Para comprar refrescos envasados, golosinas, reposterías.

loans.name: Gino Andru

texts.es:
Gino es un joven de 21 años de edad, vive en la cálida ciudad de Chincha, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de uva, frejoles, entre otros. Gino no pudo estudiar una carrera universitaria debido a sus pocos recursos económicos, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Mecánica.

Con cada mañana Gino se levanta con muchos ánimos para abrir su pequeño negocio de venta de cervezas y también alquila un taxi, el trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es responsable y sobre todo amable y respetuoso con los clientes.

Gino está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como tarrajeo, refacción de paredes, entre otros; de esta manera el podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Gino is a young man of 21 years of age, he lives in the warm city of Chincha which is characterized by having a warm and welcoming climate. There is much agricultural activity, especially grape growing, beans, and others. Gino could not study in the university due to economic reasons, but would have liked to study mechanics. 

Gino gets up each morning with enthusiasm to open his small store selling beer and also renting taxis. He works around 10 hours per day and can serve at least 20 clients. He thinks his business is going well because he is responsible and above all, kind and respectful of the clients.

Gino appreciates the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he can make some improvements to his home, such as repairing walls, among other things. In this way he can improve his way of life and continue fighting to be able to achieve his biggest dream: to have his own home.

loans.use: to make improvements on his house

loans.name: Guigonamahou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GUIGONAMAHOU est composé de quatre personnes qui sont des amies. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Hotomè Noëlie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 53 ans. Hotomè Noëlie a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Hotomè Noëlie ne vit plus avec son mari. Hotomè Noëlie est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à sa charge. Hotomè Noëlie  vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Hotomè Noëlie et son mari. Pour cette raison, Hotomè Noëlie vend du maïs et autres céréales à son domicile et par la technique de distribution depuis une vingtaine d'année.  Hotomè Noëlie  vend également des fromages, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Hotomè Noëlie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Hotomè Noëlie Claudine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe GUIGONAMAHOU, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, du mil et du sorgho.

loans.name: Las Insuperables 1 & 4 Group

texts.es:
Francia is one of the members of Las Insuperables (the invisible) 1 & 4 Group. The group is located in the city of Samana in one of the rural areas surrounded by the waters of the Atlantic Ocean. Many of the group members sell goods, such as bread, clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. Others sell seafood, run fried food stalls, and operate other businesses. 

Francia is a single mom and she lives with her only child. She is running a miscellaneous sales business where she different products like clothes, shoes, cosmetics, women accesories, and others stuff. She started her business approximately seven years ago with own saving and she started to increase her inventory with this Esperanza loan. She has said that her most difficult challenge is to finish her study and become professional. 

Francia has invested each of her three prior loans to increase her sales and to buy different products. She will use this loan to increase her business inventory. Francia is hoping to make her dreams come true; she wants to have a successful business, her own home and to see her son become professional. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, women accesories, cosmetics, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy furniture and juice making equipment for his business.

loans.name: Rumsani

texts.en:
Rumsani is an MBK member who has requested her second loan of $100. She started her bamboo basket business a long time ago. From a bamboo stick which she bought for IDR 10,000, she can produce 20 bamboo baskets that she could sell for IDR 5,000 each. The bamboo baskets are purchased by the distributor whose comes directly to her house every two weeks. For each transaction, Rumsani could sell 40 bamboo baskets. Half of the loan received from MBK will be used for her bamboo basket business while the other half will be used for her husband's business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Frely Pakan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Bamboo basket business and funding her husband business

loans.name: Ezinah

texts.en:
Ezinah I. is a 58-year-old nurse who lives with her husband and their four children in Kisumu, Kenya. Two of her children are joining University by September this year.

Ezinah trained as a nurse in the year 1969. After training, she worked in government hospitals for 35 years. In 2005, she opened her own clinic (Mt Everest Medical Clinic) in Manyatta, one of the most densely populated slums of Kisumu. In her clinic she offers general curative services, family planning, counseling, and maternal and child health care services, and also has integrated a pharmacy and laboratory within the clinic. She, in collaboration with K-MET, sells safe motherhood vouchers to expecting poor mothers, which enables them to access reproduction health services in certain medical facilities.

Ezinah attributes her success to hard work, perseverance, and assistance from K-MET’s microfinance loan. She has been able to renovate her facility, purchase a stock of drugs, and improve the quality of care she provides. Ezinah plans buy drugs and equipment for her pharmacy with the US $1200 loan.

loans.use: Improve stock of drugs at the clinic

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Business Description

Juan works in agriculture. He has dedicated himself completely to agriculture for the past 30 years, gaining much knowledge in the cultivation of rice, corn, etc. Because he is a totally dedicated to his work, he spends most of his time there, since this line of work demands total commitment.

Use of the Loan

Juan needs this loan to buy more supplies. This way, he can mechanize his crops, using pumps and other instruments in such a way that he won't have to spend the sowing period waiting to cultivate and produce, in this case, the corn crops.

Personal Information

Juan is married and has 7 children, 3 of whom are in school. Juan keeps his family together through much dedication and work. His small and cozy house is made of cement. Our friend Juan hopes to obtain more land to cultivate and in this way keep his family comfortable and stable.

Translated by Bianca V., Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Juan es agricultor trabajador, se a dedicado de lleno a la agricultura desde hace 30 anos ganando mucho conocimiento en el manejo de los cultivos como arroz, maíz, etc. Por ser netamente de este sector, la mayoría del tiempo la dedica a esta actividad, que por ser netamente del campo siempre la disponibilidad de tiempo es total.

Uso del Préstamo

Juan necesita el crédito para la compra de mayor cantidad de insumos, de esa manera tiene sus tierras mecanizadas, con la utilización de bombas y otros instrumentos, de tal modo que no tiene que esperar la temporada de siembra para poder cultivar y producir, en este caso es el cultivo de maíz.

.

Información Personal

Actualmente Juan esta casado, donde tiene 7 hijos, que en la actualidad estudian 3 de ellos. Juan con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo mantiene su familia unida, en su pequeña y acogedora casa de estructura de cemento. Nuestro amigo Juan tiene por objetivos tener mayor número de terrenos para cultivarlas y así tener a su familia cómoda y estable

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy assorted fruit.

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Married and father of one child, Mr. Yao K. is a master metal worker in Gbadago. He was born on July 21, 1974 in Kpalimé and is responsible for two dependents besides his immediate family. Born into a very poor family, he had to leave school after 6th grade and decided to begin an apprenticeship. After about 8 years he became a master at his trade and tried his best to figure out how to get a workshop. Since he has not managed to find a way for his wife to engage in retail business, he is the sole breadwinner for his family. He encounters many difficulties in his work, such as lack of the necessary machines, no way to fix up his workshop, and even lack of metal to work with. These problems have made him decide to ask for a loan of US$ 400 for his business. This will allow him to expand his business activities into other spheres and thus better support his family by increasing his income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Marié et père d’un (01) enfant, Mr K. Yao est un chef tôlier à Gbadago. Il est né le 21 Juillet 1974 à Kpalimé et a deux (02) autres personnes à charge. Issu d’une famille très pauvre, il a vite cessé les bancs en classe de quatrième et opte pour l’apprentissage. Devenu chef tôlier apres environ 8 ans, il a cassé de tête pour avoir un atelier. N’ayant pas trouvé de moyen pour sa femme afin de faire le commerce, il est seul face aux dépenses de la famille. Il rencontre beaucoup de difficultés dans ses activités tels que le manque de machines nécessaires, amélioration de l’atelier, les tôles. Ce qui le pousse à faire une demande de $400 pour son projet; ce qui lui permettra de se lancer aussi dans d’autres activités et répondre aux besoins de la famille et augmenter ses revenus.

loans.use:
purchase of raw materials

Achat de matieres premieres

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and restocking of grocery store goods

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Doña Guillermina works tirelessly every day from dawn to see the results of her work. She is an expert pastry baker and produces a huge variety of products such as pies and snacks. In order to distribute her products to different stores in town, doña Guillermina learned the art of bakery when she was a very successful student at an occupational training center. She started production at home in order to generate economic benefits for her family. At the moment she is renting an oven to bake her snacks but she wants to build her own oven so she can increase her production as the flour she uses has suffered a substantial rise in cost and for this reason she has had to reduce the production of snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermina, trabaja incansablemente cada día desde muy temprano para ver los frutos de su trabajo.Ella es una experta pastelera que produce una inmensa variedad de productos como: empanadas y bocaditos a base de harina; para distribuirlos a las diferentes tiendas de su ciudad.Guillermina aprendió el arte panadero cuando estudió en un centro de formación laboral; al culminar con satisfacción esta etapa de aprendizaje decidió implementar su centro de producción en casa a fin de generar ingresos en beneficio de su familia. Por ahora alquila un horno para la cocción de sus bocaditos y anhela construir su propio horno para incrementar su producción debido a que la harina materia prima de su trabajo durante estas semanas ha sufrido un incremento en su valor muy notable y desde luego su producción ha disminuido.

loans.use: Building of an oven in order to increase production of snacks and pies.

loans.name: Nanmugongo A Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Sarah N..  She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 10,00,000 to purchase more products and increase her stock.  Sarah is 40 years old and is divorced with two children aged 4 and 14. Both the children go to school.  Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 25,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to complete her house that is under construction. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500,000 in order to invest in the shop and the loan was paid back on time.  Sarah is joined in her small group by Rebecca N., Benah N., Ruth N., and Claire N..  Rebecca N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy another fridge.  Benah N. is also in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to start a poultry business.  Ruth N. runs a retail store and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to purchase more items for the shop.  Claire N. also runs a retail store and is requesting a loan of UGX 600,000 to purchase a weighing scale and a fridge.

loans.use: To purchase more shop items and increase stock

loans.name: Tania's Group

texts.en:
Clara, Tania, and Ruth are from the community of Rumichaca, located 15 minutes outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho. They have been members of the community bank Rumichaca for six months.

Clara is 63 years old. She is married and has four children, two of whom live with her. Clara grows parsley, cilantro, and other agricultural products that she sells in Ayacucho.

Tania is 21 years old. Tania is a tailor; she makes dress clothing and costumes ordered by established clients. Tania operates her business from her home and also works at a costume shop, where she does embroidery and finishing work.

Ruth is 23 years old. She lives with her partner and 1 year old son. For the past year, Ruth has been running a store where she sells food staples such as rice, flour, and sugar. She buys products in the city of Ayacucho and then sells them in her town.

Clara, Tania, and Ruth need $425, which they will use to buy seeds, fabric, soft drinks, beer, rice, and sugar.

One key aspect of the community bank is the interest earning savings account each associate has. Clara, Tania, and Ruth plan to use their savings to educate their children, open a women’s clothing shop, and in the case of an emergency. Their dreams are to own a tailor shop with industrial sewing machines, own a home, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fabric, soft drinks, beer, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo was trained as a mechanic in a public institute in the city of Juliaca. For the last ten years, he has been providing his mechanical repair services to the people of the town of Juliaqueña. Initially, he began working from premises not entirely suitable. Now, thanks to his skill, knowledge, ability, and excellent service, Hugo’s customers have trebled and his workshop has become one of the busiest workshops in town. He has expanded his premises and has hired more staff.

To continue to offer his customers excellent service, Hugo is in urgent need of reconditioning his equipment. Through his efforts and diligence, this enterprising father has maintained his beloved wife and son financially and they fully support him in his activities.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 10 años el señor Hugo, se dedica a brindar sus servicios de mecánico a la población Juliaqueña, Hugo estudió la carrera técnica de mecánica de producción en un instituto público de la ciudad de Juliaca, ahora gracias a su destreza, conocimientos y habilidad está logrando obtener más clientes.En principio inició su labor en un local no muy apropiado, pero conforme brindaba un buen servicio sus clientes fueron triplicándose y se vio en la necesidad de ampliar su local y contratar a más personal, actualmente es uno de los talleres más solicitados de esta localidad, es por ello se ve en la urgente necesidad de renovar sus herramientas de trabajo con el fin de continuar brindando a sus clientes un servicio de alta calidad.Este emprendedor padre con su esfuerzo y diligencia está logrando también mantener sin limitaciones económicas a su querida esposa e hijo quienes no dudan en apoyarlo en la actividad que realiza.

loans.use: Reconditioning of Workshop Tools and Equipment

loans.name: Mariam's Mtegemee Mola Group

texts.en:
Mariam, age 50, is a widow with three children (ages 30, 20 and 16). For 20 years, Mariam has sold snacks on the street in order to make a living. She works from 7am to 1pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $80.

Mariam hopes for a loan to purchase more food items in order to make more snacks. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members belong to group Mtegemee Mola. These members guarantee one another to pay back loans.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Narin

texts.en: 10 years ago Narin started this business. She is a mother of 3 children. Narin was born in 1957. She lives in Khachmaz town. She has her own hotbed where she grows vegetables. Now she needs a loan of $850 to buy vegetable seedlings and fertilizer for improving her hotbed.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Ngagne

texts.fr:
This traveling salesman has substantial business experience. He wants to increase his supply of products and improve his profits. By doing so, Mr. F. will be able to take care of his family and meet their essential needs.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Ce commerçant ambulant a une solide expérience du commerce. Il veut renforcer son stock et améliorer ses bénéfices. Avec cette activité NGagne arrive à entretenir sa famille et faire face à l'essentiel de ses besoins.

loans.use: Small business

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is a 28-year-old, married woman with 2 children who are 7 and 4 years old. She began selling clothes in 1997. Every day, she works extremely hard from 6 am to 4 pm at her business and, in doing so, she can earn a monthly profit of approximately $55 from her sales.

Zena now seeks a loan in order to buy more clothes at wholesale prices (i.e., in bulk) for her business.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional clothes in bulk

loans.name: Sabougnouma(Lucky) Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma résident dans le village de djodjandjè et sont des femmes mariées vivant en général dans des foyers polygames avec en moyenne 30 ans et cinq (5) enfants. Elles se sont connues au village par des liens d’amitié, d’affaire ou de voisinage.
Elles exercent le petit commerce de condiments alimentaires, de charbon de bois et de pagnes. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt et comptent l’utiliser pour constituer un stock des articles ci-dessus cités. Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès de grossistes attitrés. Les ventes sont réalisées sur place au village et dans les marchés des villages environnants (sur étale ou en ambulant).
Les femmes envisagent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 19.000 FCFA. qui sera utilisé pour agrandir la taille de leurs activités et faire face aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
The members of the group Sabougnouma live in the village Djodjandjè. They are married women that generally live in polygamous households. On average, they are 30 years old and have five children. They met in their village through business friends and neighborhood friends. Their small businesses are of condiments, wood coal, and African fabrics. This is their second loan and they hope to use it to increase their current inventory. They will purchase the goods in Bamako, the capital of Mali, from their regular wholesalers. Their goods are sold in their village and also the markets of the surrounding villages. The goods are put on display or sold in the street. The women hope to make a monthly profit of 19,000 FCFA, which will be used to expand the size of their businesses and meet family expenses.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various items for small businesses

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa K. was born in 1955. She lives in the village of Pribava near Gračanica. She is married and lives with her husband, daughter and two grandchildren. She helps her daughter with raising her children because she is divorced. Hanifa has worked as a tailor at home for a long time. She has her constant clients in neighbourhood and beyond. She has one old sewing machine and she needs another one. That is the reason that she is taking a loan from WWI in the amount of 500 KM. Hanifa wants to improve her business and provide a better life for her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machine

loans.name: Sinignessigui (Prepare For The Future) Group

texts.fr:
Composé de six femmes de 38 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 6 enfants, le groupe benkadi est spécialisé dans la restauration. Elles résident dans la sous préfecture de kimparana région de Ségou et sont des voisines de quartier. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 150.000 FCFA pour le quatrième prêt. Elles sont toutes des restauratrices vu la situation géographique de leur village qui est un carrefour très fréquenté. Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs de riz, des seaux de pâte d’arachide et autres ingrédients alimentaires nécessaires dans la fabrication des plats. Les ventes sont effectuées sous des hangars au bord de la route traversant la localité à une clientèle constituée de voyageurs, routiers, chauffeurs et d’autochtones.
Elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 100 000 CFA. de bénéfice dont une partie sera utilisée pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille et l’autre pour améliorer la présentation des restaurants.
texts.en:
Composed of six 38-year-old women, married and the mothers of at least 6 children, the Benkadi group is specialized in the restaurant business. They live in the Sous-prefecture of Kimparana, Ségou region, and are neighbors.

To expand the size of their businesses, the group members decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. The amount they are allowed to borrow has gone from 50,000 F CFA for their first loan to 150,000 F CFA for their fourth. They are all engaged in food service due to the location of their village at a much-travelled crossroads. This loan will be used to buy sacks of rice, buckets of peanut butter, and other necessary ingredients for preparing their dishes. The sales are made out of open sheds along the road that passes through the village to a clientele consisting of travelers, transporters, drivers, and village people. They expect to make on average 100,000 CFA in profit of which a part will be used to cover daily household expenses and the rest to make their little restaurants look more presentable.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of ingredients for food service

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. is a 32-year-old married woman with two children. To earn a living, she has been a trader for the past seven years; in particular, she sells used clothes in the local market of Tema. With income from her business, Florence is able to support all of her children in junior high school.

Her major business challenge over the years is her lack of funding, which prevents her from scaling up the business. She has a great deal of marketing experience, so she is very confident that she can improve the business with an injection of capital. As such, she is seeking a loan to enable her to achieve remarkable business progress. Specifically, she would use the loan proceeds to buy more bales of used clothes to meet her customers' demands. In turn, she hopes to save enough money to support her kids until they complete their schooling.

She belongs to the group known as the Morning Star Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Imraan

texts.en:
Imraan K. is responsible for his father and mother as well as his own family. He is single. He is busy in agriculture. He learned this business from his father but his father is unable to work in agriculture now. Imraan works hard at growing his crops and he has plenty of land for cultivation but he is unable to make use of it all.

So Imraan wants to take out an individual loan of 40,000 (AF) with a term of 26 months to complete his stock and buy more seeds to plant all his land and get ready for next year's cultivation. This is the season to prepare the lands for cultivation next year. He wants to make better life for his family in the future.

So Imraan is very happy that, with this loan, he can further his business and help his family in the future. His father and all his family want to thank those who help people by making Kiva loans.

loans.use: to complete his seed stock

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 25 year old Lucky J. M. from Dar es Salaam. She is single. She is responsible for supporting two dependants because they are schooling in he area.  Lucky has been running a clothing business since 2007. She buys clothes wholesale and sell them retail. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Lucky currently earns about 420 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 750 USD in order to purchase additional stock of clothing. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Lucky thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothing.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn T. is 55 years old and has 5 children. Her business is farming but she also sells variety goods in their neighborhood. She has a sundry shop. Her profits go toward paying the tuition fees of her 2 children who are now studying. Her husband is a "tricycle" (three-wheeled vehicle) driver. Evelyn thinks that with only her husband's income as a driver, it would be hard for them to send all their children to school.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs. Part of the loan will also be used to buy additional merchandise for her store. She wants her business to grow and the loan will help a lot for her business expansion.

CEVI helps Evelyn grow her business. With CEVI credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage, more and more people succeed in their business.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and merchandise for store

loans.name: Taofeek Jimoh

texts.en: Taofeek Jimoh O. is 36 years old and married with 4 children. He sells tires, which he purchases from Onitsha and resell them in Ibadan. He needs a loan in the amount of N140000 to purchase more tires to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more tires to sell

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr: Penda S. est une femme qui a pour activité le commerce de divers produits (patte d’arachide,  huile de palme, mil, tissus etc.). Elle va s’approvisionner à Diaobe. Elle fait ce commerce depuis sept ans  et elle sollicite ce prêt auprès de l’IMCEC pour renforcer son activité. Cette femme veuve qui habite a Thiès fait ce travail pour aider ses enfants à se nourrir.
texts.en:
Penda S. is a woman who sells a variety of products such as peanut paste, palm oil, millet, cloth and so on. She gets her goods from Diaobe. She has been in this line of business for seven years and is asking IMCEC for this loan in order to bolster her business. Penda is a widow who lives in Thiès; she works in order to feed her children.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods: peanut paste, palm oil, millet and cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy tools and other hardware to expand her business

loans.name: Elisa Del Carmen

texts.es:
ELISA D. CARMEN T. D. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Talentosas”  con su local ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry Nº 635 D. Distrito de Calleria; tiene 44 años, tiene 1 hijo menor y 2 ya adultos. Está separada de su esposo.

Ella se dedica al alquiler de este amplio local comercial ubicado en el centro de la ciudad; es socia en Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizo para el remodelamiento de su local que ahora alquila.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, piensa hincar otro negocio de compra y venta de madera, para lo cual se siente preparada y con todas las ganas de mejorar su nivel económico.

Comenta: “Me Agrada la forma de trabajo de Manuela Ramos, el sistema que tiene, el orden, así como las orientaciones que dan, he puesto en práctica algunos consejos que me ayudaron a mejorar mi empresa.
texts.en:
Elisa D. Carmen T. D. A. belongs to the “Mujeres Talentosas” community bank. Her business is located at Jr. Salaverry Nº 635 in the Calleria district. She is 44, has a minor son, and two adult children. She is separated from her husband. Her business is renting this spacious commercial business in the center of the city. She has been a member of Manuela Ramos for 1 year. Her first loan was for 300 PEN which she used to remoD. the location she now rents. With a loan of 1,500 PEN she will launch another business, the buying and selling of wood. She feels prepared for this, and she has a great desire to improve her economic level. She says, “I am happy with the way Manuela Ramos works, the system they have, and their order. I have put some of their suggestions into practice, and they helped me improve my business.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale wood

loans.name: Saeeda Shoqat Hussain Group
loans.use: To buy timber to sell.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes U. tiene la edad de 31 años, es una mujer casada. Y tiene 3 hijos a cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica este negocio. María comenzó este negocio porque anteriormente comerciaba todos sus productos de manera ambulante, y con el paso del tiempo decide establecerse en su vivienda para que sus clientes no estuvieran en su búsqueda. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos ropa para damas, ropa para caballeros, ropa para niños y calzado. Su deseo es aumentar su inventario para dejarles a sus hijos un medio de supervivencia.
texts.en:
María Mercedes U., 31, is married and raising three children. She sells general merchandise. She has been doing this for more than five years. María started this business because she used to sell her products on foot. As time passed, she decided to set up in her home so that her customers would not have to look for her. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy products such as women’s clothes, men’s clothes, children’s clothes, and footwear. Her wish is to expand her inventory to leave her children a means of survival.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania de 38 años es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Epifanio de 38 años y su hija Maria de 18 años, a quienes desea dar una buena vida. Su negocio es la carpintería, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 10 años junto a su esposo, fabrican camas, mesas, sillas, etc, las cuales distribuyen entre los vendedores de muebles del mercado Tupac Amaru (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca). Sus trabajos son de muy buena calidad y el acabado que realizan a sus muebles hacen que se vendan muy rápido, lo que más le gusta de su negocio es transformar la madera en cosas que la gente pueda usar, pero lo más difícil para ella es trasladar la madera hasta su casa, ya que le resulta muy cansado, aun así Melania desea continuar con su negocio y anhela poner su propia tienda de muebles donde pueda vender sus propios trabajos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la alegría que demuestra y contagia. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más madera para fabricar una mayor cantidad de muebles y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Melania, 38, is a happy and hard working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Epifanio, who is 38, and her daughter, Maria, who is 18. Maria wants to give them a good life. Maria’s business is carpentry. She has been in this business with her husband for over ten years. They make beds, tables, and chairs, etc. They distribute them to the furniture sellers in the Tupac Amaru market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). Their work is of a very good quality, and the finishings they put on the furniture makes it sell very quickly. What she likes most about her business is transforming the wood into things that people can use. The most difficult thing for her is transporting the wood to her house. This makes her very tired. Even so, Melania wants to continue her business. She strives to set up her own furniture store where she can sell her own work. This is her first loan with MFP. She is prepared to make all of her payments on time. She does not want to cause problems for the members of her community bank, where she is well liked for her contagious joy. With the 1,000 PEN that she is asking for, she will buy more wood to make a greater quantity of furniture to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Bron

texts.en:
The two persons shown in the above photo are Mrs. Bron S. and her husband, and they both live in Siem Reap Province.

Bron S. cultivates rice and vegetable crops to earn a living. She can collect all her mature produce to sell them in retail in the market every two months after she plants. Her husband helps be responsible for the entire family by fishing in Tunle Sap Lake. This couple has five children who have work in different jobs. Two of their children have been married for years and live separately.

Bron S. will be using the loan to buy extra tools to support her husband’s fishing business. This will help them to accrue a greater quantity of fish than before.

loans.use: To buy extra tools to support her husband’s fishing business

loans.name: Isaac Ken

texts.en: Isaac Ken S. sells phone and phone accessories in Kotokoraba in Cape Coast. Isaac Ken has received a senior high school education. He is married and has three children. His wife is a trader. Isaac Ken has been selling phone and phone accessories since 2006. He is responsible for paying utility bills and other expenses. His loan will be used to buy phone and phone accessories to resell. He hopes to reinvest his new profits in his business.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy phone and phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Danelia de 47 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos de los cuales estudian, su esposo trabaja como maestro de obra, y la ha apoyado en todos los planes. Reside en Villa Venezuela, doña Danelia tiene una pulpería que logro poner hace diecinueve años con esfuerzo de su esposo para ayudar con los gastos y sastifacer las necesidades cotidiana ya que todo esta caro,  pero ha logrado administrar su negocio con la ayuda de Afodenic ya que gracias a los prestamos ha venido desarrollándose en el comercio, este es su noveno ciclo el cual va invertir en la compra de granos básicos, productos lácteos,  y productos de cosméticos ya que son consumibles por sus clientes. Con este préstamo espera obtener mejores ganancias. Sus planes a futuro es proyectarse en hacer más grande su negocio. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios alcanzados.
texts.en:
Danelia is 47 years old, married with two schoolaged children. Her husband works as a construction foreman and has always supported her goals. She lives in Villa Venezuela and has a small store which she managed to set up 19 years ago with the effort of her husband to help with the expenses and cover the daily necessities, since everything is expensive. She has managed to administer her business with the help of Afodenic, since thanks to the loans she has developed the business. This is her ninth loan, which she will invest in the purchase of basic grains, dairy products and cosmetics products, since those are the most popular with her customers. With his loan she hopes to obtain a higher income. Her future plans are to grow her business even larger. She thanks the Afodenic institution for the benefits provided.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy products, grains, and meat

loans.name: Ernest Adera

texts.en:
Ernest Odera is a 38-year-old man married to Millicent.  He is the father of four children ages 3, 8, 9 and 10.  To make a living, he makes brake pads and other motor and bicycle rubber fittings from used tires. He has been running this business for about twenty years, next to a motor garage. His clients are mainly people who have their vehicles repaired at the garage, and the mechanics recommend him to their clients thanks to the business rapport that he has created. 

He learned about KADET Limited from his neighbor during an informal talk. This will be his first loan and he hopes to use the money to purchase more used tires, and expand his business by employing someone to assist him.  He aspires to open a motor spare parts shop, where he would include locally made and cheap rubber products, to serve a wider market segment.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy tires and hire an assistant.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 32 años, es natural de Iquitos (región selva), pero vivió en Brasil gran parte de su vida. Ahora vive en Perú con su pareja en la casa de los padres de ella y esperan iniciar una bonita familia. Hace 5 años se dedica a brindar servicio mecánico automotriz, pues desde muy joven fue muy hábil para este oficio, por ello, implementó un taller en la ciudad de Lima, donde refacciona todo tipo de autos. Esta actividad es muy apasionante para él y lo bueno es que tiene un ayudante, pues no se da abasto solo para reparar todos los vehículos que llegan a sus manos. Ahora con una persona más, aprovecha algunos momentos para brindar servicio de taxi en su auto y así obtener más ingresos. Para el futuro, Julio quiere que su taller tenga equipos variados y de última tecnología para la reparación de automóviles.
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará aceite y algunas herramientas para poder reparar más automóviles.
texts.en:
Julio is 32 years old and a native of Iquitos (a jungle region). He lived in Brazil for most of his life, but now he lives in Peru with his partner in the home of his parents. They hope to start a nice family.

Five years ago, he started providing services as an auto mechanic. He has become an expert at his job despite being so young. Julio opened a repair shop in Lima where he fixes all types of cars. He is very passionate about his work and the best part is that he has an assistant, because sometimes he receives more vehicles than what he is capable of handling by himself. Now that he has an employee, he is able to provide taxi services in his own automobile during his spare time so that he can generate more income. In the future, Julio would like to acquire a variety of equipment for his repair shop so that he can have the latest technology available to perform automotive repairs.

This is his first loan with MFP and he has agreed to make his payments on time. With the money he requested, he will purchase motor oil and additional tools so that he can repair more cars.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & tools for his repair shop

loans.name: Marcelo Ruben

texts.es: Marcelo Rubén E. Castellón tiene la edad de 28 años. Es un hombre responsable y con 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte. Marcelo inicio hace mas de 10 años, ya que su familia se dedicaba a este negocio, por lo que a él le gusto lamentablemente su familia no tenía suficiente recursos y lamentablemente no le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar, fue por esto que Marcelo lucho mas para que sus hijos no pasaran por lo mismo. Y así empezó este negocio que sería su medio de vida para sacar a su familia adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ciertos repuestos que son útiles para su medio de transporte. Para un futuro le gustaría que sus hijos aprendieran este negocio para mantenerlo en la familia.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
This is Clarita A., a 42-year-old fresh meat vendor from Silang, Cavite. She has three children, all attending school. She is married to Lysander, an architect.

Clarita has a meat shop in a nearby market. She sells fresh beef and pork meat. Her business is fairly new – she just started it last year, almost simultaneous with her joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative.  Over time, her meat shop has grown steadily to where her hands are always full handling orders and tending to buyer, so she decided to hire two assistants. She is now making at least PHP 25,000 a month. Her profits help her to send her kids to school.

She is now on her seventh loan cycle with the cooperative. She is in need of a loan in the amount of PHP 29,000 as additional capital. Clarita wishes to have her house renovated soon.


 
About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fresh meat vending business

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita M. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 60 years old. Esterlita is widowed and has seven adult children. To make a living, Esterlita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Esterlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Esterlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: M. D. Madeleine est née en 1971 et est mariée à KPONON Cosme, un aide soignant. Madeleine vit depuis treize ans au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Madeleine a quatre enfants en charge, dont deux sont ses propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Madeleine vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Madeleine a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, et depuis huit ans, elle vend des fruits (orange, banane, mangue, etc.) et également du maïs grillé dans son quartier. Madeleine fait ses achats à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà obtenu deux crédits de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Pour augmenter le volume de ses produits et faire face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Madeleine sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Madeleine M. D. was born in 1971 and she is married to Cosme KPONON, a nurse’s aide. For thirteen years, Madeleine has been living in the neighborhood of Gbégamey in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.

Madeleine supports four children; two of them are her own children. All the children attend school. Madeleine lives alone with her children and she, alone, provides for the family’s expenses. Madeleine stopped attending school in middle school. For the last eight years, she has been selling fruits (oranges, bananas, mangoes etc…) and also grilled corn in her neighborhood. Madeleine makes her purchases in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.

She is a long time client of ALIDé who has already received two loans from ALIDé. Those have been fully repaid. To increase the volume of her produces and to meet the ever-increasing demand of her customers, Madeleine is requesting another loan from ALIDé.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of baskets of oranges, mangoes, and bananas.

loans.name: Olinda Esther

texts.es:
La señora Olinda Esther, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Triunfo”, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 31 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, ella decide iniciar su propio negocio de venta de gallinas y patos, con un capital de S/. 300.00, donde comenzó vendiendo poco a poco y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes, que ya conocen de la actividad que realiza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800.00, comprará mas aves de corral como gallinas, pavos, patos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando alimento balanceado y vitaminas, para mantener sanos a sus animales y libres de cualquier enfermedad.

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro y tiene que levantarse temprano, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ms. Olinda Esther V. is a member of the El Triunfo Communal Bank in the San Hilarion district of the Picota province, department of San Martin. She is a 31-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 2 school age children.

Because of the need to help her children get ahead, and thanks to her enterprising spirit, she decided to launch her own poultry business with a capital of 300.00 PEN. She started out by selling only a few chickens and ducks, but her business has now become more well-known in the area.

With this 1,800.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more fowl, such as chickens, turkeys, and ducks. She will also invest some of the money in feed and vitamins to keep her animals healthy and disease-free.

She feels very satisfied with the work that she does, despite the fact that it is hard work and that she has to wake up very early. However, she believes that the sacrifice is worth it as it will help her reach her lifelong goals and dreams. She is also grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for supporting her and other women like her who want to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase poultry

loans.name: Etelvida

texts.es:
Etelvida, tiene la edad de 44 años, es divorciada, y no tiene hijos. Ella tiene un local donde cuenta con abarrotes para los vecinos el cual cuenta una ubicación centrica.  Ella quiere comprar mas mercadería para brindar una mayor variedad de artículos para los clientes.  Tiene varios años que se dedica a su negocio y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR  y en el pasado, ella no pudo obtener crédito por que hubo demasiado requisitos con otros bancos formales. Ella  tiene el deseo a por medio de aumentar la cantidad de artículos y tener un mejor ingreso economico, así mejorar el local y su nivel de vida. 
About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Etelvida is 44, divorced, and does not have children. She has a place where she sells groceries to the neighbors. The place is centrally located. She wants to buy more merchandise to offer a greater variety of articles to her customers. She has been in this business for several years, and she wants to grow. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR. In the past she could not get a loan because there were too many requirements with the other, formal banks. She wants to increase the quantity of articles by half and have a better income. That way she will improve her location and her standard of living. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Rosas De Villa Ingenio Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal Rosas de Villa Ingenio pertenece al Centro Focal German Busch, se agruparon hace poco para acceder al préstamo y los demás servicios que oferta Pro Mujer, todas tienen diversos negocios como la producción de alfombras, venta de ropa interior, realizar bordados computarizados, confección de ropa, elaboración de muebles, tejido de chompas y venta de pipocas.
Una de las integrantes es Angélica Isabel M. de 27 años se dedica a vender condimentos en diferentes ferias. Maria C. de 39 años produce billeteras en su domicilio. Todas necesitan el préstamo para fortalecer sus negocios comprando materia prima, mercadería o algún activo fijo.
texts.en:
The Rosas de Villa Ingenio Communal Bank belongs to the German Busch Regional Hub. They merged recently to gain access to the loans and other services that Pro Mujer offers. The members have a number of businesses such as making rugs, selling lingerie, screen printing, making clothing, furniture construction, making jackets, and selling popcorn. One of the members is Angélica Isabel M., who is 27 years old and sells spices at various markets. Maria C. is 39 years old and makes wallets in her home. All of them need the loan to strengthen their businesses by purchasing raw materials, merchandise, or capital assets.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials, merchandise, and capital assets

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo M. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling food and daily use products in his community. Ricardo is a single man from the village of Langcata-on, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. Ricardo has been in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Ricardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Ricardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. Ricardo is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be his 4th loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Khady Guèye

texts.fr: Kady Guèye S. est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité. Elle fait essentiellement de l'élevage de volailles et parallèlement elle vend du sucre et du poisson frais. Son objectif est de renforcer ses épargnes afin de prétendre à une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Kady Guèye SEN, aged 43, is married and the mother of one child. She has been a member of Banc Villageois for two years and has good experience in her business sector. Basically, she raises poultry, and concurrently she sells sugar and fresh fish. Aspiring to financial autonomy, she has a goal of bolstering her savings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering and advancing her commercial businesses

loans.name: Bashiru

texts.en:
Bashiru is 60 years old and married with five children who are excelling in their education and businesses. He loves his business and family dearly.
Bashiru is a hardworking man who sells various types of drinks from his stall. He works for long hours in order to provide for his family's basic needs. He is requesting a loan of 150,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. In the future, Bashiru hopes to own a drinks company. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Joanne Kristine

texts.en: Joanne Kristine G. is from the village of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old and single. To make a living, Joanne Kristine works in a family member's business venture in the retail sector running a general store, selling a variety of different products such as vinegar, noodles, sardines and some snack food in the local community. Joanne Kristine has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Joanne Kristine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joanne Kristine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Joanne Kristine is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Joanne Kristine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental.
