Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
For the past five years, Iyabo has owned a shop in Lagos, Nigeria where she sells foodstuffs, groceries and drinks profitably at retail prices, managing the business with the help of her husband. She also assists her husband in keeping the home. Iyabo is now requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs, groceries and drinks to sell. The additional profit from the business will enable her to save and reinvest in the business, which will lead to expansion in the future.

Iyabo is 30 years old, married and blessed with three children, ages three, five, and seven years old, all doing fine. She hopes to support her husband in sponsoring their education and expresses her huge gratitude to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs, groceries and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fresh tomatoes and peppers to sell

loans.name: Saidali

texts.en:
Saidali is married and the father of 4 children. For 10 years he has been engaged in farming and cattle raising business. The love of his children is the motor that keeps him working hard for their future. He works hard together with the help of his wife to achieve quality products. The high price of fertilizer has caused his production to slow down, but he wishes to do better, have more production, and increase the number of his cattle. 

To do this, Saidali needs capital, which he requests through a loan and hopes that you can help him; this way, he can look forward to a profitable production to increase his income and pay for his children’s education. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and fertilizer

loans.name: Santos Natividad

texts.es: El señor Santos Natividad posee un negocio que es una pulpería. Y está ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace diez años. El realiza sus compras de contado y sus ventas son al crédito y de contado, las compras las efectúa en el mercado de Managua donde le resulta mucho más favorable ya que así compra el por mayor. Pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y mantener a su familia. El está solicitando un financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio, además es padre de tres niños menores de edad, los cuales asisten al colegio y están a su cargo. El nos cuenta que sueña con mejorar su actividad económica que es su medio de vida.
texts.en:
Santos Navidad has run a small general store located in his house for the past 10 years. He buys his goods on account and sells his goods on credit or on account as well. He buys his inventory in the market of Managua where he can get wholesale prices. He has always enjoyed working and taking care of his family. He is seeking a loan to invest in his business. He is the father of three young children who are all attending elementary school. He dreams of improve his store to better his standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Guadalupe de la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, la zona queda ubicada a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar desde hace mas de tres años en la venta de refrescos, ella vende refrescos preparados   con frutas naturales en una pequeña carretilla ambulante ubicada a espaldas de la plaza de armas de la ciudad en donde vive, el negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia por lo que siempre trata de ofrecer productos de calidad y un buen trato a sus clientes.

Carmen desea adquirir mas frutas para seguir adelante con su negocio y también desea incursionar en la venta de sanguches, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es poder seguir trabajando para construir su casa propia, ya que actualmente reside junto a sus suegros. Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y que se esfuerza al máximo para sacar adelante a los suyos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 29 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the district of Guadalupe in Pacasmayo Province, La Libertad region. This area is located an hour and ten minutes away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Carmen has been selling refreshments for more than three years. She prepares cold drinks made of natural fruits from a small mobile cart located on the edge of the main city square. Her business has been a great help to her family’s finances. She always offers quality products and good service to her customers.

Carmen wants to acquire more fruit to move her business forward. She also wants to sell sandwiches. In order to achieve this goal, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 700 PEN. Her greatest wish is to continue working so that she can build her own house because she currently lives with her in-laws. Carmen is a hardworking woman who does all that she can so that her family can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit for preparing soft drinks & ingredients for making sandwiches

loans.name: Beatice

texts.en: Beatice A. is a hairdresser who is divorced and has two children. She has been through junior high school. Beatice sells hair products as well in Takoradi. She uses her income to provide for the basic needs of her children. Beatice will use this loan to purchase more hair creams and other hair products for her salon to expand her business. With the new returns from her expanded business, Beatice plans to acquire land and use the rest to pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more hair creams and other hair products for her salon

loans.name: Freddy Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Freddy Antonio C. L., tiene 37 años de edad, habita acompañado por su pareja de vida, la cual es panadera y con sus ingresos apoya a la economía del hogar, tienen 2 hijos menores de edad, que estudia la escuela primaria.

Ellos tienen una panadería desde hace 16 años, el alza de precios continua de la materia prima principal, debido al aumento del combustible que les ha ocasionado inestabilidades económicas, detieniendo el crecimiento de su negocio y por ende el desequilibrio de su economía domestica, fue con el esfuerzo de la cabeza del hogar que lograron la apertura del negocio, a futuro pretenden realizar una elaboración del productos a nivel industrial, no una venta estilo cafetería personalizada, esperan llegar a tener los recursos necesarios para incursionar de esa forma en el mercado nacional, por ahora solicita de un préstamo para la compra de  materia prima que aumente sus ventas y brinde capital necesario para llevar a cabo algunos planes que se tiene trazados para la mejora continua de sus niveles de vida de todos los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
37-year old Sr. Freddy Antonio C. L. lives with his wife. She is a baker, and the money she earns helps with household finances. They have two young children who attend primary school. They have had the bakery for 16 years. The increase in prices for ingredients is continuing because of the rise in the cost of gasoline, and this has led to economic instability for the family and slowed down the growth of their business. The business was started through Freddy’s efforts as the head of the household. In the future they hope to make much larger quantities of their products and sell them to many more customers, and thus move away from being simply a bakery for local people. They hope to obtain the resources necessary to enter the nationwide market, and for this reason Freddy is asking for a loan to buy ingredients so he can increase sales and get the capital he needs to realize his plans to continue improving the standard of living of his whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy baking ingredients

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en: Sherlita D. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 66 years old. Sherlita is widowed and has six adult children. To make a living, Sherlita operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling spices like onion, garlic and tomatoes. Sherlita has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Sherlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sherlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sherlita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Sherlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fouladou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité FOULADOU est créé depuis l’inauguration du Banc Villageois de GADAPARA il y a de cela 11 ans. Il est composé de 06 femmes issues du même quartier. Des femmes qui se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. 

Madame AWA B., debout à droite sur la photo, de blanc vêtue, est la responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 56 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge. 

Elle est vendeuse de légumes au marché central de Kolda. Elle mène cette activité depuis plusieurs années, environs 10 ans. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter des légumes en quantité plus importante que d’habitude afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins financiers de la famille. Par exemple la nourriture et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The FOULADOU solidarity group was created after the GADAPARA Banc Villageois was established 11 years ago. It is composed of 6 women who come from the same neighborhood. They are organized by neighborhood and kinship. Mrs. AWA B., standing at the right in the photo and dressed in white, is the leader of the solidarity group. She is 56 years old, married and the mother of 5 dependent children. She sells vegetables at the Kolda central market. She has operated this business for around 10 years. With her new loan, she is going to buy vegetables in larger quantites than usual so as to better satisfy her customers. Her goal is to help her husband provide for the family’s financial needs, such as the food and the children’s schooling.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el caserío El Sandial, una zona rural situada en el distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe, sus pobladores se dedican principalmente a labores agrícolas, se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas, especialmente en el cultivo de maíz, en su vareidad amarillo duro. El cuenta con un terreno de sembrío donde suele instalar este cultivo hasta dos veces por año. Adicionalmente se dedica a criar y vender animales menores, con los ingresos que obtiene de estas actividades el sostiene la economía de su familia y trata de sacarlos adelante.

Estas actividades son muy importantes para el y siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para poder sacarlas adelante y obtener buenas cosechas. Actualmente el necesita adquirir algunos fertilizantes y pesticidas con los cuales piensa brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, de modo que pueda obtener una buena producción. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Edilberto es un padre responsable y bastante entregado asu familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder otorgarles una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive el es  una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Edilberto is a 29 year old father that lives with his wife and their three children in the settlement of El Sandial, a rural area located in the Pítipo district in the province of Ferreñafe. The residents here work mainly in agriculture. It is located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Edilberto works in agriculture, focusing on the cultivation of the hard, yellow variety of corn. He has a plot of farm land where he usually plants his corn twice a year. In addition, he raises and sells small animals. He supports his family with his earnings, trying to help them to get ahead. These activities are very important to him and he works very hard to make a go of it so that he will have a good harvest. Currently, he needs to buy fertilizers and pesticides which he plans to use to maintain his crops so that they will produce well. In order to acheive this goal he has decided to request a loan for 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency). This will be his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. Edilberto is a responsible father and is very dedicated to his family. His greatest desire is to continue working so that he can give them a better quality of life. In the area where he lives he is quite well-known and is highly regarded by his neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides to maintain his crops

loans.name: Cesar Agusto

texts.es: El señor CESAR BETANOURT GARCIA de 29 años de edad, se desempeña como auxiliar contable en la institución de MATECSA soltero ha obtenido dos financiamientos en CEPRODEL los cuales le han servido para reparar la casa de habitación
texts.en:
Cesar B. Garcia, 29, works as a junior accountant for the MATECSA institution. He is single, and has previously taken 2 loans from CEPRODEL which he has used to make repairs to his house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy iron, cement and sand

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace J., 53, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She makes sure that she earns so that her family can have a better life. She has been managing her health care product business for 12 years now.

Grace has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues, because she uses the money she borrowed to expand and improve her health care product business. 

To continue operation of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 40,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of additional capital for her expanding business by buying additional quantities of health care products, as well as incorporating more varieties of products into her inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have enough money for her adopted child’s future.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional quantities of health care products.

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
La Sra. A.  es comerciante del M. la terminal donde inicia a ofertar su producto desde la 5 am. Y finaliza a las 3 pm. Este crédito lo solicita para comprar por mayor su producto y así obtener mayor ganancia, y lograr mejorar su nivel de vida realizándole mejora a su vivienda.

La Sra. está muy agradecida con Ceprodel  por que le ha ayudado que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Sra. A. is a merchant in La Terminal market, where she begins selling her product at 5:00 a.m. She finishes at 3:00 p.m.

The loan she is applying for is for the wholesale purchase of her product so that she obtains greater earnings and succeeds in improving her standard of living and carrying out improvements to her home. Sra. A. is thankful to Ceprodel because it has helped with the growth of her business.

loans.use: Purchase of queso duro (a hard, salty cheese), fresh cheese, and cream.

loans.name: Ghafooran's Group

texts.en:
Ghafooran lives in Gujranwala, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, and is famous for its dairy industry. She is a housewife and prefers to stay at home. She is very active in her household responsibilities and manages them well. She lives with her family in a 3 room brick house. Her husband, M. Y., is a vegetable seller by profession. His shop is in the market, where he offers different fresh vegetables to his clients. He has been doing this business for the past 10 years.

Ghafooran has given birth to 4 sons. Her first two sons work at different jobs. The eldest son has a business of hosiery and second one works in a factory. Her two youngest sons are enrolled in a school and are getting their education.

Ghafooran has applied for a loan for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will put a variety of fresh seasonal vegetables in his shop for reselling. Ghafooran is hopeful that this loan investment will be profitable for her husband’s business. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first experience of taking a loan from any MFI.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for vegetable sales business.

loans.name: Oneyda Del Carmen

texts.es:
ONEYDA DEL CARMEN M. L.,Trabaja como Colectora en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, es madre dos hijos pero actualmente estos no estan estudiando, ha trabajado seis prestamos con la institucion y estos han sido para el mejoramiento de la vivienda.
 el prestamo solicitado espara comprar verjas para las ventanas de su casa de habitacion.
texts.en: Oneyda del Carmen M. L. works as a collector in the Mercado Oriental market in Managua.  She is mother to two children but they are not currently in school.  She has had six loans from the organization which have been used to improve her house.  The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy grilles for the windows of her house.

loans.use: To improve her house, replacing window grilles

loans.name: Lizette Veronica

texts.es: Lizette Verónica tiene 36 años es madre soltera y vive con sus 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La experiencia que tiene en su negocio es muy satisfactoria, la ubicación de su negocio es en su propia casa de habitación,   desde hace 11 años pues Lizette atiende a sus clientes con un cálido trato logra que la visiten más seguido para realizar sus compras. Gracias a la buena administración de su negocio ha podido surtir un poco mas como golosinas, refrescos, agua, granos básicos, detergentes, sopas, jugos. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de materia prima de todo lo que ofrece. Ella ha trabajado mucho por salir adelante ya que tiene varias metas  como seguir ayudando a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en: Lizette Verónica is 36 years old.  She is a single mother and lives with her 3 children who are in her care.  The experience which she has in her business is very satisfactory.  Her business is located in her own home.  For 11 years Lizette has been serving her customers warmly.  This way she has managed to ensure they visit her again more quickly to do their shopping.  Thanks to the good running of her business, she has been able to stock her store a little more with products such as candies, soda, water, basic grains, detergents, soups and juice.  She is requesting this loan to buy more of everything she offers.  She has worked a lot to get ahead as she has several goals such as continuing to help her children in their studies.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products to stock her store.  To buy gas canisters as she is going to start selling them

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
El Señora Beatriz F. C., es madre de un hijo al cual está educando sola porque es madre soltera el padre de su hijo se fue hace como dos años y desde entonces la señora se dedico la venta de abarrotes en un mercado de la localidad de Ivirgarzama (mercado de la Playa de Autos), esta muchacha es muy joven, trabajadora y muy dedicada a su hijo, de lunes a viernes trabaja como mesera en un restaurant donde ella es bien tratada y los fines de semana trabaja en su puesta en el mercado local, poco a poco ella va levantándose para así poder tener una mejor vida tanto para ella como para su hijo.

Es la primera vez que la cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de mercadería y así poder tener una mejor variedad de productos los cuales podrá ofrecerlos a sus cliente, lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs Beatriz F. C. has one child who she is educating alone because she is a single mother.  Her child's father left two years ago and since then she has been selling groceries in a local market in Ivirgarzama (Playa de Autos market).  This girl is very young, hard-working and devoted to her child.  From Monday to Friday she works as a waitress in a restaurant where she is well treated.  At weekends she works on her stall in the local market.  She is gradually lifting herself up so that she can have a better life for herself and her child.

This is the first time that Beatriz has had a loan from our institution.  She will use it to buy merchandise so that she can have a better variety of products to offer her customers.  This will allow her to improve her income and thereby improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Flores Magon Group

texts.es:
La señora Roció Sanromán M., ella es parte del grupo “Flores Magon” comentan que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo por que la mayoría de las integrantes viven en ese andador llamado Flores Magon y dice q	ue esta muy orgullosa de pertenecer a este grupo porque ella es la representante de este. Ella originaria de la población llamada Zitácuaro Michoacán, tiene 29 años de edad, está estudiando la preparatoria abierta en este momento porque sus papas no tenían dinero para comprarle el uniforme y los útiles escolares, dice que su esposo es una gran ayuda para ella porque él la motiva a salir adelante para que estudie una carrera. Doña Rosy como le dicen sus amigos y familiares se dedica a vender dulces, jugos, chicharrones preparados con soya, refrescos, frituras, paletas de hielo etc., frente al hospital regional de Zitácuaro, tiene con su negocio 2 años, comenta que empezó a vender sus jugos y demás cosas porque ella veía que las personas que tenían enfermos en el hospital no tenían que almorzar y por eso ella decidió poner su puesto, otro de los motivos por el cual puso su puesto fue que le quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. La señora Rosy, está casada con el señor Salvador, el es abogado y tienen una niña de seis años llamada Leylan que estudia el primer año de primaria. Dice la señora Rosy que su meta en la vida es poder hacer un local estable donde pueda vender sus dulces y vender bisutería ya que le gusta diseñar collares y pulseras de pedrería, otra de sus metas es terminar la preparatoria y terminar la carrera de Licenciado en Derecho. Comenta que con las ganancias que saque de vender sus dulces y jugos ahorrara para comprar un terreno para hacer el local que tanto sueña.

María Amparo S., es parte del grupo “FLORES MAGON" tiene 43 años y estudio hasta el tercer año de preparatoria comenta que no termino sus estudios ya que sus papás no tuvieron el dinero suficiente para seguirla apoyando con los gastos de la escuela. Doña Amparo está casada con el señor José Carlos él es carpintero ellos tienen 3 hijos  de nombres José Carlos el cual trabaja con su papa y quiere emprender una tienda de abarrotes, Paulo Cesar de 13 años de edad el estudia la secundaria y Mauricio de 6 años estudiante de primaria Ella se dedica a vender productos de belleza por catalogo como cremas, cosméticos, etc, lleva con esta actividad aproximadamente 9 años, decidió emprender este negocio para ayudar con su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos y también para estar al pendiente de ellos y de su casa. Doña Elvia está solicitando su préstamo para invertir en cosméticos para tener en existencia y no pedirlos porque es algo tardado los pedidos que realiza, La meta que tiene para su negocio es seguir incrementando el número de clientas.

Los otros 10 integrantes se llaman María Guadalupe Julián C., Reyna P. Esquivel, Isabel M. García, Clementina Solís Setina, Stephanie Sanromán Sandoval, Teresa López Pichardo, Perla Janeth M. López, Azucena Julián C., José Carlos J. S., Marisol Sanromán Sandoval ellos quieren los préstamos para invertir en venta de colchas por catalogo, venta de dulces, zapatos por catalogo, manualidades, panadería, cosméticos por catalogo etc.

***la chica a la mesa con blusa blanca y chamarra de mezclilla es la coordinadora de FRAC***
texts.en:
Roció Sanromán M. is part of the group “Flores Magon." She says she gave the group this name because the majority of the members live in the Flores Magon area. She also says that she is very proud to belong to this group and be its representative. She is from the town of Zitácuaro Michoacán, and she is 29 years old and is finishing high school in an Open High School program, because her parents were unable to afford her uniform and other school supplies when she was younger. She says that her spouse is a great help to her because he motivates her to study and to advance. Rosy, as her friends call her, sells sweets, juices, soy chicharrones, soft drinks, fried foods, ice blocks, and more, in front of the regional hospital of Zitácuaro. She has had this business for 2 years, and began to sell juices and other things because she saw that the family members of the hospital patients didn't have anything for lunch, and she decided to put up her stall. Another motivation for putting her stall there was that she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses. Rosy is married to Salvador, who is a lawyer and they have a 6 year old daughter named Leylan, who is in first grade. Rosy says that he goal in life is to be able to have a fixed location from which to sell her treats and also to sell jewelry, as she likes to design necklaces and jeweled bracelets. Another of her goals is to finish school and complete a degree in law. She says that with the earnings from her sales of sweets and juices that she's saved, she wants to buy some land to have permanent store she's dreamed of. 


María Amparo S. López is part of the “Flores Magon” group. She is 43 year old and is in her third year of Open High School. She says she had not finished her studies earlier because her parents didn't have the money to continue to support her with her school expenses. She is married to José Carlos who is a carpenter and together they have 3 sons: José Carlos, who works with his dad and wants to open a grocery store, Paulo Cesar, who is 13 years old and studies in secondary school, and Mauricio, who is 6 and is in primary school. María sells beauty products through a catalogue, like creams, makeup, etc. She has done this for about 9 years. She decided to open her business to help her husband with the kids' expenses and also to be able to watch over them and her house. Elvia is seeking this loan to invest in cosmetics to add to her stock and not to have to order them when her clients request them because it delays her ability to deliver her clients' items. Her goal is to continue increasing her number of clients. 

The other 10 group members are: María Guadalupe Julián C., Reyna P. Esquivel, Isabel M. García, Clementina Solís Setina, Stephanie Sanromán Sandoval, Teresa López Pichardo, Perla Janeth M. López, Azucena Julián C., José Carlos J. S., Marisol Sanromán Sandoval. They seek this loan to invest in the purchase of bedding, sweets, shoes, handiwork, bread, and cosmetics. 

***The woman at the table with the jean jacket is the coordinator from FRAC (a Kiva partner) ***

loans.use: To purchase sweets, juices, refreshments, etc.

loans.name: Micheal Kamu

texts.en:
Micheal, age 61, is married to Mary Nyambura, who is a farmer.  He rears sheep for sale on his farm in Limuru. His wife is of great assistance in the farming activities. He has done this for 32 years and he is able to support his family from the proceeds and support his grandchildren as well.

This is the second loan he has received from KADET Ltd. and he intends to use it to buy a dairy cow for milk production since this will be his source of income.  This will bring him more income for the family. 

From the profits of this loan, he desires to develop a piece of land he had acquired earlier for the family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Rosaura Dionicia

texts.es:
La señora Rosura Dionicia C. S. tiene 45 años de edad y vive en una casa en anticretico vivienda que esta ubicada en zona de la terminal de la ciudad de Tarija. Rosaura es madre soltera de un hijo, por circunstancias de la vida se quedo sola ahora ella tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a su hijo. Rosaura se dedica desde hace mas de 12 años a trabajar en una empresa muy reconocida en esta ciudad la cual se dedica a la venta de comida rapida que es pollo a  la broster  la empresa se llama Crocan pollo,  Rosaura quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto con su hijo , pero ella nos cuenta que quiere comprarse un horno industrial para poder vender pollo a la broaster, como ella ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el crédito será destinado para la compra de dicho horno que es necesario para realizar su actividad para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                                                                                                                        

Rosaura  nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para la compra de mas maquinas industriales.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosaura Dionicia C. S. is 45 years old and lives in a rental house located in the section of the city of Tarija where the bus terminal is located. Rosaura is a single mother with one child. Due to life’s circumstances, she ended up alone and now has to work so that her son can get ahead. For more than 12 years, Rosaura has worked at a well-known business in the city – a fast food restaurant that sells roasted chicken called “Crocan Pollo”.

Rosaura wants to earn more income so that she and her son can get ahead, but she says that she wants to buy an industrial oven so that she can sell roasted chickens. She has the experience in this business and will buy the needed oven that will allow her to increase her income.

Rosaura says that she wants to improve her living conditions and will use her next loan to buy more industrial machines.

loans.use: Purchase an industrial oven for roasting chickens

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 59 años, natural del distrito de Quimbiri es una señora muy alegre y trabajadora, vive sola en su propia casa ya que todos sus hijos ejercieron una carrera y son independientes. Rosa, es una mujer muy laboriosa con su arduo trabajo pudo educar a sus 04 hijos y sacar profesional a cada uno de ellos. La bodega de Rosa es la primera en abrirse en su barrio situado en el distrito de Quimbiri, abre las puertas de su negocio desde las 06 de la mañana y ya están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lleva 27 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela adquirir un puesto dentro del mercado situado en su propio distrito y así hacer crecer su negocio. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a las compañeras de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 59 years old and a native of the District of Quimbiri. She is a cheerful hardworking woman who lives alone in own home since all of her children have their own careers and are independent. Rosa worked very hard to provide her four children an education and help each one become a professional. Her store is the first establishment that opens in her neighborhood in the District of Quimbiri. She opens the doors of her business at 6am and is ready to welcome her first customers. They know that Rosa’s store offers a variety of merchandise, so they have no hesitation in buying since she provides everything they need. Rosa has been in this business for 27 years and considers the most difficult part to be remaining at her store all day and not having the opportunity to leave. In the future, she wants to acquire a shop at the local market and grow her business.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Rosa hopes to complete her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank. She is well-respected since she keeps the group organized. The loan of 1000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more merchandise to keep her store in business.

loans.use: Purchase more products for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional stock of home utensils

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el caserío Cruceta, uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que se encuentra ubicada a casi cinco horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con un pequeño taller instalado en su domicilio en donde elabora diversos trabajos de imprenta y serigrafía en todo tipo de materiales como tarjetas, polos, sellos etc. Actualmente su negocio cuenta con bastante acogida debido a la campaña electoral que se vive en todo el país. Adicionalmente su esposo trabaja como pintor y también cuentan con un equipo de sonido el cual alquilan para amenizar diversas actividades sociales.

Ana María desea contar con dinero para poder comprar útiles escolares a sus menores hijos, los cuales ya empezaron a estudiar en la escuela local, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles. Ella es una mujer que siempre trabaja dando lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Maria, 31, lives with her husband and their two children in the town of Cruceta, one of the towns that make up the rural district of Tambogrande, a semitropical region of Peru, about five hours from the city of Chiclayo.  

Ana Maria operates a small home-based printing and silkscreening business for all kinds of things from business cards to clothing to stamps.  Demand for her printing services is especially high now because of the upcoming national elections.  Her husband works as a painter and operates a business renting sound equipment for parties and other events.  

Ana Maria is applying for a loan so that she can buy the supplies her children need for the school year that has just started.  She needs 500 new soles from Edpyme Alternative to buy what they need.  Ana Maria works hard to support her family and make the best life she can for them.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en: Mediatrice is 40 years old and has 7 children aged 1 to 13 years old. Mediatrice has owned a boutique for 13 years. She is requesting a loan to buy additional inventory and, with the profits, she hopes to build a home for her family

loans.use: to buy more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand her business by buying a table and 4 chairs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou G., 42, is only a high school graduate, but right now she manages her own micro business. She is married to Romy, a worker at an upholstery shop, and mothers her three children, who are studying in public elementary and high schools nearby.

Marilou runs her own sari-sari (variety) store located in an extension of their house. Every day she observes the buying patterns of her customers and notes down their preferences in terms of the type of item they buy, the price, and the brand. She sees to it that her customers get what they deserve. Monthly, she earns an estimated net income of around 12,000 PHP.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 44,000 PHP loan. As needed, she will buy more stocks of rice, soft drinks, and other grocery items to meet the demands of her customers. 

Marilou dreams of making her sari-sari store grow. 

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Perry

texts.en:
Perry O. is 54 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. He is from the village of Gata Daku in Clarin municipality, a part of Misamis Occidental province in the Mindano islands. Perry plants and harvests coconuts to sell. He has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Perry joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services.  He is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to finance labor costs for his farm’s maintenance and to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Perry from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to finance labor costs for his farm’s maintenance and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Segundo Wilmer

texts.es:
Segundo es un hombre soltero de 29 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Reque a unos 15 minutos de la  provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona es rural y la actividad que desarrollan sus pobladores es la agricultura y ganadería.

Segundo se dedica ha manejar su mototaxi (transporte utilizado por las personas en rutas pequeñas), en la tarde en su distrito, ya que en las mañanas se dedica ha las labores agrícolas, ya quecuenta conunos terrenos donde siembra verduras y una vez que cosecha lo vende a diferentes comerciantes que se dedican a la venta de verduras en los mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Sus ingresos es para ayudar en las obligaciones diariasd de la casa de sus padres. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para brindar algunas mejoras en su terreno de cultivo con elque cuenta, para la compra de abonos para preparar sus tierras y empezar a sembrar y  brindar mantenimiento a su mototaxi que es su herramienta de trabajo, la cual también le permite movilizarse más rápido a ver sus terrenos.  Segundo es una persona muy responsable y trabajador que con esfuerzo trata de salir adelante y darle algunas comodidades a sus padres que siempre lo han ayudado en todo momento.
texts.en:
Segundo is a single man, 29 years old, and he lives with his parents. It is equipped with running water and electricity and it is located in the district of Reque, at about 15 minutes from the provide of Chiclayo. This is a rural region and the population are involved in agriculture and farming.

Segundo drives his motorcycle transport (a transport used by passengers for short distances) in the afternoons in his district. In the mornings he carries out his agricultural work. He has a few plots of land where he plants vegetables. Once he does the harvest he sells his products to the merchants who sell vegetables at the markets in the city of Chiclayo. His earnings are used to help with the daily obligations incurred by his parents' household.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles to provide a few improvements to his farm land. He will purchase fertilizers to prepare his land and to start planting. He will also provide some maintenance to his motorcycle transportation, which is his work tool. He also uses it to travel faster to check on his fields. Segundo is a very responsible and hardworking person who tries to move forward through his invested effort and to provide his parents with a few comforts. They have always been his support.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance on his motorcycle and to purchase fertilizer for his farm land

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Nimfa has a retail shop that sells canned goods, eggs, noodles & snacks. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy eggs, snacks & canned goods.

Nimfa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nimfa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy eggs, snacks & canned goods

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has two children.

In 2000, Alaa opened his shop where he sells cars accessories and decorates wedding cars. He has more than ten years' experience and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1800 loan to make an advertising light box for his shop. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To make an advertising light box for his shop.

loans.name: Baida

texts.en: G., is 45 year old she, has six children, four of them are in school. Her husband is also a businessman. She sells beer, sugar, rice, etc. She wants to expand her business and paying school fees

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Ahlonkoba

texts.fr: Revendeuse de sacs et habits friperie à BAGUIDA, Ahlonkoba revend à toutes personnes après avoir acheté à Lomé. Elle veut ce premier cycle pour acheter des habits et sacs. Elle est mariée à un électricien et ils ont 03 enfants. Elle a démarré en 2001.
texts.en: A retailer of bags and used clothing in BAGUIDA, Ahlonkoba sells to anyone after having made her purchases in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She wants this initial (loan) cycle to buy clothing and handbags. She is married to an electrician, and they have three children. She began in 2001.

loans.use: to buy bags and clothing

loans.name: Rajabmoh

texts.ru: Ражабмох проживает в районе Дангара. Ей 51 год. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она пенсионерка, ее муж тоже в пенсии. Ражабмох занимается торговлей. Она пять лет назад открыла продуктовый магазин. На сегодняшний день она продолжает свою деятельность. Ее дети тоже занимаются торговлей. Она берет кредит для покупки чая, сахара, напитков, сливочного масла, конфет, печенья и макарон.
texts.en: Rajabmoh lives in Dangara. She is 51 years old. She is married. She has two children. She and her husband are retired. Rajabmoh works in trade. Five years ago, she opened a grocery store. Today she continues to work there.  Her children also work in trade. She is taking out a loan to buy tea, sugar, beverages, butter, chocolates, crackers, and pasta.

loans.use: to buy tea, sugar, beverages, butter, chocolates, crackers, and pasta.

loans.name: Kalaytu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Kalaytu. She is married and has four children, ages 5, 10, 12, and 20. All of her children attend school. She has one additional dependent who lives with her: her niece. 

In 2000, Kalaytu established her business doing tailoring and selling football game materials. She gained business experience from her husband; since he is a business man, he coached her on how to run her business. He gave her some starting capital to begin her business. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about 1,140,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Kalaytu  has already received and successfully repaid one loan. She will use the new loan to buy wool thread (20 bundles @ 30,000 SLL), footballs (5 doz @ 60,000 SLL), padlocks (20 doz @ 7,000 SLL), and nylon thread (10 bundles @ 30,000 SLL). She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 225,000 SLL.  

Kalaytu is quite sure that this money will help her improve her business gradually. In the future, she plans to educate her children to the university level with the support of her husband. She wants her children to be able to take care of them when they retire. 

The rainy season is a threat to her business. Competition is average, but she normally overcomes her competitors due to her customer service. She serves the entire Makeni community. Her suppliers are located at Guinea Conakry and Freetown, where she travels by vehicle twice a week. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase wool thread, footballs, padlocks, and nylon thread

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Venera's Group

texts.en:
Venera is the treasurer of this group. She is 37 and married to a joiner. Together with her husband, she brings up three daughters, all of whom are at school. Venera works as a flute teacher at the music school. A year ago, with an initial investment of 20,000 soms she started to sell grocery goods at home. Her monthly profit from the trade is 5,000 soms. She applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds to purchase sugar, oil and macaroni for trade. In the future with the profits gained from the trade, Venera wants to purchase furniture to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, oil and macaroni to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, age 37, is engaged in farming along with her husband. They plant rice on their land and sell their harvest at the market. They have four children between the ages of 14 and 21.

Marilou does her best to help support her husband and children. She has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and other farm inputs. 

She is confident that investing in their farm in this way will help to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rysbu's Group

texts.en: Rysbu is the leader of this group. She is 45 and married to a constructor. Together, they have raised two sons and a daughter. The older son earns money by providing mobile repairing services, and the other two children live independently from their parents. Eight years ago, with an initial investment of 15,000 soms, Rysbu purchased a cow; since that time, they have bred cattle for making additional money to meet the family's needs. With money received from the loan, she plans to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future, she plans to purchase a piece of land to start building a house. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 44 years old and lives in Lubogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She  is married with seven children. 

Marites has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more fish to sell

Marites has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Marites hopes to have a big capital.so that they can earn money for their children. Marites is a MIGS member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a fish monger at Elmina. She also moves through the small market (in the picture above) selling local drinks that she makes. She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is a driver. She is responsible by assisting her partner in providing the basic needs of the home.  Her loan will be used to procure fresh fish and ingredients to make drinks to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a shop.

loans.use: to procure fresh fish and ingredients to make drinks to sell.

loans.name: Maria Deysi

texts.es:
María tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera.  Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Distrito de Tambogrande en el departamento de Piura, en una zona rural, la cual cuenta con servicios básicos.

La actividad que realiza María,  es la crianza de ganado porcino y aves de corral los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local, también los sacrifica para vender en carne. Realiza esta  actividad desde hace más de 3 años en una parte posterior de su casa. 
También se dedica a la agricultura contando con 1 has de terreno agrícola el cual tiene sembrado de limón.  Este terreno le fue entregado por su padre como herencia.

María es una mujer emprendedora, y para poder realizar sus actividades ha decidido obtener un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, esto con la finalidad de comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ganado y aves, con lo cual obtendrá un buen peso y tamaño de sus animales para luego venderlos a un mejor precio y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
María, 36, is single.  She lives in her own house located in Tambogrande district in Piura Department, a rural zone that has basic utilities.

María’s activity is raising pigs and barnyard fowl that she fattens up for subsequent sale in the local market; she also butchers them to sell the meat.  She’s been carrying out this line of work for over 3 years in her back yard.   She also farms.  She has a one hectare plot of farmland planted with lemons.  She got this lot as an inheritance from her father.

María is an enterprising woman and in order to be able to do her activities has decided to get a 600 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her livestock and fowl so that they will attain good size and weight so that they can be sold later for a better price and she can continue to grow in the business.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Matlyuba

texts.ru: Матлюба проживает в районе Джиликул. Ей 24 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее дети маленькие, а муж находится в России. Сама Матлюба занимается выращиванием овощей для торговли. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений, чтобы получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Matlyuba lives in the Jilikul region. She is 24 years old. She is married with two children. Her children are small, but her husband is in Russia. Matlyuba grows vegetables for sale. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer in order to have a good harvest.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en: Maurine is a hardworking 20-year-old married lady with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has a family goal of educating her children. She has been running a cosmetics business for a period of five years. Maurine started this business with capital of only 150,000 UGX and now has capital of 600,000 UGX. She is facing challenges of price fluctuation and inflation; however, she has a dream of moving her business to a permanent location. Maurine needs a loan facility to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta lives in Ijevan city. She is 43 years old, separated and has two daughters. Her older daughter is married and lives separately, and the younger one, who is jobless, lives with Julieta.

For several years Julieta worked in the Ijevan carpet company. Since 1995, she has been involved in the clothes-trading business. She sells women and children’s clothes and shoes from a rented stall in Ijevan market. Julieta buys her merchandise three times a month from Yerevan. 

Thanks to her business income Julieta paid for her daughters’ education, organized her older daughter's wedding and provides for her family. Julieta has had four loans from Nor Horizon. Now she is asking for an 800,000 AMD loan to buy winter clothes, outerwear and high boots to sell.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes, outerwear and high boots to sell.

loans.name: Sirozhidin

texts.ru: Сирожидин более 7 лет занимается откармливанием скота. Он очень трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. Сирожидин имеет дружную семью, и его сыновья помогают ему в бизнесе, а жена занимается домохозяйством. Сирожидин старается хорошо ухаживать за скотом чтоб они набрали хороший вес для того чтобы он смог продать их за  выгодную цену. Мясо основное блюдо населения и он сможет продать откормленный скот под праздники за хорошую выгоду. Сирожидин хотел бы получить займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Sirozhidin has been raising cattle for over seven years. He is a very hard-working and goal-oriented person. He has a tight-knit family. His sons help him in the business, and his wife is a homemaker. Sirozhidin tries to take good care of his cattle so that the animals would gain more weight and he could sell them at a good profit. Meat is a staple product, and with the upcoming holidays he will be able to sell his well-fed cattle at a good price. Sirozhidin would like to receive a loan to buy more cattle and expand his business. He hopes for your help and thanks you in advance for your kind  assistance.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en:
Hakim is a twenty-one year-old married man with three children living in Kasese,Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. He has been running a retail business for ten years which he started with capital of UGX one hundred thousand and now has capital of over UGX two million. 

His major challenge is high fuel and transportation costs. However, he has a vision of expanding his business into new areas. The purpose of the loan is to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Etevise

texts.en: "Etevise is 19 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, flour, vegetable oil, and a frying pan. In the future,Etevise hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services."

loans.use: to buy buy weed spray, chemicals, bush knives, filings and a crowbar

loans.name: Maa Mauli Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Biswaprabha, the lady standing first from right, and her husband run a poultry farm. Hailing from a small village in Sonepur district, they have been involved in this business for the past nine years. First, she purchases chicks from the local seller, then the caring process goes on for 3-4 months. After that hens are ready to sell. 

Biswaprabha is looking for a loan to expand her poultry. She has estimated the expenses item-wise and is confident that she will be able to get a good income if she can invest this amount. She feels it is easy to run a poultry farm as there's not much of effort that goes into taking care of the chicks. Since this poultry farm is the family's only source of income, Biswaprabha would want this business to flourish and do well.

Biswaprabha, along with her group, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR from which she will use her portion to buy chicks, feeds, and medicines.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feeds, and medicines.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Madam Beauty L., born on September 3, 1961 at Akoumapé in the prefecture of VO, is issued from a numerous and poor family. She is married and mother of one child with two (02) dependants. Her husband, a plumbing master without stable employment, exercises this activity from which he draws very difficultly income to help his wife to face the family expenditures. This Madam L. was launched in the small table trade, then progressively she succeeded to open a shop which she manages very well despite she is illiterate (neither read, nor write). Honest and full of trusty, she repaid promptly her two first credits without incident. She deserves to be backed financially to increase her trade and draw great profit to the family needs. So, this credit of $1000 she is requesting will serve to supply her shop of rice, sugar, milk, soap and other essential produces to resell them in this period of good businesses of end year feasts. This will strengthen the profitability of her activity and will enormously contribute to the family living conditions improvement.

Madame L. Beauty, née le 3 septembre 1961 à Akoumapé dans le Vo, est issue d’une famille nombreuse et très pauvre. Elle est mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant avec 2 personnes à sa charge. Son mari, un maître plombier sans emploi fixe, exerce cette activité dont il tire très difficilement un revenu pour aider sa femme à faire face aux dépenses de la famille. Madame L. s’est lancée alors dans le petit commerce de table, puis progressivement elle est arrivée à ouvrir une boutique qu’elle gère très bien malgré qu’elle soit analphabète (ne sait ni lire, ni écrire). Honnête et pleine de confiance, elle a su rembourser promptement ses deux premiers crédits sans incident. Elle mérite d’être appuyée financièrement pour accroître son commerce et en tirer grand profit aux besoins de famille. Ainsi donc, ce crédit de $ 1000 qu’elle sollicite servira à approvisionner sa boutique de riz, sucre, lait, savon et autres produits de première nécessité pour revendre en cette période de bonnes affaires des fêtes de fin d’année. Ceci renforcera la rentabilité de son activité et de facto, contribuera énormément l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, soap and other essential produces

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles M. is 34 years. He is married and has one child. He also takes care of two of her sister’s children, Millicent 18 years and Nelly 17 years, both in high school. He assists in paying their school fees. The sister succumbed to illness in the year 2004. She was not legally married.

Charles only managed to get education up to high school level. Due to the increased unemployment in Kenya and lack of fees for college, he only managed to get a casual job in the juakali sector. Through this he learned various skills, including the spraying of cars. He worked in the garage for seven years. All this time he had been saving a bit of the little money he got as wages. It is while working at the garage that he together with his colleagues came up with the idea of opening their own garage. With their little saving and their varied skills, they managed to buy simple basic tools to start up. It is then that they opened Walsam garage at a road reserve near Fort Jesus in Kibera slums. They have been operating there for the last three years.

Charles and his friends have had constraints in their tools at work. They have no spraying machine at the garage. They are forced to hire a machine at a cost of USD 7 for every vehicle they spray. Besides that, they have to book the machine a day in advance. Sometimes they do not get the machine, which forces the vehicles to stay longer at the garage, which often results in loss of business. A loan of USD 200 in kind, in form of a vehicle spraying machine will them to maintain more customers. He intends to train other boys within the Kibera slums on vehicle repair skills. This will reduce their chance of getting into crime and drugs as well as opening up for them employment opportunities. The loan is repayable within 12 – 18 months.

loans.use: Purchase of a spray painting machine for vehicles

loans.name: Anne Dorothy

texts.en:
Anne is a married woman with two children aged 2.5 years and 7 months. She operates a hair salon business in a town suburb. She has been in this business for six years.

Ann, a professional teacher, managed to start the salon business with money she saved. The extra income has helped to improve the standard of living of the family.

Anne's salon is located near Makerere University and has a high number of student clients. Private entrepreneurs have opened up hostels to accommodate the increasing number of students at the university. This has increased the demand for her services.

She needs to improve her services by stocking more cosmetics and improving the place of work. She wishes to borrow $675 to buy more cosmetics. In the future, she hopes to borrow more funds to purchase better salon equipment to serve more clients.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics for hair salon

loans.name: Julpa

texts.fr: Madame Julpa L. est âgée de 44 ans est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vend de la sucrerie. Elle cherche à augmenter le niveau de son commerce par l'achat des caisses de sucrerie supplémentaires et de 2 glacières et chaque de la glace. Les glacières permettront de conserver les boissons fraiches et attireront les clients.  Pour réaliser son projet, elle sollicite un prêt de 650 dollars. C'est une femme dynamique et pleine de volonté qui mérite d'être encouragée dans sa volonté d'améliorer les conditions de sa vie et celle de sa famille.

loans.use: Achat des caisses de sucrerie, de 2 glacières et de la, glace

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her business.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Mr. Anthony O. is 35 years old, single, and lives in the town of Asaba, Delta State. He learned to be a butcher from his father, and started his own butcher business in 1996. He is requesting a loan of $1,175 to enable him to buy cows for meat sales. He is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more cows for sale

loans.name: Tajudeen

texts.en: Tajudeen R. is 35 years old, married and has 4 children. She hails from Ajamgbadin in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a stylist and also rents out DVD's. She has been a LAPO member for 2 years and needs the loan to buy generator.  This, she said, will help her serve her customer better. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy a generator

loans.name: Werdi Laksana Group

texts.id:
This group was formed because there is a desire from several members of the society to diligently rear pigs more seriously and with better management.  Previously, they heard of animal rearing groups based on Dinari Foundation, which receive instruction and funding capital.  With 7 members, this group is headed by Ni Kadek Sumarni and is named Kelompok Werdi Laksana.
 Kelompok Werdi Laksana obtained good and proper instruction and training on how to rear pigs, financial management, and methods of warding off diseases.  When the knowledge of the members is adequate, Kelompok Werdi Laksana received a loan, which will be used to purchase superior quality piglets and quality supplies.  This is in order to achieve the maximum output from the level of quality as compared rearing local pigs.
 Having the construction and support from the funding loan, kelompok Werdi Laksana is optimistic that they will be able to materialize a successful business.

 Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer. 

Kelompok ini terbentuk karena adanya keinginan dari beberapa anggota masyarakat untuk menekuni usaha ternak babi lebih serius dan dengan manajemen yang baik. Sebelumnya mereka sudah mendengar tentang kelompok ternak bentukkan Yayasan Dinari yang mendapat binaan dan pinjaman modal. Dengan anggota sebanyak 7 orang, kelompok ini diketuai oleh Ni Kadek Sumarni dan diberi nama Kelompok Werdi Laksana.
Kelompok Werdi Laksana mendapat pembinaan dan pelatihan tentang cara beternak babi yang baik dan benar, manajemen keuangan dan tata cara penanggulangan penyakit. Setelah pengetahuan anggota cukup, Kelompok Werdi Laksana mendapat pinjaman modal yang akan dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit babi unggul dan pakan yang berkwalitas. Hal itu dimaksudkan agar hasil yang didapatkan akan lebih maksimal dari sekedar memelihara babi jenis lokal.
Dengan adanya pembinaan dan didukung oleh pinjaman dana, kelompok Werdi Laksana optimis akan dapat melaksanakan usahanya dengan sukses.

loans.use: Purchase superior quality piglets and quality supplies (Membeli  bibit babi jenis unggul dan pakan berkwalitas)

loans.name: A. Jocelyne

texts.fr:
A. Jocelyne A. was born on May 9, 1976 in Cotonou (Littoral District). She is married and the mother of two. She sells clothing, shoes, and undergarments that she acquires in Lomé, in the neighboring republic of Togo. Her husband teaches in a private school and earns very little, which doesn't allow him to be the sole provider for his family. So she must help with family expenses. The income from her business enables her to meet family needs. She is waiting for this loan, which would build up her working capital to increase her revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 09/05/1976 à cotonou dans le LITTORAL, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des vêtements, des chaussures et des dessous qu’elle achète à Lomé dans la république voisine du TOGO.Son époux instituteur dans une école privée a un faible revenu qui ne lui permet pas de subvenir seul aux besoins de la famille. Elle doit participer aux dépenses familiales .Le revenu issu de son activité lui permet de répondre aux sollicitations de la famille. Elle attend ce crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin d'augmenter son revenu.

loans.use: To buy 12 women's dresses, 20 men's suits, 12 pairs of women's shoes, and 20 pairs of men's shoes.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa C. V. is a member of the “San Rafael” microfinance institute. Her business is located in the district of San Rafael, Bellavista province, in the department of San Martín. She has been selling homemade cheese for a living for a year and a half. She produces between 30 to 35 cheeses a day.

With the loan of S/. 2,000.00, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a new refrigerator, since the one she currently has is no longer in good condition. This piece of equipment is vital to her business for the proper storage of her cheese.

Rosa is 42 years of age and has 2 children. She learned cheesemaking at a young age from her parents. Now, she is putting her skills to use. Her desire is to set up a business space next year so that she can make her cheese because she is doing it from home for now.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa C. V. es socia del Banco Comunal “San Rafael” tiene su negocio ubicado en el distrito de San Rafael, provincia de Bellavista, departamento de San Martín, ella se dedica a la elaboración casera y venta de quesos, es un negocio que inicio desde hace un año y medio diariamente producen entre de 30 a 35 quesos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 el caul pagara en 6 meses, comprara una nueva refrigeradora, ya que la que tiene actualmente no esta en muy buenas condiciones, ya que este es un equipo muy importante en su negocio para la buena conservación de los quesos.

Rosa tiene 42 años y 02 hijos, aprendió a elaborar quesos desde muy pequeña junto a sus padres, ahora esta poniendo en practica lo aprendido, tiene como aspiración hasta el próximo año implementar un local para la elaboración exclusiva de estos productos ya que por ahora lo esta realizando en su propia casa.

loans.use: Purchase of refrigerator

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is thirty four years old and married with three children. Her children are currently in school. She sells onions and iodated salt to her community folks.

Mary is not able to buy and stock more salt and onions due to her low working capital. She frequently travels to Kumasi to buy her products. But the frequent travel reduces her income and working capital. She therefore wants to use this loan to buy more bags of iodated salt and sacks of onions.

She a proud member of the group called Gold. The group members uses peer pressure on members to repay the loan on time.

Mary is seen above displaying her products.

loans.use: To buy more bags of iodated salt and sacks of onions

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma, age 21, is married with a 5 month old baby. She sells clothing and coconuts and began this business a year and a half ago. She works from 8am to 2pm daily and makes a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

Fatma hopes for a loan to purchase more clothing and coconuts for her business. She belongs to loan group Tushikamano whose members guarantee one another to pay back loans.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts and clothing

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou C., age 42, is married and has four children, one of whom is in her care, in addition to her grandson. She has been a member of the village bank of Simbandi Brassou for six and a half years. She sells medicines and ice cream, which is made starting with monkey bread (baobab fruit), bissap (hibiscus flower), and sugar. She is the matron of her village. She gets her stock of medicines at the health district. She wants a loan that will help her to contribute better to community health (given the frequent shortages of medicines in the village) and to the support of her family. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Aissatou C., 42 ans, mariée, mère de 04 enfants dont 01 en charge en plus de son petit fils est membre du banc villageois de Simbandi Brassou depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle vends des médicaments et des crèmes glaces fait à partir du pain de singe, bissap et du sucre. Elle est la matrone de son village elle s’approvisionne en médicament au niveau du district sanitaire. Elle veut un prêt qui l’aidera à mieux participer à la santé communautaire avec les ruptures de médicaments fréquentes au niveau du village et à l'entretien de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To sell refreshments and medicines

loans.name: Susana Aída

texts.es:
Susana is a hardworking woman. With the help of her husband, who works as a miner, she was able to open a small store and achieve her dream of having her own business without having to leave her work in the country. Susana now wants to set up a space with arcade games for the diversion of her neighbors. This way she can set up a new project with her oldest son who helps her in his free time when he’s not studying. One of her limitations is that she does not have sufficient money to defray the costs of this project. We therefore hope that you can help with Susana’s request.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Susana es una mujer muy trabajadora que con el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja como minero, pudo abrir una pequeña tienda, y consolidar su sueño de un negocio propio, sin dejar de lado el trabajo en el campo. Sin embargo, Susana ahora desea poder tener aparte, un espacio con juegos de tragamonedas para la distracción de sus vecinos y así iniciar un nuevo proyecto junto a su hijo mayor quien le ayuda las veces que está libre y fuera de sus estudios. Pero una de sus limitaciones es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para costear los gastos de este proyecto. Esperamos entonces que usted pueda atender la solicitud de doña Susana.

loans.use: Investment capital for a new project.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children, ages 15, 14 and 3. She has owned a small food vending store since 2004. She works from 6am to10pm at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Salama now hopes for a loan to buy more food items such as rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables, and bananas for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items to increase her stock.

loans.name: Tiba Juma Bilaly's Diamond Group

texts.en:
Tiba J. B. is 38 years old and married. She has no children yet. She owns a general store in an area called Tabatawhere where she sells food, soap, charcoal, and other items. She opened her shop in 2006. She works daily from 6 am to 9 pm and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $260.

Tiba has received two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania and has paid them back successfully. She used them to open a material shop where she makes clothes. She intends to use this third loan for the same purpose.

Tiba is part of subgroup A of the Diamond Group. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. Her fellow group members sell clothes, fish, and charcoal. In the picture, Tiba is the second from the left.

loans.use: To expand her material and fabrics shop.

loans.name: Enith

texts.es: Enith, mujer decidida y de mucha energía física, en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comida, y gracias a su buena atención y amabilidad cuenta con variada clientela que degustan de su buena sazón. Se siente satisfecha con este negocio, sin embargo, extraña su anterior rutina como instructora aeróbica, la misma que dejó por falta de máquinas y otros motivos.Ahora se trazó el propósito de implementar un pequeño gimnasio con máquinas nuevas y desde luego brindar la comodidad a sus clientes que requieren de este servicio para mantenerse en forma. Y para poder realizar lo que quiere necesariamente requiere de un préstamo.
texts.en:
Enith is determined woman with lots of physical energy. She currently works selling food, and thanks to her great service and friendliness she has a variety of customers who enjoy her flavors. She feels satisfied in this business; however, she misses her former routine as an aerobics instructor, which she had to quit because of a lack of equipment. Now she has drawn up a plan to install a small gym with new equipment, and from then on give her customers the comfort they need to stay in shape.
