To be able to achieve what she wants, she needs a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a small gym

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.fr: Le jeune Jean Baptiste M. expolite un restaurant à Kadior sur le croisement Tiléne. Sa position est stratégique d'où une clientéle nombreuses. C'est pourquoi il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer ses activités de restauration.
texts.en:
Young Jean Baptiste M. runs a little restaurant in Kadior at the Tiléne crossroads. His location is strategic so he has numerous customers. This is why he is requesting this loan to reinforce his food service business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to reinforce his food service business

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
La señora María Antonia R. es originaria del municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León donde se dedica a atender su propia pulpería el cual la inauguró desde hace 15 años con pocos recursos económicos y realizando pocas ventas. 

Es madre de un hijo el cual ha beneficiado brindándole los estudios para su desarrollo siendo su mayor anhelo que su hijo llegue a ser un gran profesional. 
Su negocio se ha venido desarrollando poco a poco y esto gracias al apoyo de Ceprodel el cual le ha permitido la compra de sus productos para su respectiva comercialización y hoy en día una vez más espera que su crédito sea otorgado para que de esta manera continúe con el desarrollo familiar y del negocio.
texts.en:
María Antonia R. is from the municipality of Telica in the city of León , where she has her own general store, which she opened 15 years ago with few economic resources and making few sales. She is the mother of one child, who she has helped with his studies, for his development. It is her greatest longing that her son becomes a professional. Her business has been developing little by little, and this is thanks to the support of Ceprodel, which has permitted her to buy the products that she sells. Today once more she hopes that a loan will be granted so she can continue in this way with the development of her family and the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Taing

texts.en:
Taing R. is 26 years old, married, and has two children. Both of her children are young and go to primary school. Her husband, Bin Say, 29, is a fisherman. She and her family live in Kompong Tom Province.

She is a local farmer who specializes in growing both rice and vegetables. She has been widely known in the business for over seven years, earning approximately $1.50 per day. R. is requesting a loan to purchase two cows to help her with the farming.

loans.use: Purchase two cows

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: OSCAR ESTA CASADO CON LA SRA. SANDRA DELGADILLO. TIENEN DOS HIJOS: 19 Y 9 AÑOS. POSEEN UN BIEN INMUEBLE PROPIO EN EL CUAL SE ENCUENTRA FUNCIONANDO EL NEGOCIO. OSCAR PRESTA LOS   SERVICIOS DE CERRAJERIA, BICICLETERIA Y GOMERIA,  LA CONYUGUE ATIENDE EL NEGOCIO DE COMIDA QUE TIENE INSTALADO EN SU DOMICILIO, AMBOS ATIENDEN SUS NEGOCIOS HACE 18 AÑOS APROXIMADAMENTE. LA COMPETENCIA ES ALTA, PERO LA ANTIGÜEDAD, EXPERIENCIA, CALIDAD Y  RAPIDEZ EN EL SERVICIO PRESTADO, LES HA PERMITIDO SER CONOCIDOS EN LA ZONA Y EN EL BARRIO, POR LO QUE CUENTAN CON MUCHA CLIENTELA. EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA INCREMENTAR EL CAPITAL DE OPERACIONES DEL NEGOCIO Y LA COMPRA DE UNA NUEVA COMPRESORA. CUARTO PRESTAMO  AL QUE ACCEDE EL CLIENTE, CON EXCELENTE COMPORTAMIENTO Y PUNTUALIDAD EN SUS PAGOS. NO REGISTRA UN SOLO DIA DE MORA EN NINGUNA CUOTA DE LOS CREDITOS OTORGADOS.
texts.en:
Oscar is married to Mrs. Sandra Delgadillo. They have two children ages 19 and 9. They own their own building where their business is located. Oscar provides locksmith service, a bicycle shop, and a tire repair shop. His wife has a food business in their home. They both have attended to their respective businesses for approximately 18 years. Their competence is high, but their longevity, experience, quality and fast service has enable them to become known in the area and neighborhood so they have many customers. The loan will be used to increase their working capital and buy a new compressor. This is the fourth loan to be given to this client, who has been excellent and punctual in his payments. He has never been a day late on any payment of his previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica S., 44, the mother of two girls and three boys, four in school and one not yet of school age, lives with the family in Koforidua, a small farming and commercial town close to Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband works with the transport union in her community.

Monica trades in bananas, purchasing them from farmers in the nearby villages, ripening and then selling them to retailers in her community in the local market. She also at times sells roasted groundnuts by the roadside. Monica has been in business for over 15 years, and it has been her dream to save enough money to support her husband in caring for the family. She therefore is requesting a loan to procure bananas in bulk in order to maximize her profit margin, hoping to thereby sponsor her children’s ongoing education.

loans.use: To procure bananas in bulk.

loans.name: Donoi

texts.en: Donoi T. is 37 years old and her business is the retail sales of footwear at the wholesale market in the Leova district. As winter is now virtually at an end, she needs to buy shoes for the spring season. The demand for winter shoes is low and T. earns nothing but she still must rent her table at the market. T. has requested a loan from MicroInvest to buy merchandise for the spring season.  In the future, T. would also like to buy clothing to sell during the spring season. This loan will help T. increase her future sales..

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience D. is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. She says with the help of God, all her children attend school. She owns and operates a grocery store and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, and biscuits, and baby products like napkins, feeding bottles, etc. in her neighborhood. She lives in Dome in the Ashanti region of Ghana. With her nine years of experience and through this business Patience has supported the family. Fortunately, her business is positioned at a strategic location within the town where she lives. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. Patience belongs to a village bank called ‘Sunkwa,’ which means ‘Pray for Life’. She hopes to receive 900 GHS to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Umbelina

texts.es:
Umbelina es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.
Umbelina es casada, tiene 63 años y 6 hijos, Umbelina tiene un puesto en el mercado Mariscal Cáceres en donD. venD. mercerías, que adquiere en L. ciudad D. Lima, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Umbelina necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. lanas, loceria.
Los sueños D. Umbelina son aumentar su negocio y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Umbelina is a member of the El Roble (The Oak) Communal Bank. She is 63 years of age, married and has six children. She has a stand in the Mariscal Cáceres market where she sells sewing supplies which she obtains in the city of Lima. She does this every day. Umbelina needs a loan of 1,000 Sols that will be invested in the purchase of woolens and crockery. Umbelina dreams of being able to build up her business and fix up her house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy woolens and crockery

loans.name: Mirsabeth

texts.es:
La señora Mirsabeth, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Vencedoras de Villa Universitaria”, vive en el Jr. Salaverry Nº 167, Distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 28 años y es madre 05 hijos, que todavía depende de ella.

Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia. Inicio su negocio con la venta de Anticuchos y nos cuenta que le va muy bien. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio vendiendo comidas preparadas, asados y juanes, ubicada en la vereda de su casa, donde vende a los moradores de la comunidad, amigos y vecinos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 400.00 que cancelara a plazo de 04 meses, desea invertirlo, ampliando e implementando su negocio, y comprar más mesas, sillas, vasos y ollas, e insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos.
Ella mayormente toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. Hoy se siente más independiente y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y en los actos de su vida diaria.

Mirsabeth, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer y apoyar a otras mujeres que quieren emprender su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Mirsabeth is a member of the communal bank, “Las Vencedoras de Villa Universitaria.” She lives at Jr. Salaverry Nº 167, in the Tarapoto neighborhood, in the department of San Martín. She is single, 28 years old, and the mother of 5 children who are all still dependents. By her own initiative, she began her business selling beef hearts, with a loan of 300.00 soles. She tells us that it is going very well. At present, she will continue with the same business, selling prepared foods, roasted food, and “juanes” (similar to tamales). Her business is located on her home’s sidewalk, where she sells to her friends, neighbors, and the inhabitants of the community. She would like to invest in growing her business by buying more tables, chairs, glasses, pots, and supplies for the daily preparation of her food with this loan of 400.00 soles (which she will pay off in 4 months). She makes most of the decisions about the earnings from her business. Today she feels more independent and responsible about making her payments and in the everyday activities of her life Mirsabeth is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businesswoman, and a woman, and for supporting other women who want to start their own businesses

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara insumos para sus alimentos.  Compra de sillas, ollas y otros utencilios de cocina.

loans.name: Bilquis Begum M. Aslam Group

texts.en:
Bilquis begum baji is married to M. A., and they have been living together in Borewala, Pakistan since past 10 years. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community. Bilquis baji runs a clothes sewing business and she takes orders from her neighbors and relatives. She does this work to share the financial burden of her husband. Bilquis baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality. Saleem baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Kosar parveen baji wants a loan to buy paint to sell. 

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Pabla Estela

texts.en:
Mrs. Pabla is 36 years old and married. She has two school-aged children and lives in her own house. Mrs. Pabla is the owner of a tailor shop in a very important neighborhood in Limpio. The business has been open for more than 10 years and she works with her two sisters.

She started working in a tailor shop owned by a Korean citizen and little by little she bought sewing machines with the help of her mother, who died three years ago. With the help of her sisters, she created their own tailor shop, which is the pride of the family. She thanks the Foundation for the opportunity to buy more machines and to employ local girls as help.

loans.use: The purchase of fabric

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es:
Anatolia es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Anatolia es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijos, Anatolia viaja a las diferentes ferias D. L. región 3 veces por semana en donD. venD. ropa variada, productos que adquiere en L. ciudad D. Lima.
Anatolia necesita un préstamo D. 800 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. ropa para adultos.
Los sueños D. Anatolia son que su hija sea profesional y tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of “Las Gaviotas” community bank. She is 27 years old, lives with her common-law husband and has one child. She travels to different markets in the region three times a week to sell a variety of clothing, which she purchases in the city of Lima. Antonia needs a loan for 800 soles that she will invest in clothing for adults. Antonia dreams of seeing her daughter become a professional and of having her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: clothing

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia T., 30, is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Virgilia owns and operates a business venture in the wholesale sector selling fruits. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits. Virgilia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns ~5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Virgilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Virgilia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza. 
Bernardo es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Bernardo vende productos variados como radios, frazadas, ollas, platos, sus ventas los realiza en las diferentes ferias de la región, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Bernardo necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas y platos.
Bernardo sueña con tener una tienda, una fabrica de ollas.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a member of the Nobleza community bank. He is 42 years old, partnered and the father of 2 children. He sells a variety of products such as radios, blankets, pots and dishes. He buys the products in the city of Ayacucho and sells them in different market fairs in his home region. Bernardo needs a loan of 1500 soles, money that he will use to buy pots and dishes. Bernardo's hope for the future is to own a store and a factory for making pots.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Bertha Cecilia

texts.es: Bertha Cecilia Téllez J. tiene 41 años. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella dio inicio a este negocio con esfuerzo propio para ayudar en los gastos de su familia. A pesar de las dificultades que ha enfrentado le han servido para proporcionarles a sus hijos lo necesario como es el pan de cada día.  Ella prendió este negocio de una manera muy rápida ya que tenía el interés en ganar dinero. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de faldas, camias, pantalones, camisolas y ropa interior. Sus deseos son obtener una tienda en donde sus clientes puedan apreciar todos sus productos.
texts.en:
Bertha Cecilia Téllez J. is 41 years old, and has two dependent children. She sells clothing, which she has done for more than five years. She started this business with her own effort, in order to help with her family's expenses. In spite of the difficulties she has faced, this business has allowed her to give her children the necessities of life, like daily bread.

Her business took off quickly since she is motivated to earn money. She is requesting this loan to use as working capital to buy skirts, shirts, pants, camisoles, and underwear. Her desire is to have a store where her customers can appreciate all her products.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda A., 40 years old from Baseco Compound, Port Area, Manila.  Her husband Rodelito, 47, is a welder.  They have four kids, all attending school.

Imelda has a general store situated just in front of her house.  In front of the store, she also sells cooked foods.  She has been enjoying running her business for the last eight years and now earns close to P18,000.00 a month.   

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2003.  She is now on her 10th loan cycle and has applied for a new loan in the amount of P16,000.00.  She will stock more items to sell at her store to include school supplies.  

She wants to see her general store in the future to be bigger than what it is now so she could help employ some of her neighbors.  She also dreams of opening a restaurant soon.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To stock additional items for her general store including school supplies

loans.name: Rosas Group

texts.es:
Rosas es un grupo de 11 personas que forman parte del Centro Focal Collpani, una de sus integrantes es Elena T. de 54 años, vende carne hace dos años en su mismo domicilio y necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería. Las demás integrantes tambien tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de abarrotes, fruta, café, api, cosméticos, detergentes, tenis, otras se dedican a actividades económicas de producción como es el tejido de manta y chompa.
Todas desean mejorar sus negocios, por lo que necesitan el crédito, algunas comprando mercadería como la carne, fruta de temporada, arroz, fideo, azucar,perfumes, detergentes y otras comprando materia prima como la lana.
texts.en:
Rosas [Roses] is a group of eleven people who make up part of the Collpani Regional Office. Elena T., 54, is one of its members. She has been selling meat in her own house for two years, and she needs a loan to buy merchandise. The rest of the members have their own businesses, including sales of groceries, fruits, coffee, Api [a sweetened corn and cinnamon drink], cosmetics, detergents, and sneakers. Other members are in business producing items such as hand-woven ponchos and sweaters. They all want to improve their businesses, so they need loans, some to buy merchandise like meat, seasonal fruit, rice, noodles, sugar, perfumes, and detergents, and others to buy raw materials, like wool.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and raw materials.

loans.name: Luisa Emilia

texts.es:
En el mercado El Bisne del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Luisa Emilia G. se ha destacado por ser una excelente trabajadora dedicándose al negocio de venta de repuestos de vehículos ofertados en su establecimiento.

Actualmente ella requiere invertir en la compra de los repuestos para ofertarlos y por esto es que ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los repuestos para así continuar mejorando su negocio en su establecimiento.

loans.use: Compra de repuestos para automóviles

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 34 years old and married with two children. He has been working as a farmer since 1994 to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Today, Mohamad is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy an agriculture delivery van to satisfy the demand of the market and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a van

loans.name: Concejo

texts.en:
At the age of 54 and having three children, Mrs. Concejo G. is still looking for another source of income. She is from the village of San Pedro San Pablo, Aurora, Isabela. She is engaged in the business of retailing goods with her small general store. She just started her business one year ago. Concejo is luckily married to her husband named Ysmael. He is a laborer in a buying station in Aurora, Isabela.

Concejo operates her business with faith that she can improve it in time. Her business is her only source of income, and it will help her husband in covering her family’s expenditures. She wanted to borrow the amount of 5,000 PHP for additional capital for her general store. She wants to add some items to sell to be able to increase her income.

loans.use: Additioanl capital to buy more items for her store

location.town: San Pedro San Pablo, Aurora, Isabela

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita D. is from the village of Curvada, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 71 years-old and widowed with one adult child. Anita operates a service-based business providing pedicab services to local community members. Anita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Anita joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Anita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase spare parts. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Anita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen V., 55, is from the city of Mabini Street, Cauayan City.  She  is married and has two adult-aged children.  To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling shoe products in her local community.  Carmen has been in business for over 31 years and earns approximately Php20,000 a month.

In 2009, Carmen joined ASKI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business. She is requesting a new loan of Php20,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  This loan will be her third from ASKI.  Carmen plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 
---------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es:
La señora AUREA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “HUAYNA CCAPAC” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco del Departamento del Cusco. La socia tiene 45 años es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de autopartes de carros. Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivó abrir hace varios años su propio negocio, cuyas ganancias aporta al ingreso económico en su hogar. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para adquirir más autopartes de carros como focos de faros y silicones. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aurea belongs to the community bank of “HUAYNA CCAPAC” of the Arariwa Assoiciation of the provence of Cuzco, of the Department of Cuzco. She is 45 years old and married with two children. This partner alternates her activities in the home with the sale of car auto parts. Her strong character and her longing to complete her dreams, motivated her to open her own business a few years ago. She contributes those earnings to the household expenses. She has been working this business for several years and it has gone well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. This partner of ours is a working and enterprising mother that moves her family forward despite adversities. This partner is requesting a loan in order to obtain more auto parts such as headlights and silicones. She is pleased about the opportunity before her and at the same time is committed to the corresponding timely repayments required.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This partner requests the loan to obtain more auto parts such as headlights and silicones.

loans.name: Pablo Artemio

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 61 años de edad, es soltero vive en casa propia tiene 3 hijos. Pablo se 
dedica a atender el kiosko en un colegio particular de la ciudad. El inició su negocio 
hace 2 años, con un capital pequeño producto de sus ahorros y poco a poco ha ido 
incrementando su negocio, Pablo con los ingresos que obtiene ha costeado los estudios 
de sus hijos, de los cuales la ultima recientemente ha ingresado a la Universidad. El 
atiende el kiosko de manera muy calida y amable ya que se encuentra en contacto con 
niños, su menor hija le ayuda a la atención del kiosko, ahorra al máximo el dinero que 
obtiene de las ventas del kiosko el cual lo vuelve a invertir. El sueño a futuro de 
Pablo es poder tener mayores ingresos y así poderle brindar una buena educación a su 
menor hija. Solicita el crédito para la mejora de su vivienda la cual fue afectada por 
el terremoto.
texts.en:
Pablo is 61 years old, single, and lives in his own home. He has three children. Pablo attends to a kiosk in a private school in the city. He started this business 2 years ago with a small amount of his own savings, and little by little the business has grown. With the income it generates, Pablo has funded the education of his children, the last of whom recently entered the university. He attends to the kiosk in a warm and friendly manner, since his main contact is with children. His younger daughter helps him attend to the kiosk. He saves the maximum amount of money that he can from the sales of the kiosk in order to reinvest in the business. Pablo's dream for the future is to have a better income, and in this way be able to provide a good education for his youngest daughter. He requests this loan in order to make improvements to his home, which was affected by the earthquake.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: housing improvements

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia L. is from the village of Miaray in Dangcagan, Bukidnon. Lilia is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Lilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19000 PHP from HSPFI. She used her previous loan to expand her business. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 22000 PHP that will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be Lilia's 14th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying cloth

loans.name: Waldo

texts.es: Waldo tiene 47 años de edad, es casado pero actualmente esta separado de su esposa; el tiene dos hijos de 18 y 16 años, los cuales no dependen de él ya que ellos trabajan. Cuenta con casa propia. Waldo se dedica a prestar sus servicios de chofer de buses, se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo atrás, trabaja con diferentes empresas. El nivel de competencia es alto ya que hay varias personas que se dedican a esta actividad, pero también la demanda por este servicio es alta también. El destino es para refacción de vivienda, por las lluvias una parte de su cocina se vio afectada, por lo que desea refaccionar dicha parte. Éste es el tercer crédito al que accede Waldo, demostrando un excelente comportamiento en nuestra institución y en el sistema financiero, ya que no cuenta con antecedentes negativos. SE HACE NOTAR que si bien hay una persona más en la fotografía. la misma no tiene ninguna relación con Waldo, simplemente es una pasajera que tomo los servicios de Waldo.
texts.en:
Waldo is 47 years old, he is married but actually he is separated from his wife. He has two children ages 18 and 16, they both work and don't depend on him. He has his own house. Waldo lends his services as a bus driver, he has been in this business for a long time, he works with different businesses. The level of competition his high, there are various people dedicated to this activity, but the demand for this kind of service is high as well. This credit is destined to be used for housing renovation, because of the rains a part of his kitchen was affected and this is what he wishes to repair. This is the third credit for Waldo, demonstrating an excellent behavior with Fundacion Agrocapital and in the financial system and he doesn't have a negative background. It is important to note, there are more than one person in the photograph. They do not have any relation to Waldo, they are simply passengers that use Waldo's services.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of home

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 32 años, por el momento vive sólo, sus padres murieron hace varios años. En busca de comodidad, él mismo construyó su casa a base de madera, ubicada en una zona de selva.

Perder a sus padres le afectó duramente, pero esta circunstancia le sirvió para valerse por sí mismo. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a cultivar yuca, plátanos y café en sus terrenos propios, donde labora con la ayuda de operarios, a quienes contrata para preparar sus terrenos para la siembra y la cosecha.
Lo que más le gusta a Jaime de su actividad es mantener limpios sus terrenos, pues así asegura que sus productos sean de buena calidad y le resulten muy rentables. Con estas ganancias puede adquirir más bienes e inclusive está ampliando su pequeña casa, también está ahorrando para cuando tenga su propia familia no les haga faltar nada. Para más adelante planea comprar más terrenos agrícolas donde siembre maíz en grandes cantidades, asimismo desea convertirse en un exitoso comerciante de frutas y otros productos comestibles.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, en su banco comunal se siente bien y gracias a las charlas educativas que recibe de su asesor de crédito ha podido invertir adecuadamente el dinero. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará decenas de plantas de frutas cítricas, además preparará los terrenos que recientemente adquirió para sembrar maíz.
texts.en:
Jaime is 32 years old and, for the moment, he lives alone. Several years ago, his parents passed away. In search of comfort, he himself built a house out of wood, located in a forested area. Losing his parents affected him greatly, but these circumstances helped him to be able to manage life on his own. For the last 10 years he has made a living by cultivating yuca, plantains, and coffee on his own land, where he labors with the help of workers who he contracts to prepare his land for planting and the harvest. The thing that Jaime likes the most about this activity is keeping his land clean, thereby assuring that his products will be of good quality and very profitable. With these earnings he can acquire more property and expand his small house. Also, he is saving money for when he has a family so that they will not be lacking anything. Further down the road, he plans to buy more agricultural land to plant corn in large quantities. Likewise, he wishes to become a successful merchant of fruits and other edible products. This is his third loan with MFP. He feels well about his communal bank, and thanks to the educational talks that he received from his credit advisor, he has been able to adequately invest the money. With the money that he is currently requesting, he will purchase dozens of citric fruit plants, and will also prepare his recently acquired lands to plant corn.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit plants

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy C. is a villager who lives in Chrouy Dang village in the Kandal province. Mrs. Thy C. and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land and cultivate rice to earn a living for their family. On this farm, they do not have enough money to support their farming crops. Thus, Mrs. Thy C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. 

Mrs. Thy C. is 40 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory, three are attending the local school, while the youngest one is 5 years old. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladys L. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo, el señor Rogelio Conde y sus tres hijos. La señora Gladys es empleada en una carnicería y su esposo trabaja en una mina que se encuentra en el departamento de La Paz.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de una habitación ya que sus hijos crecen y necesitan espacio.
Esta es la séptima ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Gladys L. lives in her parents’ house in the Pasankeri region of the city of La Paz. She lives with her husband, Rogelio Conde, and their three children. Gladys works in a butcher shop. Her husband works in a mine that is located in the La Paz department. The requested loan is to fix up a room because her children are growing and need space. This is the seventh time she has asked for a loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of fixing up a room for her childrenn

loans.name: Nasirullo

texts.en:
Nasirullo is 48 years old and lives with his wife and three children. This man has been a farmer for more than 5 years. Together with his family he grows diverse products such as cucumbers, onions, wheat, barley and other vegetables. What pleases him is sowing his diverse crops as it is profitable to invest in a variety of vegetables and sell his harvest monthly, according to market demand. But the most tedious part is having to clear his land and take care of his crops day after day. This is his first loan with IMON International and he is promising to repay the loan ion time, not letting down anyone. Nasirullo will invest the money in purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. 

 More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto tiene 33 años, su actividad económica es la  elaboración y venta de juegos pirotécnicos. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar sus ingresos, pues desde muy joven ha tenido que trabajar para su 4 hijos que estaban a su cargo el se preocupaba por proporcionarle lo más necesario. Por lo que es muy popular por ofrecer este tipo de producto y además por tener un gran carisma. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima. El desea continuar con esta actividad y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto, 33, makes and sells fireworks. He has been in this business for over 20 years. He is always striving to increase his income because he has had to work from a very young age to support his four children that were under his care; he wanted to provide them with all they needed. He is very popular because he offers this service and because he has great charisma. He is asking for funding to buy raw materials. He wants to continue with this activity and succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fireworks raw materials.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Roxana, ella tiene 28 años de edad, la socia es madre soltera con 2 menores hijos, ella se divorció de su esposo y es madre y padre para los menores, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura y la ganadería, la socia también cría animales menores tales como (cuyes, chanchos y aves de corral, gallinas, pollos, patos). Nuestra socia también elabora tejidos de a mano con figuras geométricas, la socia empezó a interesarse en este arte al ver que sus otras compañeras de bancos comunales lo hacían y lo llevaban a vender al mirador de Taray punto en el que diversos buses de turismo a diario hacen su parada para tomar fotos del valle sagrado de los inkas y ellas se acomodaron a los alrededores del mirador con todas sus artesanías y venden sus brazaletes a cuarto de dólar cada uno. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas, abono, y todo lo que respecta el sembrío de tierras de cultivos de papa y maíz.

Nuestra socia agradece a todos los inversionistas que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank, "Colquecancha." She lives in the community of Raqchi, which belongs to the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. Our member is señora Roxana. She is 28 and is the mother of 2 young children. She divorced from her husband and is both mother and father to her children. She alternates her activities at home with agriculture and raising livestock. She also raises small animals like guinea pigs; pigs; and poultry like hens, chickens, and ducks. She also makes weavings by hand with geometric figures. She became interested in art after seeing other what other members of communal banks were doing. They took what they made to sell at the viewpoint in Taray, a place where different tourist buses come every day to take pictures of the sacred valley of the Incas. The other members would go around the viewpoint selling their handmade items and would sell their bracelets for $0.25 each. Roxana is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, and everything that is involved in growing corn and potatoes. She is thankful to the investors that make it possible for her to realize this dream, and she promises to pay back her debt within the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, and everything involved in growing potatoes and corn.

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es: Zulema, de 39 años, vive en la casa de sus padres.Desde hace 4 años, se dedica a la preparación de pasteles  y queques que vende  a sus clientes fijos. Sus pasteles son elaborados con ingredientes de calidad que garantizan su buen sabor, y tienen mucha demanda, es por esta razón, que se siente muy satisfecha con las ganancias que obtiene. Sus ventas las realiza generalmente por las mañanas; y por las tardes se dedica a comprar los ingredientes que necesita. Este negocio le ha generado buenas ganancias económicas que necesitaba, y aunque una de sus dificultades era que no tiene un horno disponible, ya que arrienda uno de un familiar, seguirá trabajando para concretar su deseo de llegar a  tener su propio horno.Es la cuarta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además  agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Zulema tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de harina, y también adquirirá  otros  ingredientes, al por mayor,  que necesita para seguir preparando sus pasteles.
texts.en:
Zulema, 39, lives in her parents' home. For 4 years she has made cakes and queques [Peruvian cake with orange juice] which she sells to her regular customers. Her cakes are made with quality ingredients that guarantee a good flavour. She has a lot of demand, and so she is very satisfied with the earnings she obtains. She usually makes her sales in the mornings; and in the afternoons she buys the ingredients she needs. This business has generated her the good income that she needs, although one of her difficulties is not having an available oven, as she rents one from a family member. She will continue working to achieve her goal of having her own oven. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with the payment of her quotas. She also thanks everyone who is making this loan possible; it will be very useful in the progress of her business. Zuelma plans to invest the requested money in the purchase of flour, and she will also acquire other wholesale ingredients that she needs for her cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn M., age 51, lives in Voat Svay village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns  four hectares of land to cultivate rice and sweet potatoes for living. 

In order to support the farm, Mrs. Sorn M. decided to ask for a loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticide as well as to pay for a laborer to help plow her farm. She wants to use the rest of the loan to buy a cow for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Heang Em, is a motorcycle taxi driver who is able to earn a small additional income to support his family living. 

This couple has three children: one is a mirror smith, one is a construction worker, and the youngest attends the local school. Her husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for a laborer to help plow her farm

loans.name: Khaki Womens Association-Jinja Group

texts.en:
32-year-old K. Aisha began her now five-year-old tailoring business with savings from her fish selling business. She operates from her home and her customer base cuts across from community members to schools, interested in well-sewn uniforms. 

In her business, what has helped her find a niche in the market is the top rate quality of most of her designs. With the passage of time, she has seen her profits go up in the ascendant. It’s not only her splendid designs that have been her winning calling card. She is also a high spirited and hard working lady who always creates a pleasant and relaxed atmosphere around her clients. 

Her stable marital status has also in many respects contributed to the stability and growth of her business. Knowing that family is the foundation of society, she has laid special emphasis on the education of her three children. With a profit average of $31 per week, she has been able to make her ends meet. 

Aisha also sells lake shells as an additional source of income. She is now taking a long view with plans of opening up a retail shop and giving her children the best education possible in the future. With this loan she is fully focused on purchasing more clothing textiles and also more shells.

loans.use: Purchasing more clothing textiles and also more lake shells.

loans.name: Migdalia

texts.es:
En el barrio las colinas    Municipio de Somotillo la señora L. F. realiza su trabajo de venta de comida en un tramo ubicado en el mercado municipal de Somotillo.
Ella nos dice que el crédito será utilizado Compra de mercadería variada para su negocio de venta de comida.
Este es el segundo   crédito que nos solicita y nos dice que el primero la beneficiara a reparar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
In the “Las Colinas” (Hills) neighborhood of the Somotillo municipality, L. works selling food in a section of the municipal market of Somotillo. She told us that the loan will be used to purchase various merchandise for her food-selling business. This is the second loan that she has requested from us and she tells us that the first benefited her by allowing her to repair the home she lives in.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various merchandise for her food-selling business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz G. is from the village of San Jose, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 27 years old. Beatriz is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Beatriz raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Beatriz has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Beatriz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beatriz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Beatriz from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier S. J. es dueño de un tramo que está ubicado en el mercado periférico frente al Cementerio Oriental de Managua. Vende carne de res. 

Todos los días realiza la compra del ganado en pie en la subasta (bolsa ganadera), luego se traslada al matadero La Curva y posteriormente se dirige a su tramo a vender la carne, diariamente mata una res. 

Es casado padre de familia de dos niñas y un niño que adoptó al quedar huérfano de padre y madre. Tiene un año de tener el negocio.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier S. J. runs a stand located in the Peripheral Market, across from the Eastern Cemetery in Managua. He sells beef. Every day, he buys live cattle from the livestock auction center, and then he takes them to the La Curva slaughterhouse. Later, he goes to his market stand to sell the meat. He slaughters one beef cow each day. He is married and the father of two daughters, along with one son whom he adopted when he lost his father and mother and was left an orphan. He has operated the business for one year.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying live cattle in order to sell the beef

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen B. is a 33-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  General Store and Laundry Service businesses. She lives in Ampalaya, Brgy. Gun-ob, Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her general store and laundry service businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000. Carmen is now borrowing PHP 17,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 15th  loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. 

 Carmen aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

 About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Sra. Esperanza del Socorro L., se dedica la venta de electrodomésticos al crédito a los comerciantes del mercado la terminal, los cuales le realizan abonos diarios. Ella realizas sus compras en Managua 2 veces en el mes.

Ella realiza 3 recorridos de cobros en el día a sus clientes y se siente muy satisfecha con ceprodel porque ha logrado mantener estable su negocio.
texts.en:
Esperanza del Socorro L. sells domestic appliances on credit to merchants at the terminal market.  They make daily payments to her.  She buys her stock twice a month in Managua.

She makes three daily trips to visit her customers and is very happy with CEPRODEL because they have helped her maintain a stable business.

loans.use: Domestic appliances for resale

loans.name: Gladys Wanjiku

texts.en:
Gladys Wanjiku N. is married, and they have three children to support. Gladys has been in the health business for two years. She has a clinic that holds medicine and lab equipment. Gladys operates in a busy market in town.

Gladys joined KADET with the help of a credit officer, and she is servicing her first loan (she has never borrowed from any other MFI). With the loan she intends to add stocks of medicine and buy lab equipment for her office. With the extra profits, Gladys plans to send her children to a university; she also is hopeful that she can open a nursing home and take care of patients, as she believes she is enterprising.

loans.use: To increase stocks of medicine and buy lab equipment

loans.name: Amparo De Fátima

texts.es: La Sra. Amparo de Fátima G. C. es trabajadora Activa del Colegio Público Rodolfo Schear  el portillo desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene diez  años de trabajar para esta institución es casado actualmente tiene dos  niños en edad escolar. Ha tenido  nueve créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Amparo de Fátima G. C. works at the Colegio Público Rodolfo Schear as a primary school teacher. She's worked at this school for ten years. She's currently married and has two young children. She's had nine loans with CEPRODEL and has used each one for the purchase of construction materials in order to expand and improve her house. These loans with CEPRODEL have helped her greatly in improving the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials such as sand, cement, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Judith

texts.fr:
Judith  est vendeuse des ustensiles de cuisine qu’elle achetait dans les dépôts et magasins de poto-poto.

Le prêt passé a été très bénéfique pour elle, elle a eue un plus dans la manière d’exercer son commerce.
De 5000f 10000f par  jour, elle vendait maintenant 30000f à 40000f  jour apres le premier pret..

Femme de caractère, elle contrôle son activité jour après jour en se basant sur son journal de caisse. 
Le prochain prêt, va lui faciliter entre autre d’augmenter  le stock de sa marchandise et d’améliorer ses services au près de sa clientèle .
elle va faire venir sa marchandise de la chine ; de Dubaï, de Kinshasa, de Cotonou et même de Pointe-Noire afin de générer des bénéfices considérables.
Pour sa famille, elle se bat pour que les études de ses enfants marchent bien et dans peu de temps commencer a construire une maison pour ses enfants
texts.en:
Judith sells kitchen utensils which she buys in warehouses and stores of Poto-Poto [a neighborhood of Brazzaville]. The previous loan has been very helpful to her. She has been able to manage her business better. Her sales used to be between 5000 and 10,000 West African Francs per day, and after her first loan her daily receipts are now between 30, 000 and 40,000 per day.

A spirited woman, she  manages her business carefully, leaning over her receipts book day after day. The new loan will allow her, among other things, to expand her merchandise stock and provide a better service to her customers. She would like to export  goods from China, Dubai, Kinshasa, Cotonou and even from Pointe-Noire in order to be able to achieve significant revenues. She works very hard for the sake of her family,  to ensure that her children’s studies go well and, in the near future, to start building a  house for her children.

loans.use: Purchasing dishes, pots, glasses,  stemware and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Wazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Wazeeran comes from a small city called Khanewal in Pakistan. She has been living there in a  two-room brick house with her family for over 20 years. She is 38 years old, married to Q. S. who works in a tea processing factory for a reasonable income. 

Wazeeran supports her family by running a small grocery store adjacent to her home. From her shop, she fills the timely grocery needs of her customers. She is the mother of 2 sons and 3 daughters. Only her 2 younger children are able to attend school and other stay at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her grocery store business. With the loan, she will buy groceries in bulk quantity for increasing her sales and income. 

She started doing this business 15 years ago and she is very hopeful that a loan investment will bring her business to more profitable position.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She has established a good credit record in the previous loan year by paying her installments on time.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Wazeeran.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 28-year-old lady, married and with seven children who are in school.  She is a hard-working lady who does dairy farming for a living.  She has been running the business for over two years.  She is also employed in a hotel.  She aspires to be a well-known farmer in the future.  She has requested 20,000 Kes through 'Ikinu Genesis' group in Faulu Kenya so as to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Saul Alejandro

texts.es:
MICROEMPRESARIO: Saúl Alejandro D. O.


Desde muy niño, a partir de los 7 años, Saúl Alejandro D. O. ha sabido lo que es ganarse la vida gracias al trabajo. Fue criado por su abuela debido a que sus padres lo abandonaron cuando era muy pequeño, situación que le impidió estudiar, puesto que el trabajo era su prioridad para poder tener el sustento diario para su familia.

Desde hace 12 años, Saúl trabaja en el Sector de la Plaza  Minorista de Medellín vendiendo jugos, principalmente a los conductores del sector quienes reconocen la calidad de su producto. Para poder diversificar sus productos y para que su negocio pueda incrementar sus ventas, Saúl necesita un crédito que apoyará el mejoramiento de su negocio y que, por tanto, incidirá positivamente en su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Saúl es tener su casa propia y a través del crédito, que propiciará el crecimiento de su negocio, está convencido de que pronto lo podrá hacer realidad.
texts.en:
Small businessman:  Saúl Alejandro D. O.

Ever since he was seven years old Saúl Alejandro D. O. has known what is is to earn a living by working.  He was raised by his grandmother because his parents abandoned him when he was very little.  This situation kept him from getting an education. Work was his priority so that the family was able to have their daily bread. 

Saúl has been working twelve years selling juice in the Medellín Plaza Minorista sector.  He mainly sells to the drivers in the sector who recognize the quality of his product.  He is requesting a loan to be able to diversify his products so that he will be able to increase the sales in his business.

Saúl needs the loan to support the improvement to his business, which will positively influence his quality of life.

Saúl’s dream is to have his own house.  He is convinced that through the loan, which will increase his business, he will soon be able to make his dream come true.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Ian Maina

texts.en:
Ian, 56, is a hardworking man. He is supporting one child and they live in a place called Kabuku, in Limuru town, which is on the outskirts of Nairobi city. He sells charcoal and firewood which is used mainly for fuel by the locals of this area.

He has been running this business for 16 years and he finds it profitable. This is the fourth loan he has received from KADET and he intends to use it to buy more charcoal and firewood for sale so he can expand his business. He also plans to build a better shed from where he will sell the charcoal. 

If the loan improves his business, he hopes to supply the neighbouring schools and colleges with firewood and provide a good education for his child.

loans.use: to buy 50 bags of charcoal and to construct a shed or a stall for his business.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La Sra. Felicidad es una cliente antigua de la institución que ya fue  beneficiaria del  el crédito kiva, la clienta   ha mostrando responsabilidad   en los pagos de sus créditos, y por esta razón se  decidió otorgarle un nuevo  crédito.  Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de muebles lo refacciona y los vende a un precio mas alto, el puesto de venta  se  encuentra en la populosa  zona de la Ballivian (ubicada al norte de la ciudad de el alto), la señora se esfuerza por superarse ya que trabaja desde la madrugada hasta que se pone el sol, el esposo de la Sra. felicidad se dedica a la construcción de viviendas, quien de igual forma trabaja todo los días, con el dinero del crédito comprara muebles para luego venderlos a un buen precio, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Felicidad is a longtime client of Emprender and has been the beneficiary of a Kiva loan. She has demonstrated responsibility with her loan payments and for this reason is requesting a new loan. Felicidad engages in the purchase and sale of furniture that she repairs and sells at a higher price. Her vending post is located in the crowded area of Ballivian (which is located to the north of the city of El Alto). Sra. Felicidad strives to succeed by working from dawn until sunset. Her husband engages in home construction and works in the same manner every day.

The money from this loan will be used to buy furniture that she will sell later at a good price. She is grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: Purchase furniture (wardrobes, dining sets, used cabinets)

loans.name: Johannes

texts.fr: Monsieur Johannes  a  49 ans  et père  de 6 enfants. Il habite quartier Ahligo où il exerce son activité. Il  est meunier pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins  de ces  enfants.  Il a commencé en  1995 l’activité. Il a employé  une personne qui l’aide dans ces activités. Il  demande  un prêt  pour acheter une dynamo.
texts.en: Mr. Johannes is 49 years old and the father of six. He lives in the Ahligo district where he also works. He works as a miller in order to be able to support his children. He started this work in 1995. He employs one assistant. He requests a loan to purchase a generator.

loans.use: Purchasing a generator

loans.name: 'unity #2' Group

texts.en:
Hawa S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of two borrowers, called 'Unity #2'. She is 33 years old, married, and has two children who are between the ages of 16 and 14 years. She was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to financial constraints. She cares for two siblings.
 
For 5 years, she has been selling red oil in New Georgia Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 15,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 25,000LRD business loan to buy more gallons of red oil to resell.

She describes herself as a hard-working woman whose goals are to improve her business, build a house and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil to resell

loans.name: Jose Leoncio

texts.es:
Leoncio tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y no tiene hijos dependientes, vive en casa propia de material rústico. Cliente vive en el Caserío Capilla Santa Rosa, ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque. 

La actividad que realiza el cliente es la crianza y comercialización de animales, labor muy común en la zona rural de Lambayeque.
Leoncio también cuenta con una pequeña bodega donde vende jora (materia prima necesaria para elaborar chicha) y azúcar. Adicionalmente cliente trabaja en la agricultura y el jornal.


Leoncio quiere invertir en compra de alimento para animales y en compra de abarrotes para surtir su bodega, es por ello que ha creído conveniente adquirir un préstamo de 1300 soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 56 years old, married, and he doesn't have children who are still dependent. He in his own house made of rustic materials. He lives in the community of Capilla Santa Rosa, located 10 minutes from the city of Lambayeque. 

He raises and sells livestock, a very common occupation in the rural region of Lambayeque. 

Leoncio also has a small convenience store from where he sells jora (an ingredient necessary to make chicha) and sugar. Additionally he also works in agriculture and is a laborer.

Leoncio wants to invest in the purchase of feed for his livestock and to purchase groceries to supply his store. For this reason he has requested a loan of 1300 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Laîdou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Bekobougou, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers tels  les ustensiles de cuisine, les tubercules, de l’arachide et du bétail.                                                                                      
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.                                                                       MAGNE C. compte acheter des ustensiles de cuisine au marché de Dioïla le plus souvent. Elle effectue ses au village au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 18.000F CFA qui est utilisé généralement pour les dépenses familiales et particulièrement dans les dépenses personnelles.
texts.en:
The women of the Laïdou group are all married, average 38 years of age with four children, and all live in extended traditional families in the village of Bekobougou, in the sub-prefecture of Fana, in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They met through relatives, neighbors and friends. They trade in various products, such as kitchen utensils, tubers, peanuts and livestock. 

The women of the Laïdou group are on their second group loan.

Magne C. is planning to buy kitchen utensils mainly at the market in Dioïla. She sells her products for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 18,000 FCFA which will be used generally for family expenses and particularly for her personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: La señora Elva se dedica a la comercialización de juegos para niños y vende en los colegios de la ciudad;el crédito lo utilizará para refaccionar parte de su casa (necesita nueva pintura y arreglos interiores); su esposo es rentista jubilado; estas dos actividades son la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir los gastos familiares; vive en casa propia ubicada en al zona de Rió Seco de la ciudad de El Alto, es casada y tiene seis hijos.
texts.en:
Elva sells children’s toys at schools and in the city.  She will use the loan to repair part of her house (it needs new paint and some interior repairs).  Her husband is a pensioned retiree.  These two activities are their sources of income to meet family expenses.  

She lives in her own house located in El Alto’s Río Seco zone.  She’s married and has six children.

loans.use: to buy paint and do some interior home repairs.

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Khat K., 57, lives with her husband and four children in the Kampong Chhnang province. She works in a grocery store, typically making US$2.50 per day, while her husband earns less than US$1 per day. Her husband is a farmer, growing rice. This couple also is supported by four children, three of whom are garment factory workers and one is a construction worker. 

Khat K. would like to take out a loan of US$700 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. K. appears in the photograph with her son.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has an abaca (natural fiber) weaving business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving business. She has been in this business for 15 years. Adelina earns additional income from livestock and her sari-sari (variety) store.

Adelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her livestock business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Ivan Ernesto

texts.es:
Ivan Ernesto  tiene 23 años vive en la zona de las lomas en la casa de sus padres, de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con un taller de elaboración de calzados para niños con 3 años de experiencia en el rubro.
El cliente con el transcurso del tiempo ahorró dinero de donde con ese pequeño ahorro se hizó de un capital para la elaboración y venta de sus productos.
El destino del crédito esta destinado a capital de operación, compra de material de trabajo, con el dinero solicitado incrementará su mercadería y materiales, cueros, plantillas, hilos agujas y otros mas.
El cliente no tiene deudas en el sistema financiero, en cuanto a su experiencia quiere ampliar su negocio y su nivel de ingresos, cuenta con actitud de pago y emprendimiento en la administración del negocio.
texts.en:
23-year old Ivan Ernesto lives in the Las Lomas area of La Paz with his parents. For three years now he has been making children’s shoes in his workshop. Over time Ivan managed to save enough money to buy the materials and then sell his products. Now he is seeking a loan to buy more supplies such as leather, insoles, thread, needles etc. 

Ivan does not have any debts to repay. He wishes to expand his business and increase his income. He has a good attitude towards repaying the loan, and his business is well run.

loans.use: to buy materials for his shoe-making business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old single woman living with her parents and two siblings. She has almost five years of experience selling beauty products to local customers. She also provides her clients with beauty and hairdressing services. She works on a freelance basis. In parallel, she has been working for a local company since 2007. It’s very common in Lebanon to have multiple jobs in order to be able to handle the high costs of living. She has taken advantage of her first Kiva loan and has been a reliable client paying on time. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more beauty products and new hairdressing tools and supplies. In the future, she is willing to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products and hairdressing tools and supplies

loans.name: Rysbu

texts.en:
Rysbu is 50, married and has four children. She lives in the Kyrgyz southern city of Osh. Rysbu graduated from Pedagogical University and worked as a teacher at the local school. As it was difficult to cover all her household expenses on the low wage, and in order to find an additional means of subsistence for her family, Rysbu started her own business in reselling carpets. 

She worked hard and her activity started to bring permanent profit in the sum of 60.000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS) in a month, and the number of customers increased. 

But in June 2010, when violent clashes caused by a deposed political regime broke out in Osh city, Rysbu lost her business, which was robbed and looted. But Rysbu, being an optimistic and hardworking person, didn’t give up and decided to resume her lost business and continue activities. 

For this very reason, Rysbu is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her business. Despite the many difficulties along the way, Rysbu doesn’t look back and is ready to take a step forward to her future.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods.

loans.name: Muyassarkhan's Group

texts.en:
Muyassarkhan, 39, is the leader of this group. She resides in the small town of Aravan in the south of the republic. For the past 15 years, her daily routine has consisted of feeding and watering the cattle, taking it on high pastures to get sun and fresh air and then back to the shed. Cattle breeding is not Muyassarkhan's only activity; she has also graduated with a degree in medicine and has been working in this sphere for almost two decades. Since the monthly income of medical personnel is only 7,000 soms, Muyassarkhan attempted to find an additional source of income. She invested 5,000 soms of family savings to purchase her very first heads of cattle. She did her best to promote the business and soon, thanks to generated profits, she managed to make repairs to her house and expand her herd. Cattle breeding and resale take much time and energy and brings 4,000 soms monthly. Muyassarkhan has many plans for the future, including providing college education for three of her children and opening a grocery store and a small pharmacy.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman, age 25, works in the manufacture of glass windows, doors, and closets. He has operated his business since 2007 and has eight years of experience in this field. He has built up a good reputation over the years. He started working at the age of 17 in order to help his family to increase their income so as to cover their expenses. Ayman was lucky because his grandmother gave him the shop he's working in as a gift, so it belongs to him now and he does not need to pay rent, which helps in increasing his income. 

Ayman requested a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to buy new, upgraded machines and tools, since the ones he has currently are old and not suitable for today's designs and requests. In spite of this challenge, he manages to provide all requested work at a high standard.

This is Ayman's third cycle with Al Majmoua. He is a borrower in good standing, and his previous loans have had a positive effect on his family's social and financial situation. He and his wife have one child.

loans.use: to buy new, upgraded machines and tools for his business

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en:
Jumaa is a single man who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, he has operated a grocery business, selling by retail to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During the rainy season, the availability of green grocers is lower compared to the demand in the market. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing a boutique in the future.

With the KES30,000 loan, he wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Debora Angela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Empresarias Con Futuro se reúne cada 15 días en el Palmar en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual y con muchos atractivos turísticos.

Aquí vive la señora Debora, tiene 57 años  de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad pero aun vive con ella. Lleva en el Banco Comunal dos ciclos y le gusta porque en las reuniones se entretiene y se olvida de sus problemas con sus amigas del grupo.

Ella tiene un local en su casa en el cual se dedica a la venta de repuestos para bicicletas y artículos de ferretería. También se dedica a las bienes raíces pues se encarga de vender terrenos y viviendas en toda la ciudad de Manta por lo cual recibe buenas comisiones por las ventas realizadas.
