texts.fr: FIFAGBE POUCE est un groupement de seize personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement, Henriette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 58 ans et est mariée à un certain Albin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un est à leur charge. Henriette a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Henriette vit ensemble avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis une quinzaine d'année, Henriette vend des produits vivriers à son domicile. Henriette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la septième fois que Henriette et les autres membres du groupement FIFAGBE POUCE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Fifagbe Pouce is a group of 16 people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, who is called Henriette (and whose hand is raised in the photo), is 58 years old and married to a man called Albin. The couple has two children, who are both educated, and one remains in their care. Henriette left school at secondary level. She lives with her family, and she and her husband cover the various household expenses between them. For around 15 years Henriette has been selling fresh food products from her home. She gets her supplies from a Benin market. This is the seventh time that Henriette and the other members of the Fifagbe Pouce group have requested financial support from Alidé, so that they can boost their working capital and better respond to customer demand. The previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: to buy fresh food products.

loans.name: Maria  Santos

texts.es: MARÍA  SANTOS: Es una señora jovial de 51 años de edad, trabaja como  docente de educación primaria, desde hace más de 25 años. Está casada con 3 hijos en edad escolar. Desde hace 20 años habitan en una vivienda de tambo y madera, sin embargo se encuentra en mal estado. Solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: madera, clavos, zinc y cubrir los costos de mano de obra, debido a que con su salario con su salario no le ajusta para realizar la mejora. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto (cemento), ya que es de mayor durabilidad.

loans.use: para comprar materiales de construcción: madera, clavos, zinc y cubrir los costos de mano de obra

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy 4 sacks of potatoes, 5 packs of onions, 5 crates of tomatoes and varieties of fruits

loans.name: Toalua

texts.en: Toalua of Vaitele-m tai is a hard working lady and she knows that she cannot sit back and rely on her family members to support her. With the great assistance given to her by the SPBD she is now running her own business to support herself and her whole family. Every day is vital to Toalua so she has her barbecue stand running on everyday of the week. She earns three hundred tala daily and uses half of it for her shopping, fifty tala is used for family necessities and uses the hundred that is left for her loan repayments and for her personal savings.

loans.use: To purchase stand, mutton flaps, turkey tail, chicken,  soy sauce, plastic plates,   cements,  and timber.

loans.name: Héctor Conrado

texts.en:
Mr Hector is married and has 3 children (ages 15, 24, and 26). In the past, he worked in the outskirts of the San Juanito area in the state of Chihuahua. It has been a year now since his heart attack and his health has prohibited him from heavy labor. In order to sustain his family he decided to open his own business selling refreshments and cookies. He has since incorporated other products, and he has witnessed his business grow.

To improve his grocery shop, Hector requests a loan of $275 dollars. He will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, thus allowing him to offer better service to his clients and continue to grow his business. He intends to pay back this loan within 6-12 months. In your decision to support this family you are playing an important part in their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Héctor es casado y tiene tres hijos de 15, 24 y 26 años, antes él trabajaba en los aserraderos de la localidad de San Juanito en el estado de Chihuahua, pero hace un año tuvo un infarto al corazón y por salud le prohibieron labores pesadas, para poder sostener a su familia decidió abrir su propio negocio inició con la venta de refrescos y galletas, después fue incorporando otros productos y ha estado surtiendo mejor su negocio, ahora tiene un poco de todo.

Para mejorar su tienda de abarrotes, Héctor solicita un crédito por $275 dólares que utilizará en la compra de más mercancía que le permita ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y continuar creciendo, él se compromete a devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en la vida de esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Shohida

texts.en: Shohida is a young specialist who sews national dresses. She has a high education as a designer of women's garments. She has been a client of Micro Invest since 2003. Her business is to buy beautiful fabrics and sew dresses for the market. She has an agreement with several shops to sell her dresses in their shops. Shohida also takes orders from individuals for sewing modern garments for them. She is always trying her best to satisfy her clients. Today she has many constant clients. In the future, Shohida would like to hire one assistant to help her, and she needs extra capital to buy a sewing machine for this purpose. She is requesting 1200USD.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing machine

loans.name: Babek

texts.en:
Mr. Babek is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 40, married with three children, and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central plains area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Babek has a place in the local market of Saatli where he sells watermelons seasonally. The business is running well but needs to increase its daily turnover. That's why Babek has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a loan of US$ 500.

With this loan as business capital, Babek intends to increase his turnover and thus his income from selling so as to better provide the necessities of life for his three children.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Mrs. Nilda is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She is owner of a vegetable and fruit stand in the municipal market for over 12 years. She depends on her steady amount of clients who visit her in the market daily to purchase her products. She comments that this job has helped her husband to maintain family expenses; provide her children with a good education; and to finish and expand her house.

The loans that she was granted from Fundación Paraguaya allowed her to attain an operating capital so that she was able to purchase the products on sale and in greater quantities since prices vary constantly in this sector.

Her goal is to open a small convenience store at her house so that her children can manage and watch over. Hence, she is seeking a loan to purchase the necessary elements such as a freezer and merchandise such as tomatoes, onions, lettuce, oranges, apples, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nilda tiene 45 años está casada y tiene 3 hijos ella es propietaria de un puesto de venta de verduras y frutas en el mercado municipal ya hace más de 12 años. Cuenta con clientela fija que diariamente vienen al mercado a comprarle sus productos, ella comenta que con éste trabajo pudo ayudarle a su marido a mantener el gasto de la familia, dar una buena educación a sus hijos y así también pudo terminar y ampliar su casa. Los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya le permitió hacerse de un capital operativo y así poder comprar los productos que se encontraban en oferta y en cantidades importantes ya que los precios en éste rubro varían constantemente. Su objetivo es la abrir una despensa en su domicilio para que sus hijos puedan administrar y cuidar, para concretar éste proyecto tiene pensado solicitar un préstamo y así poder comprarle los elementos necesarios como la congeladora y las mercaderías como tomate, cebolla, lechuga, naranja, manzana, etc.

loans.use: Purchase tomatoes, onions, lettuce, oranges, apples, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business and to begin selling other fruits

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old.
She is a widow with five children. Currently, she wants to venture into the business of fruit vending. She would like to begin another business from the profits made.

loans.use: To buy a fridge so that she can make more fruit juice

loans.name: Teofila's Group

texts.en:
Jeanett, Juana, and Teofila have been part of the community bank “Magnolia” for almost one year. In that time they have learned how to manage their finances, to treat clients properly, to stay healthy, and to feed their children a balanced diet. Jeanett is 26 years old with a three year old daughter. Jeanett and her husband own a bakery where she makes fortified bread for the school breakfast program. She formerly worked in another bakery where she was able to learn about the business and eventually to open her own.

Juana is 28 years old with two children. Four months ago Juana was able to open her own stand where she sells vegetable in the Americas Market. In her free time, Juana also bakes and sells cookies.

Teofila is 47 years old and is married with four children. She buys various cheeses from different markets around the region of Ayacucho and for the past several years has been selling them around her neighborhood.

Jeanett, Juana, and Teofila need loans of 600, 400, and 200 soles (3 soles = $1) respectively, which they will use towards buying flour, butter, squash, onions, and cheeses. One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest that each woman will earn from her savings account. Jeanett, Juana, and Teofila plan to use their savings to pay their children’s school fees. They dream to own their land, continue developing their businesses, and that their children will become educated and successful. These loans could significantly help them towards reaching these dreams.

loans.use: Jeanett, Juana, and Teofila need loans of 600, 400, and 200 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying flour, butter, squash, onions, and cheeses.

loans.name: Kibuuka A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Aisha N.. She is currently in the business of livestock farming and is requesting a loan to increase her stock of goats. Aisha is 43 years old and is a widow. She has 1 child aged 23 who doesn’t go to school. Each week, Aisha makes approximately UGX 18000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater for her health. Aisha has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more goats and the loan was paid back on time.

Aisha is joined in her small group by Prossy N., Ritah N., Margret N., and Grace N.. Prossy N. has a tailoring business and wants to purchase a sewing machine. Ritah N. is currently operating a business selling fresh food and wants a loan to invest in her business. Margret N. operates a business selling snacks and wants to purchase glassed display shelves. Grace N. is currently in the business of cosmetic sales and is requesting a loan to add capital.

loans.use: To add capital and purchase more goats

loans.name: Benigno

texts.es:
Mr Benigno P. is 43 years old, single, and is a carpenter. He has worked for several years in large furniture stores and has gained a lot of experience. He has worked for several years in the ACHON furniture factory, one of the most widely recognised in our country.

With such experience, and a good amount of savings, Benigno has decided to set up his own carpentry workshop. Benigno exclusively produces carved beds and, luckily, business is thriving.

The loan which he is requesting is to diversify the products which he makes, as he wants to start manufacturing wardrobes, bedside tables amongst other things.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Benino P. de 43 años, es soltero, y se dedica a la carpintería. Trabajo varios años en grandes mueblerías del país, y fue así que adquirió mucha experiencia. Trabajo por varios años en la fabrica de muebles ACHON, una de las mas reconocidas de nuestro país.

Con basta experiencia y buen dinero ahorrado, Benino se decidió a montar su propio taller de carpintería. Don Benigno se dedica exclusivamente en fabricar camas torneadas y gracias a Dios le va bastante bien en el negocio.

El crédito que solicita es para diversificar el producto que fabrica, pues desea empezar a fabricar también roperos, mesitas, entre otros.

loans.use: Para la compra de madera

loans.name: Khanlar

texts.en:
Khanlar S. is a 49-year-old married father of two living in the Imishli region of Azerbaijan. For the past 14 years, he has earned a living for his family by milking cows and selling dairy products.

To expand his business and better support his family's needs, Khanlar has applied for a loan of $1,200 U.S. dollars to purchase three calves. He wants to start breeding cattle for meat. Beef is a main staple of the regional diet, so Khanlar is certain that he'll be able repay the loan and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: Going to purchase three calves

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Segundina, along with of her spouse, has been dedicated to brick manufacture insiD. their humble home for many years. Now that their age has diminished their strength, they work on a smaller scale. For this reason Segundina has decided to focus on the care of baby animals, to sell them in her community's fairs to obtain earnings to benefit her household.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Segundina, en compañía D. su esposo por muchos años se ha dedicado a la fabricación D. ladrillos dentro D. su humilD. hogar, ahora que los años han disminuido sus fuerzas se dedican a esta labor en menor escala. Por esa razón Segundina, ha decidido ocuparse D. la crianza D. animales pequeños para ofertarlos en las ferias D. su comunidad y así obtener ganancias en beneficio D. su hogar.

loans.use: Capital to acquire more baby animals and to improve sales

loans.name: Verita

texts.es:
Verita is a member of the community bank Las Divinas, located in Jr Pucallpa 655 in the Calleria district of the region of Ucayali in Peru. She is 33 years old and the mother of 3 children. Her husband is a shopkeeper but his income is too low to meet the family's economic needs. For this reason, Verita decided to start a food sales business with the first loan she received from Manuel Ramos, for 300 soles (Peruvian currency).

She works in her business in the evenings from her own home. She rises at 7 AM to prepare breakfast for her husband and children. Later she works preparing the meals she will sell from 5 PM until 10 PM.

With this loan of 1500 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy ingredients for the preparation of her meals along with materials to add atmosphere to her place of business.

Verita is a very hardworking woman. She is moving her family ahead with her work with effort and humility.She has returned to Manuela Ramos for a second loan as a woman visibly committed to growing her successful business and continuing to move her family ahead. She appreciates all the support that Manuela Ramos provides to her.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Verita pertenece al banco comunal Las Divinas, ubicado en el Jr Pucallpa 655, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, pero los ingresos económicos es muy bajo para sus necesidades familiares, es así que Verita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de comida.

Su actividad la desarrolla por las noches en su propia casa, para lo cual se levanta a las 7am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas para ponerlos a la venta desde la 5 pm hasta las 10 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, compro insumos para la preparación de sus comidas y materiales para ambientar su local.

Verita es una mujer muy trabajadora que saca a delante a su familia con su trabajo a base de esfuerzo y humildad, manifiesta que se ha vuelto una mujer que solo piensa en hacer crecer su negocio y ha salir adelante junto con su esposo y sus hijos, y agradece a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo que le brindan.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of ingredients and purchase of materials for her place of business.

loans.name: Ovenseri

texts.en: Ovenseri I. is a farmer. He is 42 years old and married with 5 children. He lives in Okohuo, Edo state, Nigeria. He plants corn on his farmland, and he has been farming for the past 15 years. He is a LAPO client. He needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to buy more seedlings for planting and also for maintaining his farmland.

loans.use: To buy more seedling for planting and for the maintenance of his farmland

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.es:
Mrs. Norma B. is a hardworking, middle-aged woman who works as a sales supervisor at a shopping center. Aside from that, she is a mother and a homemaker. She and her husband work long hours daily in order to put food on the table. She is requesting this loan in order to waterproof the roof of their house because the rain has damaged their furniture little by little. For this reason, they also want to plaster the dilapidated interior walls. Let’s help and support her!

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

NORMA LETICIA B. N. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

La señora Norma es una mujer de mediana edad y muy trabajadora, ella trabaja en un centro comercial como supervisora de ventas. Aparte de esto es madre de familia y ama de casa, su marido y ella trabajan dia con dia largas horas para llevar "comida a su mesa" ; ella esta solicitando este prestamo para impermeabilizar su techo ya que a causa de tanta lluvia se llueve y sus muebles se han ido dañando poco a poco, por ello tambien quiere disponer para enjarar con yeso su casa ya que se le ha caido en la parte interior. APOYEMOSLA Y AYUDEMOSLE!!!

loans.use: Roof waterproofing and plaster interior walls

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La Sra. María tiene 51 años y esta casada con el Sr. Oscar Vega, tienen 1 hija de 15 años que esta cursando el 9º año de la media. La Sra. María y el su marido el Sr. Oscar tienen una imprenta hace 15 años en San Lorenzo en donde hacen libretas para colegios, talonarios, recibos, etc.

Oscar, adquirió ésta profesión de su padre quien se dedico a esta actividad durante mucho tiempo del cual el aprendió mucho. La Sra. María anteriormente tenia una librería que tuvo que cerrar por que no tenia los ingresos necesarios para mantener el negocio, y se dedico de pleno a ayudar a su marido.

Gracias al esfuerzo de ambos pudieron terminar de construir su vivienda y actualmente solventar el gasto del estudio de su hijo. En el futuro tiene pensado abrir un local con varias maquinas para una mayor producción y venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and is married to Oscar Vega. They have a 15 year old daughter who is in 9th grade. Maria and her husband Oscar have had a printing press for 15 years in San Lorenzo. They make notebooks, receipt books, receipts, etc.

Oscar, acquired this profession from his father who dedicated himself to this business for a long time. Maria previously had a bookstore which she had to close because she did not have the necessary income to maintain the business so she now dedicates herself to helping her husband.

Thanks to both of their efforts they were able to finish building their home and pay for the expenses of their daughter’s education. In the future, they want to open a shop with various machines to increase production and sales of their products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a printing press.

loans.name: Karla Vanesa

texts.es:
La señora de nombre Karla Vanesa D. Sánchez quien tiene la edad de 27 años, el estado civil en que se encuentra es de acompañada tiene 4 hijos de nombre Yusbania Lizbeth Hernández que tiene 12 años y cursa el 1 año de secundaria, Sara Abigail Suazo que tiene 9 años y cursa el cuarto grado de primaria, Danilo José D. que cursa el sexto grado y Lázaro Josué D. quien tiene 2 años y no estudia, su conyugue trabaja con ella, las aspiraciones que ella tiene es poder lograr tener su propio tramo donde pueda vender sus productos sin tener que estar ofreciendo sus productos de forma ambulante. Otra de sus aspiraciones es poder brindarle a sus hijos estudios para que en un futuro se puedan defender como profesionales.

El tipo de negocio que tiene es la venta de bolsas plásticas y el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado la terminal de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de trabajar en este negocio es de 9 años la forma en como ella inicia fue desde niña ya que su mama tenia este negocio y las encamino con este negocio pero después su mama se enfermo y dejo de trabajar  por lo que ante tal situación decidió experimentar por sus propios medios y no dejar caer el negocio por lo que tomo la decisión de continuarlo con los mismos clientes que tenia su mama, sumándose los clientes que ella había obtenido y piensa que algún podría obtener su propio tramo con un buen inventario de mercadería, la forma en como ella piensa usar el fondo es comprando mas variedades de bolsas de todos los tamaños, esta será  la opción que ella tendrá para poder ofertar a sus clientes la variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Karla Vanesa D. Sánchez is 27 years old and has four children between the ages of 2 and 12. Their names are Yusbania Lizbeth Hernández, Sara Abigail Suazo, Danilo José D., and Lázaro Josué D.. Except for the youngest, they are all in school. She and her partner work together. One of her aspirations is to have her own stall where she can offer her products instead of selling her products as a street vendor. Another hope of hers is to be able to offer her children a good education so that in the future they can be self-supporting professionals. Karla’s business, which she has had for 9 years, is selling plastic bags in the market at the terminal. She took over the business that her mother had established when Karla was a little girl. When her mother became ill and could no longer work, Karla did not want to let the business fall so she decided to experiment with the situation. She continued selling to her mother’s customers and she also was able to add new clients. She thinks that some day she will be able to get her own vending stall with a good inventory. The way she plans to use her loan is to buy a greater variety of bags of all sizes to offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lai

texts.en: Mrs. Lai V. is 51 years old and she now lives in Lvea Sor Kandal village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Chea Savoeun, are farmers who own a piece of land.  They cultivate rice for a living. In this plantation, they face some problems because the field is infertile and they do not have rice seeds to support their field. Their field is also too far from the irrigation system. In order to deal these problems, Mrs. Lai V. requests a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and petrol pumping to support her field. She has three children, one of whom is a nurse while the others attend the local school.  Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds and petrol pumping to support her field.

loans.name: Shakeela M.ramzan Group

texts.en:
Shakeela Baji is a 42 year old lady who resides in a shrine city named Pakpattan, Pakistan.  She has been living in this city for the past 10 years.  

Her husband's name is M., and he has a tea stall in the community.  He has 6 years of experience in this business.  Shakeela Baji is a mother of eight children: six daughters and two sons.  Her first two daughters sew clothes and earn a profit.  The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. 

Shakeela baji also sews clothes and earns a profit.  She uses her profits to pay her children's school fees.  She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy materials (tea and sugar) for her husband’s tea stall. 

She is a group leader of a few more women.  Azra Bano Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.  Kosar Baji and Zainab Baji each want a loan to buy blankets to resell.  Sakina Baji and Sheedan Baji each want a loan to buy chairs and mirrors for their salon.  Munawar Baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business. 

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for a tea stall

loans.name: Betzabé

texts.es: Betzabé tiene 27 años y vive con su esposo. Desde hace más de 10 años trabaja de manera independiente en la venta de carteras y accesorios diversos de vestir, de acuerdo a la temporada. Reparte sus prendas a sus amistades más cercanas que trabajan de manera estable. Inició este negocio movida por la necesidad económica de cubrir sus necesidades, como los gastos de su hijo que está por nacer. Es la quinta vez que Betzabé solicita un crédito con MFP, y ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. En esta ocasión, solicita este dinero para la compra de más mercadería para sus ventas de fin de año y año nuevo.
texts.en:
Betzabé is 27 years old and lives with her husband. For more than 10 years she has been working independently selling bags and various clothing accessories according to the season. She distributes her merchandise to her closest friends who have stable work. She began this business because of her economic need and in order to pay for her necessities, like the expenses of the birth of her son. It is the fifth time that Betzabé has requested a loan with MFP, an affiliate of Kiva, and she has demonstrated that she is punctual in her payments. On this occasion, she requests a loan in order to purchase more merchandise for her year end sales and the new year.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de su mercadería

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice T. is 46 years old. She is married and has six children - three sons and three daughters. Her two youngest children are still in school: one is in the senior high, and the other - in the junior high school. The other ones have completed junior high school, but have not been able to continue. They are currently learning trades - hair dressing, dressmaking, etc. Alice's family lives in a rented apartment in a small town called Koforidua in the Ashanti Region. Her husband is a teacher at a local government-run school, while Alice herself works as a maize and banana trader. She buys the produce from farmers in the nearby villages and sells it to retailers in her community. She also prepares a dish made of ripe banana and roasted groundnut and sells it by the roadside. Alice has been in this business for seven years, and now needs a loan to buy maize and banana in bulk. She hopes to thereby increase her business profit and be able to better support her husband in paying for the construction of a house for their family and for the further schooling of their youngest two children.

loans.use: Purchase of banana and maize

loans.name: Toki

texts.en: Toki I., 46 years old and married with four children, sells spare motor  parts, and his wife owns a restaurant.  He is requesting the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more spare motor parts to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more spare motor parts to sell.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es: Eulogia tiene 51 años, vive sola en su propia casa. Hace 20 años realiza viajes para vender productos alimenticios típicos de su zona (quesos y truchas) para llevarlos a otra ciudad. Viaja sola todos los fines de semana para llevar en sus baldes herméticos estos productos a los principales mercados de la ciudad capital y luego venderlos de manera ambulante. Trabajar de esta manera le permite a Eulogia tener los ingresos económicos para su sustento, y siempre obtiene las ganancias que ha planificado para la semana. Para el futuro desea tener en su casa una tienda de abarrotes y establecerse en su localidad con la venta de los alimentos. Es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es considerada como persona de confianza en el tema de los créditos y le gusta ser parte de un trabajo solidario en su banco comunal. Eulogia solicita esta cantidad de dinero para invertirlo en la compra de más productos alimenticios para potenciar su capital de trabajo, de esta manera tendrá más ganancias.
texts.en:
Eulogia is 51 years old and lives alone in her own home. For 20 years she has been travelling to other cities to sell foods typical of her region (cheeses and trout). She travels alone every weekend to the capital city with her products in airtight containers, so she can sell them in the main markets. Working this way permits Eulogia to have the income to support herself, and she always manages to earn what she expected to get through the week. In the future she wants to have a grocery store in her house, and establish herself in her neighborhood with grocery sales.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP, and she is considered a very trustworthy woman in regards to loans, and she likes to be part of the work in solidarity of her communal bank. Eulogia asks for this amount of money to invest it in the purchase of more products to improve her working capital, and this way will earn more.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise to sell

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle F. is a 47 year-old mother of four. Her husband Angel is a fisherman. The family live in a village along the sea of San Jose, Antique, the capital town of the province. Her present business is a variety store, established using her previous loans from ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.). The income from her store and her monthly honorarium for being a councilor in the village are not enough to support the needs of her family, especially the education expenses of her two children in college and one in high school. 

Mergelyn, her eldest daughter, helped her in managing their grocery store. She applied for this loan to buy a brand new motorized fishing boat for her husband. She hopes that through her proposed business she will be able to sell a large volume of fish, enabling her to save for the expansion of her venture. She dreams of expanding her fishing boat in the future. She also wants to save money for the education of her children and to improve their house.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorized fishing boat

loans.name: Noel Anselmo

texts.es:
El Señor Noel Anselmo Juárez Días tiene la edad de 66 años, su estado civil es casado. 
Don Anselmo tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Don Anselmo es transporte de carga. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que anteriormente no tenía trabajo y la su único medio de supervivencia. Los propósitos de Don Anselmo son de ofrecer los mejores servicios con su negocio. Ya que su edad es muy difícil encontrar otro trabajo es por eso que solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para comprar repuestos de llantas para su camión, luces y algunas mejoras. Es por esto que el sueño de Anselmo es obtener las suficientes ganancias para dejar de trabajar ya que a su edad es muy difícil encontrar otro trabajo.
texts.en:
Noel Anselmo Juárez Días, 66, is married and has 4 children who all work. Anselmo transports cargo, and he has been doing this for 15 years. Before that he did not have work, and it is the only way he can survive. In his business he wants to offer the best services. At his age it is difficult to find other work. That is why he is asking for a loan for working capital to buy replacement tires for his truck, lights and other improvements. For this reason his dream is to get enough financing so that he will not have to find other work. At his age it is hard to find another job.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: N’Towosso

texts.fr: N’towosso A. est une femme de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. elle est revendeuse de poissons et légumes au marché d’Avetonou. N’towosso  détient cette activité depuis des années et arrive difficilement à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Elle désire avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son commerce afin d’augmenter ses recettes pour mieux satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants. dans la vue, Ntowosso est celle assise derrière l’étalage.
texts.en:
N'towosso A. is a 49-year-old woman who is married and has 5 children. She is a retailer of fish and vegetables at the market in Avetonou. N'towosso has had this business for many years and finds it difficult to provide for her family. With this loan, she would like to enlarge the size of her business in order to increase her sales so that she can better satisfy the needs of her children. In the photo, N'towosso is the woman seated behind the display.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Ysuf

texts.ru: Юсуф Чомадов проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 43 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Юсуф более 10 лет занимается земледелием. Он сеет урожай риса,  часть продает, а часть оставляет для семьи. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить удобрения для земли. Клиент после применения удобрений может получить хороший урожай, который покроит его расходы, т.к. он планирует продать часть своего урожая населению.
texts.en:
Yusuf J. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 43 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Yusuf has worked in agriculture for more than 10 years. He plants rice and sells part of it and keeps part of it for his family. The client is asking us for credit in order to purchase fertilizer for his land. The client will be able to get a good harvest after using fertilizer, which will cover his expenses, because he plans to sell part of his harvest to the local population.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 54 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus 2 hijas quienes también son madres solteras y la apoyan mucho. Hace 10 años se dedicaba a la venta de pescado en un puesto del mercado de su localidad y gracias a la buena relación que tenía con sus clientes, uno de ellos la contactó con los dueños (norteamericanos) de una planta llamada Inguirilla, donde desde hace 2 años empezó a trabajar. Pero para incrementar sus ganancias, vienen vendiendo gaseosas a todos sus compañeros de trabajo y le va muy bien. Lo bueno es que cuenta con el apoyo de sus jefes que le permiten realizar su negocio, sin descuidar su trabajo y le es muy rentable porque vende diariamente gran cantidad. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos son comprensibles, unidos y muy solidarios. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más gaseosas y con otra parte mandará a reparar algunas imperfecciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Irma is 54 years old and is the single mother of two daughters, who she lives with. Her daughters are also single mothers and are very supportive of her. For the past ten years, Irma had been selling fish from a stand at the local market. She had a very good relationship with her clients, and one of them put her in touch with the American owners of the Inguirilla plant, where she started working two years ago. In order to supplement her earnings, she also sells sodas to her coworkers, which is going very well for her. Her bosses let her carry out this business without any trouble as long as she doesn't neglect her work duties. This is very profitable for her, because she sells a large number of sodas each day. This is Irma's fifth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. Her favorite part of village bank membership is that her fellow group members are understanding, united, and show great solidarity amongst themselves. With the requested loan, Irma will buy more sodas and will also pay for some home repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sodas, pay for home repairs

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy D. is from the village of Panay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married and has four school-aged children. Nancy owns and operates a sari-sari or general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Nancy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona tiene 50 años, desde muy joven se preocupó por salir adelante en la vida, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio son los metales, en su taller los moldea y los convierte en diversas estructuras, como carretillas, escritorios, sillas, etc, también aprovecha para arreglar cosas malogradas, lo que le genera un ingreso extra. Actualmente trabaja con un ayudante, quien realiza todos los trabajos de mayor esfuerzo físico. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es arreglar las cosas malogradas que le traen, ya que aunque es mujer arregla muy bien los artefactos, lleva 15 años en esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que conseguir los metales para moldear, ya que transportarlos le resulta muy pesado y cansado. Para el futuro espera hacer crecer su negocio y convertirlo en uno de los principales de la ciudad. Este es el tercer préstamo de Simona con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los demás. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos materiales para la fabricación de estructuras metálicas y el arreglo de artefactos malogrados.
texts.en:
Simona is 50-years-old, and since she was very young, she has been concerned with getting ahead in life. She lives in her own house, and what she wants the most is to improve her quality of life. She has a business doing metal work. In her workshop, she molds the metal and coverts it into diverse forms like wheelbarrows, desks, chairs, etc. She also repairs broken things to generate extra income. She currently works with an assistant, who does the work that requires more physical effort. What she likes the most about her job is fixing broken things that people bring her because she fixes them very well even though she is a woman. She has done this work for 15 years, and the thing that she likes the least is having to obtain metals to mold because transporting them is hard and tiring. This is Simona's third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and just like with her other loans, she is willing to make all of her payments on time. She is very loved in her communal bank because she always worries about others' well-being. With this loan of 2,000 PEN that she is requesting, she will buy new materials to make metal items and to fix broken items.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for her workshop.

loans.name: Nirian

texts.es:
La señora Nirian, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Optimistas”, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 47 años y 06 hijos, 02 que aun estudian y dependen de ella. 

Deseando ver profesional a sus hijos y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que en su vida paso por altas y bajas, su carácter emprendedor que siempre la caracterizo, le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas prepararas. Nirian, vende sus comidas en la carretera marginal, en un local acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que son choferes, pasajeros, alumnos y por su buena sazón sus ventas le van muy bien,  los vende en las mañanas y en las tardes.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Nirian, se siente con muchas fuerzas todavía para seguir con sus ventas de comidas, posteriormente desea implementar mas su negocio con un Restaurant bien acondicionado para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Nirian belongs to the Mujeres Optimistas Community Bank in the San Hilarión district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She is 47, single, and has six children. Two of her children still go to school and are dependent upon her. Wanting to see her children become professionals with their own incomes, she decided to start her own business to make that happen. She has passed through highs and lows in her life. Her entrepreneurial character, which has always characterized her, served her to start her own business of selling prepared food. Nirian sells food in the Carretera Marginal in a spot well suited to waiting on her customers. Little by little she has become well known among her customers, who are drivers, passengers, and students, for her good seasonings. Her sales are going very well. She sells in the mornings and afternoons. With this loan for 1,200 PEN she will buy supplies for her prepared food like sacks of rice and sugar, crates of chickens and eggs, bunches of bananas, noodles, and oils by the dozen. She will also buy kitchen utensils to offer quality service. Nirian feels she has lots of strength to continue with her food sales. Later, she would like to further set up her business with a well equipped restaurant to offer her customers better service and attention. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to prepare her food

loans.name: Colette

texts.en: Colette has owned a beauty shop selling makeup and beauty products since 2002. She is a 42-year-old woman living with her parents. In order to develop her business and attract more clients, Colette is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase additional merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Walter Agustín

texts.es:
Walter es casado, tiene 54 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y una de sus tres hijos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado 5 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Tiene 20 años trabajando como transportista, eventualmente alquilaba vehículos para ganarse el sustento familiar, luego pudo comprarse un auto en el año 2006, actualmente utiliza este vehículo como herramienta de trabajo, está asociado a una empresa de taxis que brinda sus servicios a los clientes del centro comercial más grande de la ciudad.

Este es su segundo préstamo con Edpyme Alternativa, el primero lo utilizó para cambiar el sistema de su auto y empezar a usar gas combustible, ahora se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 1600 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el mantenimiento de su unidad móvil, ya que, debido al continuo uso, está empezando a sufrir diversas fallas mecánicas en el motor.

El planea crear un pequeño negocio de alquiler y venta de prendas de vestir para seguir ayudando a la hija con la que viven a culminar sus estudios, además desean brindarle a su hijo mayor la oportunidad de culminar sus estudios superiores, los cuales interrumpió para irse a trabajar a Cuenca, Ecuador.

Walter es considerado como un cliente excelente por nuestra Institución ya que ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Walter is married, he is 54 years old and he lives together with his wife and one of their three children in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, located 5 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been working as a taxi driver for the past 20 years. He started out renting cars in order to earn the family income, but later in 2006 he was able to buy his own car. Currently he still uses that car to work. He is a member of a taxi company and he provides his services to clients in the largest shopping center in the city.

This is his second loan with Edpyme Alternative (Kiva Field Partner). The first loan was used to change the fuel system in his car to use natural gas. The loan he is currently requesting is in the amount of 1600 nuevos soles which he will invest in maintenance repairs for his car. Given the continuous use of his car it is starting to show several mechanical problems.

He also plans to set up a shop where he will sell clothing so that he can continue to support his daughter with her studies. They also wish to provide their eldest son with the opportunity to finish his post-secondary education. He interrupted his schooling because he needed to work in the city of Cuenca, Ecuador.

Walter is considered to be an excellent client because he has demonstrated great responsibility and timeliness with hsi payments.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the maintenance and repair of his car.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Mrs. Rom N. is a villager in Tuol Krang village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetable to earn for living. In her cultivate rice, she has a problem because she does does not have enough money to expand for cultivating. Thus, she decided to request for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticides, and to hire laborers to work on the field. She is 44 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To request for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticides, and to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es: La señora Maria Martha de 52 años de  edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casada y con tres hijos todos mayores y trabajan, sus planes es poder terminar de hacer las mejoras a su vivienda, su esposo se desempeña como abogado, ella es gerente de una tienda de productos de limpieza desde hace seis años, el cual comenzó como vendedora, lo cual se veneficio por que los ingresos son mejores, con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, cemento, arena, hierro y otros para hacer una oficina por que su esposo alquila en otro lugar para brindar sus servicios de abogado, y a ella le conviene que lo ponga en su casa de habitación para que ahorren dinero y hay mas cuido en nuestra casa. Agradece a la institución por los financiamientos que me ha dado ya que me han sido de mucho beneficios para hacer las mejoras en mi hogar.
texts.en:
Maria Martha is 52, and she lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is married, and she has three grown children who work. Her plans are to be able to finish making improvements on her house. Her husband works as a lawyer. She has worked for six years as the manager of a store selling cleaning products. She started as a seller. She has benefited because the earnings are better. With this loan she will buy construction materials like rocks, cement, sand, iron, and other things to make an office for her husband. He rents another place to provide his services as a lawyer. She sees that putting the office in their home will save them money, and their house is better kept. She is grateful to the institution for the loans they have given her. They have been very beneficial in improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build an office for her husband, a lawyer
